body: Boeing is now party to a new federal investigation involving a 737 Max 8 after United Airlines pilots reported that part of the flight controls became jammed as they landed in Newark last month. CNN’s Pete Muntean reports.

headline: Boeing in hot water after door plug panel flew off jet
body: NTSB rips Boeing for failing to produce key documents in door plug investigation. CNN’s Richard Quest breaks down the controversy.

headline: Want cheap airfare? This travel expert has one crucial tip
body: Travel expert Katy Nastro shares the golden rule of booking flights to get the cheapest rates in 2024.

headline: Airfare hasn’t been this cheap since 2009
body: In travel news this week: Why the cost of living is high but plane tickets are cheap, the best countries for expats in 2024, and the big-shot movie stars getting in trouble in the US and Europe.

headline: Dubai airport tops pre-Covid passenger levels
body: Dubai Airport could break its passenger numbers record this year after hitting 86.9 million in 2023

headline: Move over, Nvidia. Investors are obsessed with this AI stock you may never have heard of
body: Nvidia isn’t the only stock capturing the attention of AI enthusiasts these days.

headline: 'Is anybody else seeing this?': Woman spots plane dropping from the sky
body: CNN affiliate KING reports on a plane with it own parachute system that was used after the plane’s engine failed, saving the 2 passengers inside.

headline: UN World Restoration Flagships 2024
body: The UN has announced seven new World Restoration Flagships, recognizing the best large-scale, long-term ecosystem restoration projects.

headline: IBM's vision for the future of work
body: Justina Nixon-Saintil, IBM’s chief impact officer, discusses sustainability, global skill-building, and technology-driven solutions for a better work environment.

headline: Ethiopian to order up to 20 new Boeing aircraft
body: Ethiopian Airlines Group CEO Mesfin Tasew discusses his company’s new order as Boeing faces mounting regulatory woes.

headline: NTSB rips Boeing for failing to produce key door plug documents
body: Boeing has not turned over important records to investigators probing the door plug blowout on a 737 Max earlier this year, investigators say. That, Boeing signaled Wednesday afternoon, is because there are no records.

headline: Mitch McConnell releases statement endorsing Trump
body: Minority leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY) announced he will support Donald Trump for the presidency after McConnell blamed Trump for the attack on the US Capitol on January 6, 2021.

headline: 'I won't make it': Small plane crashes onto shoulder of Tennessee interstate
body: 5 people on board a small plane were killed after a it crashed into the shoulder of Nashville’s Interstate 40. The National Transportation Safety Board and Federal Aviation Administration are investigating.

headline: Search for MH370
body: Seabed exploration firm that conducted two searches for the missing airliner says it wants to try again. CNN’s Richard Quest reports.

headline: FAA finds ‘multiple instances’ of Boeing quality control issues
body: The Federal Aviation Administration has found multiple problems with Boeing’s production practices following a six-week audit of Boeing triggered by the January 5 door plug blowout on an Alaska Airlines’ 737 Max 9.

headline: AirAsia aims to merge long-haul and short-haul brands
body: Entrepreneur Tony Fernandes, the cofounder of AirAsia, speaks with CNN’s Richard Quest.

headline: Search for MH370 could restart, 10 years after the plane went missing
body: CNN Aviation Analyst Mary Schiavo says new evidence could help with the search.

headline: JetBlue pulls out of deal to buy Spirit Airlines
body: JetBlue Airways announced Monday it is pulling out of its deal to purchase Spirit Airlines.

headline: NASA/SpaceX Crew-8 blasts off
body: NASA’s Crew-8 is on their way to the International Space Station aboard a SpaceX Crew Dragon.

headline: March 2, 2024 - Israel-Hamas war
body: The US says it has made its first airdrop of humanitarian aid into Gaza. Aid groups have criticized the plan as ineffective while Israel continues to obstruct the bulk of deliveries.

headline: ‘I want to get off the plane.’ The passengers refusing to fly on Boeing’s 737 Max
body: The Boeing 737 Max is under scrutiny for safety flaws that have come to light following the Alaska Airlines incident. Polling suggests that the aircraft doesn’t enjoy full public confidence.

headline: March 1, 2024 - Israel-Hamas war
body: The US will airdrop humanitarian aid and supplies into Gaza “very soon,” President Joe Biden announced Friday.

headline: Boeing wants to buy back the company that builds the body of its troubled Max planes
body: Boeing said it is in talks to buy Spirit AeroSystems, a major supplier that was part of Boeing until a 2005 sale, and one that was also involved in the Alaska Airlines doorplug incident.

headline: The FAA flags more potential safety issues on Boeing’s 737 Max and 787 Dreamliner
body: The Federal Aviation Administration has flagged more safety issues for two troubled families of Boeing planes, the latest in a series of issues at the embattled aircraft maker.

headline: Boeing fined $51 million for violating Arms Export Control Act
body: Boeing has agreed to pay $51 million for violating exports controls of military technology, including employees in China downloading sensitive data from numerous defense aircraft and missiles.

headline: This crazy-looking plane might let us travel cross-country in half the time
body: Lockheed Martin has built a “quiet” supersonic plane for NASA that reduces the volume of sonic booms. They hope their design could open the door to supersonic air travel accessible to everyone.

headline: Dude, you’re not getting a Dell. So why is its stock soaring?
body: It’s not a good time to be selling PCs — Dell has been grappling with sinking demand for the past few years. But its stock still shot up 20% in after-hours trading after the company excited investors about the tech industry’s favorite buzzwords: artificial intelligence.

headline: Airplane safety has hit a new record. But these ‘critical phase’ challenges are still a problem
body: Last year had the lowest aviation fatality risk and “all accident” rate on record, says a new report, making 2023 the safest year on record by some measures.

headline: US Justice Department is investigating Boeing over its door plug blowout
body: The Justice Department is reviewing whether deficiencies found in the wake the door plug blowout on a 737 Max flight last month violate a deferred prosecution agreement that Boeing signed with the government three years ago following two Max fatal crashes, according to a person familiar with the investigation.

headline: February 28, 2024 - Israel-Hamas war
body: The US is considering the possibility of airdropping aid into Gaza, two US officials told CNN Wednesday.

headline: Dubai wants to build the biggest airport in the world. Here’s how that’s going
body: Al Maktoum International has already been open for 13 years, but Dubai Airports says it plans to transform it into the biggest, busiest airport in the world by far.

headline: Lusail Towers will be the tallest in Qatar
body: Designed by Foster + Partners, the four towers are part of a 1.1 million-square-meter project for the city of Lusail.

headline: In pictures: Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell
body: Mitch McConnell announced Wednesday that he will step down as Senate minority leader in November.

headline: FAA gives Boeing 90 days to come up with a plan to address quality issues
body: Boeing must produce within 90 days a plan to fix serious quality and safety issues, the Federal Aviation Administration said on Wednesday.

headline: New report slams safety culture at Boeing
body: Expert panel found Boeing culture included safety “gaps” and fear of retaliation, Pete Muntean explains.

headline: Ryanair CEO says Boeing delays could lead to fare hikes
body: Ryanair CEO Michael O’Leary says delays at Boeing may force his airline to raise ticket prices for this summer. Simon Calder, travel correspondent for The Independent, explains why.

headline: 'Buy Now, Pay Later' CEO says this generation is most financially responsible
body: “Buy now, pay later” services are increasingly popular as Americans rack up record debt and feel the pressure of inflation. Max Levchin, founder and CEO of Affirm, sat down with CNN’s Matt Egan to talk about how consumers are increasingly paying for things later.

headline: Aviation safety panel finds Boeing culture included safety ‘gaps,’ fear of retaliation
body: Some Boeing employees did not understand their role in safety and feared retaliation for raising safety-related concerns, a report by federal regulators found Monday.

headline: Warren Buffett: Berkshire’s boom days may be over as his company approaches $1 trillion in value
body: Berkshire Hathaway neared a $1 trillion market valuation Monday after a record-breaking year, but CEO Warren Buffett warned in his annual letter to investors that more skyrocketing performances are likely a thing of the past.

headline: Amazon officially joins the Dow Jones Industrial Average, booting out Walgreens
body: Amazon on Monday was officially added to Wall Street’s most venerable stock index, the Dow Jones Industrial Average.

headline: ‘Inexcusable.’ Ryanair says it may have to raise fares this summer because of Boeing
body: Ryanair may be forced to cut flights and raise fares in the peak summer season this year because crisis-hit Boeing can’t deliver the planes it promised.

headline: Nvidia brings AI fever to Wall Street
body: American chipmaker Nvidia’s market value topped 2 trillion dollars, in the process raising tensions between Washington and Beijing over semiconductor and AI technology. CNN’s Anna Stewart has more.

headline: Ukraine claims it shot down 'rare' Russian spy plane
body: The Ukrainian air force is claiming they shot down another Russian A-50 spy plane. CNN’s Jim Sciutto reports.

headline: Mercedes CEO: AI will have huge impact on auto industry
body: Mercedes-Benz CEO Ola Källenius speaks to CNN’s Anna Stewart about the way artificial intelligence is changing the automotive industry.

headline: The Airbus A340 airplane was built to rule long-haul travel. Now it’s vanishing from the skies
body: While the A380 superjumbo is enjoying a resurgence, its four-engined older sibling – the A340 – seems dangerously close to being grounded for good.

headline: Aircraft delays push back launch date for Qantas’ record-breaking ‘Project Sunrise’ flights
body: Travelers who were hoping to experience Qantas’ long-awaited, record-breaking ‘Project Sunrise’ flights next year will have to be a bit more patient. The airline has moved the launch date to 2026.

headline: Qantas reveals new A350 first and business class cabins
body: As Qantas gears up for the launch of its ultra long-haul "Project Sunrise" flights, the airline is offering a sneak peek of what passengers in the front section of the plane will experience on the 19-hour record-breaking journeys. (2023)

headline: Boeing replaces 737 Max unit head amid ongoing plane issues
body: According to an internal memo obtained by CNN, the head of Boeing’s 737 Max division has been replaced following last month’s door blowout incident on an Alaska Airlines flight. CNN’s Pete Muntean reports.

headline: United to resume non-stop service from US to Israel
body: United Airlines said it will resume flights from the United States to Israel beginning in March.

headline: Boeing removes head of 737 Max program in wake of safety incidents
body: Boeing removed executive Ed Clark, the head of its 737 Max passenger jet program, in the wake of several safety and quality-related incidents.

headline: Passengers: Man on plane tried to open emergency exit in flight
body: CNN’s Pete Muntean breaks down the scary moment in the skies.

headline: Tokyo startup Attuned is trying to use AI to motivate workers.
body: Julia Chatterley speaks to Casey Wahl, the CEO and founder of the human resources tech firm Attuned.

headline: Why Walmart is buying Vizio
body: Walmart is buying TV-maker Vizio for $2.3 billion in an effort to build its advertising business and rival Amazon.

headline: IATA chief "confident" on net zero aviation target
body: Airlines have been set a 2050 deadline to reach net zero. Industry leaders tell CNN’s Clare Sebastian the target can be hit.

headline: China’s homegrown passenger jet makes international debut
body: Beijing’s C919 airliner, a potential rival to Western-made Boeing and Airbus planes, made its first foray outside Chinese territory on Sunday by staging a flyby at the Singapore Airshow.

headline: The Alaska Air flight was terrifying. It could have been so much worse
body: There was a huge bang. A massive hole opened up in the side of the plane, minutes into a flight. Wind and noise filled the cabin, clothes and phones were ripped from passengers and hurled into the void. The metal of airplane seats twisted towards the opening. It was an extremely lucky day.

headline: Japan successfully launches flagship H3 rocket
body: Japan successfully launches its flagship H3 rocket following a failed attempt last year. Manisha Tank reports on what this means for the country’s space program.

headline: Trump unveils sneaker line. See what they look like
body: Former President Donald Trump unveiled in Philadelphia his newly launched sneaker line, “Trump Sneakers,” a day after he and his companies were ordered by a judge to pay nearly $355 million in his New York civil fraud trial.

headline: Neil deGrasse Tyson says he's skeptical about Russia using new weapon to attack satellites. Hear why
body: Astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson joins CNN’s Abby Phillip to discuss US intelligence that Russia is developing anti-satellite capability.

headline: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway sells off some Apple stock
body: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway sold off 10 million shares of Apple stock in the final three months of 2023, representing about 1% of its holdings in the company.

headline: Navy destroyer crew has only seconds to respond to incoming missiles. See them in action
body: The US Navy has been maintaining a visible and active presence in the Red Sea to protect international shipping from the constant threat of missiles and drones being launched by the Iran-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen. CNN’s Natasha Bertrand was aboard the USS Gravely on the front lines of this fight in the Red Sea, capturing how quickly the crews on these ships need to react in order to successfully shoot down an incoming missile.

headline: Video shows plane crash on Florida highway
body: Two people are dead after a small plane crashed near Naples, Florida. Before the crash, the pilot told an air traffic controller that both engines failed.

headline: Paramount Global to lay off 800 employees after record Super Bowl ad revenue and ratings
body: Paramount Global, the owner of broadcast and cable TV networks, announced Tuesday it will lay off hundreds of staffers as the media giant looks to reduce costs and grow revenue. The news comes just days after its CBS network saw record-breaking advertising sales and the highest-rated telecast for the Super Bowl.

headline: Boeing orders nearly frozen in wake of Alaska Air incident
body: Boeing, hit by quality concerns following the incident with a door plug blowout on a January 5 Alaska Airlines flight, had the worst month for new orders in January since the height of the pandemic.

headline: Carl Icahn buys a huge stake in JetBlue at bargain prices
body: JetBlue’s stock soared more than 14% in premarket trading Tuesday after financier Carl Icahn disclosed late Monday that he had taken a 9.9% stake in the company.

headline: Concerns over Israel's potential ground operation in Rafah
body: Retired U.S. Air Force Colonel, Cedric Leighton, joins Rosemary Church to discuss Israel’s potential ground offensive in Rafah.

headline: Airbus CEO speaks about rival Boeing's woes
body: Airbus CEO Guillaume Faury says the troubles with the Boeing 737 Max 9 are humbling.

headline: 2023: Airlines Association CEO on connecting a continent
body: At the 2023 Aerospace African Forum, Aaron Munetsi, CEO of the Airlines Association of Southern Africa, told CNN his hopes for the continent’s aerospace industry.

headline: Brands shell out big bucks for Super Bowl ads
body: Do the sky-high prices of Super Bowl ads pay off for companies? Michael Holmes speaks with Emory University marketing professor Jamie Turner to find out.

headline: IDF says it killed Hamas operatives in Rafah
body: Casualties following IDF airstrikes in Rafah, as Israel says they’ve discovered a Hamas tunnel running beneath UNRWA offices. CNN’s Nic Robertson reports.

headline: February 10, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
body: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has directed the military to prepare to evacuate over 1 million Palestinians from the southern Gaza city of Rafah ahead of a ground operation.

headline: Video captures plane on fire after deadly crash on Interstate 75
body: Dramatic video shows the aftermath of a small plane crash in Naples, Florida. The  aircraft crashed on Interstate 75. At least two people were killed, and three survived.

headline: Worried about how safe it is to fly? Here’s what the experts have to say
body: It’s already a bad year for aviation safety with a runway collision in Tokyo and a 737 Max 9 midair door plug blowout in the US. So is flying getting any riskier?

headline: February 9, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
body: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has directed the military to prepare to evacuate over 1 million Palestinians from the southern Gaza city of Rafah ahead of a ground operation.

headline: Maersk CEO on Red Sea disruptions
body: Maersk CEO Vincent Clerc says the global shipping giant has to guarantee the safety of its crews, even if it means prolonging trips by avoiding the Red Sea.

headline: India’s Gautam Adani rebounds from Hindenburg attack with return to the $100 billion club
body: One year ago, a spectacular David and Goliath battle shook corporate India when a tiny American firm took on one of the world’s richest infrastructure tycoons.

headline: Alibaba shares sink after it shelves IPO plans for two units
body: Shares in Alibaba sank as much as 7% in Hong Kong on Thursday, after the Chinese tech giant reported disappointing sales figures and announced it would suspend listings plans for two of its units.

headline: Another accident like Boeing’s door plug blowout could happen again, NTSB chair says
body: Jennifer Homendy, chair of the National Transportation Safety Board, says that the problem that resulted in a door plug blowing out of a Boeing 737 Max 9 jet minutes into a January 5 flight could happen again.

headline: Key bolts were missing from a Boeing door plug that blew out in mid-air, report says
body: Investigators from the National Transportation Safety Board on Tuesday said evidence shows four bolts that hold the door plug in place on the Boeing 737 Max 9 were missing at the time of last month’s blowout on Alaska Airlines flight 1282.

headline: World’s largest chipmaker TSMC to build a second factory in Japan
body: Chip giant Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) is upping its output in Japan as it continues to expand its global presence.

headline: Muntean shows example of bolt that was missing from door plug on Boeing plane
body: Investigators from the National Transportation Safety Board said evidence shows four bolts that hold the door plug in place on the Boeing 737 Max 9 were missing at the time of last month’s blowout on Alaska Airlines flight 1282.

headline: Boeing supplier swings to profit despite recent problems
body: Spirit AeroSystems, the troubled Boeing supplier which builds fuselages and other parts for the company, reported its first adjusted quarterly profit since the start of 2022, helped by increased payments from Boeing.

headline: February 5, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken arrived in Saudi Arabia on Monday, the first stop on his latest trip to the Middle East as the Biden administration seeks to advance an Israel-Hamas hostage deal, get more aid into Gaza and ensure the war doesn’t escalate into a wider regional conflict.

headline: Virgin Galactic grounded after a small part fell off vehicle during latest space tourism flight
body: Virgin Galactic said an issue on its sixth commercial mission at no time posed “a safety impact to the vehicles or the crew on board.”

headline: Tesla stock drops as investors scrutinize board’s close personal ties to Elon Musk
body: Tesla shares fell nearly 4% Monday after a Wall Street Journal report shed light on Elon Musk’s unusually close personal and financial ties with members of the carmaker’s board of directors, fueling concerns on Wall Street about a lack of real oversight on one of the world’s most powerful CEOs.

headline: New problem found on Boeing 737 Max planes
body: A new problem has been found during the production of 737 Max jets that will force Boeing to rework about 50 planes that have not yet been delivered.

headline: Boeing is in the ‘last chance saloon,’ says Emirates head
body: Tim Clark, the president of Emirates, has joined a chorus of airline executives in warning that Boeing is running out of time to restore its reputation following a series of safety and manufacturing blunders.

headline: Researchers capture image of what they believe is Amelia Earhart's missing plane
body: Using high-tech sonar equipment, a team of researchers captured an image from deep under the Pacific Ocean which they believe is Amelia Earhart’s plane that vanished in 1937. CNN’s Lynda Kinkade has more.

headline: See CENTCOM images of F-18 taking off from aircraft carrier
body: CENTCOM released images of US fighter jets taking off from an aircraft carrier and a tomahawk missile launch against Houthi rebels in Yemen.  CNN Pentagon correspondent Oren Liebermann explains.

headline: Jeff Bezos may cash out billions in Amazon stock this year
body: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos plans to sell up to 50 million shares of Amazon stock over the next year, according to a regulatory filing on Friday.

headline: Video shows remnants of plane after fiery crash at mobile home park
body: According to authorities, several people were killed after a small plane crashed into a mobile home park in Clearwater, Florida. CNN Omar Jimenez reports.

headline: 2023: IATA chief economist on sharing the costs of climate change
body: At the 2023 World Sustainability Symposium, International Air Transport Association chief economist Marie Owens Thomsen spoke to CNN about sharing the burden of responding to climate change.

headline: 2023: IATA chief on addressing aviation's climate impact
body: At the 2023 World Sustainability Symposium, International Air Transport Association director general Willie Walsh spoke to CNN about the industry’s climate commitment.

headline: The people who live inside airplanes
body: It’s the ultimate passion project for aviation fans: buying a plane and converting it into your own private home. Meet the people living the dream in their Boeing 727, McDonnell Douglas MD-80 and DC-9.

headline: Boeing was once known for safety and engineering. But critics say an emphasis on profits changed that
body: Part of the fuselage blowing off shortly after takeoff, leaving a gaping hole in the plane, and phones and clothing ripped away from terrified passengers. Investigations revealing sloppy work, including loose or missing bolts, instances of tools, trash and even empty tequila bottles left inside planes built for government clients. Worldwide groundings. Halts to deliveries due to quality issues.

headline: Save $300 on our favorite laptop, the MacBook Air M2, right now
body: Best Buy currently has the 15” Apple MacBook Air laptop on sale for $300 off.

headline: Putin claims Russian IL-76 downed by Patriot missile
body: Russian President Vladimir Putin claimed Wednesday that the IL-76 plane that crashed last week in the Belgorod region was shot down by a U.S. Patriot missile system and has called for an international investigation.

headline: Boeing CEO on 737 blowout: ‘We caused the problem’
body: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun said that Boeing is responsible for the incident of door plug blowing out of a 737 Max 9 in flight earlier this month, saying that Boeing must do a better job than it did in this instance.

headline: January 30, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
body: US President Joe Biden said he has decided on the US response to the drone strike that killed three service members in Jordan. Meantime, a powerful Iran-backed militia in Iraq announced the suspension of its operations against US forces.

headline: First Boeing 737 Max 9 flight since door plug incident lands safely
body: Lynda Kinkade speaks to travel industry expert Henry Harteveldt, who explains the measures that have been taken to get Boeing 737 Max 9 planes back in the air.

headline: US F-16 fighter crashes off South Korea in third loss of Korea-based jet in a year
body: A US Air Force F-16 fighter jet crashed after suffering an in-flight emergency off the coast of South Korea Wednesday in the third crash of one of the US military’s Korea-based warplanes in less than a year.

headline: Amazon's role in a pivotal moment in technology
body: Julia Chatterley speaks with Adam Selipsky, CEO of Amazon Web Services.

headline: Walmart’s stock is about to appear a whole lot cheaper
body: Have your eye on Walmart stock? You may be able to seemingly save money and maybe live better too in the coming weeks.

headline: January 29 2024 Israel-Hamas war
body: The US response to the drone attack in Jordan that killed and wounded US service members Sunday is likely to be more powerful than previous retaliatory strikes in Iraq and Syria, officials told CNN.

headline: Europe’s biggest airline has ‘a lot of confidence’ in Boeing chief David Calhoun
body: The CEO of Europe’s largest airline, who not so long ago described Boeing management as “headless chickens,” has come out in strong support of the beleaguered US planemaker, pushing back against criticism from several other carriers after this month’s mid-flight breakage on a Boeing aircraft.

headline: Toyota halts shipment of 10 models over diesel engine testing issues
body: Toyota said Monday it would suspend shipments of some models including the Hilux truck and Land Cruiser 300 SUV after finding irregularities in certification tests for diesel engines developed by its affiliate, Toyota Industries.

headline: January 28, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
body: Three American service members were killed in a drone attack on a US outpost in Jordan, marking the first time US troops have been killed by enemy fire in the Mideast since the beginning of the Gaza war. Follow for live updates.

headline: Electric air taxis may be our link to emission-free flying
body: An aerospace company in Munich is building an eVTOL jet it says can be a sustainable solution to regional flights.

headline: Russia releases video claiming to show Ukrainian POWs boarding doomed military transport
body: CNN cannot independently verify video Russia says shows Ukrainian POWs boarding a military plane that later crashed in the Belgorod region. Russian President Vladimir Putin says Ukraine shot the plane down. Kyiv is not saying if it fired at the plane or not.

headline: January 26, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
body: An oil tanker went up in flames in the Gulf of Aden after being hit by a Houthi missile. The Iran-backed Yemeni group claimed responsibility, saying the attack was in response to the “American-British aggression against our country” and in support of the Palestinian people.

headline: First Boeing 737 Max 9 with passengers flies after three-week grounding, Alaska Airlines COO sits next to door plug
body: Boeing’s 737 Max 9 model returned to service Friday afternoon when Alaska Airlines flight 1146 departed Seattle at approximately 3:51pm local time (6:51pm ET) bound for San Diego.

headline: Boeing planes to take flight after weeks of safety inspections
body: The Federal Aviation Administration gives the green light for Boeing’s 737 Max 9 passenger jets to fly again after an accident caused a door plug to blow out during an Alaska Airlines flight earlier this month.

headline: Boeing 737 Max 9’s: What travelers need to know
body: The Boeing 737 Max 9’s grounded several weeks ago will be back in the air soon after each passes inspection guidelines set by the FAA. Here’s what you need to know.

headline: U.S. officials move to allow Boeing's 737 Max 9 jets to return to the skies
body: Boeing’s CEO stops by Capitol Hill, hoping to reassure key senators that the company’s planes are safe, after an incident earlier this month in which the door panel of a 737 Max 9 blew off.CNN’s Pete Muntean has details of the meetings with U.S. lawmakers.

headline: Kyiv raising fresh doubts about Russian claim that Ukrainian servicemen were on plane that crashed
body: Isa Soares speaks with Global Affairs Analyst Michael Bociurkiw as questions swirl over what happened to the Russian military plane that crashed in Belgorod on Wednesday

headline: The 737 Max grounding will cost Alaska Airlines $150 million
body: The grounding of the 737 Max 9 after a January 5 incident that blew a hole in the side of an Alaska Airlines plane earlier this month will cost the airline about $150 million, Alaska announced Thursday.

headline: Russia calls UNSC meeting over plane crash
body: The United Nations Security Council is set to meet to discuss the possible causes of the crash of a Russian military plane in the Belgorod region as Ukraine launches its own investigation; CNN’s Fred Pleitgen has more.

headline: Before part of an Alaska Airlines plane blew off, Boeing had removed and adjusted it, reports say
body: Before the plane took its first flight, Boeing removed and reinstalled the part that blew off an Alaska Airlines flight on January 5, according to reports from the New York Times and the Seattle Times, both citing a person familiar with the matter.

headline: This company is driving some of the first Tesla Semi trucks. Here's what they're learning
body: PepsiCo operates about 21 Tesla all-electric Semi trucks as part of a pilot program towards their goal to be carbon neutral by 2040. Here’s what they’re learning.

headline: Moscow accuses Kyiv of downing military plane near Ukrainian border
body: CNN’s Rosemary Church talks to retired Australian Army Major General Mick Ryan about Moscow’s claims that Kyiv shot down a Russian military plane near the Ukrainian border, killing everyone on board.

headline: Russia accuses Ukraine of shooting down military plane
body: CNN’s Matthew Chance reports on conflicting stories from Ukraine and Russia surrounding a mysterious plane crash in Russia’s Belgorod region, killing all 74 onboard.

headline: China takes delivery of Boeing 737 Max in show of support for troubled plane maker
body: Boeing has delivered its first 737 Max to a Chinese airline for the first time in nearly five years, according to flight data, in a rare spot of good news for the embattled company.

headline: FAA approves a path for Boeing 737 Max 9s to return to operations
body: Boeing CEO David Calhoun’s Wednesday was decidedly a mixed bag: The Federal Aviation Administration finally approved a set of inspection criteria for the 171 grounded 737 Max 9 planes that, if followed, could return the aircraft to service. But he also learned that his company faces yet another investigation into its safety issues.

headline: Russian military plane crashes near Ukraine border
body: Russia accused Ukraine of downing a military plane near the Ukrainian border Wednesday, saying all 74 people on board were killed including dozens of Ukrainian service members being transported for a prisoner swap.

headline: Video shows Russian military plane crash near Ukrainian border
body: Russia accused Ukraine of downing a Russian military plane near the Ukrainian border Wednesday, saying all 74 people on board were killed including dozens of Ukrainian servicemen being transported for a prisoner swap.

headline: New type of semiconductor could transform electronics
body: Rafael Romo explains the breakthrough of the graphene semiconductor.

headline: Nose wheel comes off Delta Boeing 757 shortly before takeoff
body: A Boeing 757 plane lost its nose wheel shortly before taking off at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport, according to US aviation officials.

headline: 5 things to know for Jan. 24: Presidential race, Russia plane crash, Gaza, Tech industry, Oscars
body: CNN’s 5 Things brings you the news you need to know every morning.

headline: Hear recording of moment Boeing 757 loses a wheel minutes before takeoff
body: A Boeing 757 plane lost its nose wheel shortly before taking off at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport, according to US aviation officials. This comes as Boeing faces scrutiny over an Alaska Airlines flight losing a section of the plane midair.

headline: Alaska Airlines CEO says company found loose bolts on ‘many’ Boeing Max 9s
body: Alaska Airlines CEO Ben Minicucci revealed the carrier found “some loose bolts on many” Boeing 737 Max 9s in an interview for “NBC Nightly News with Lester Holt” scheduled to air Tuesday.

headline: ‘The straw that broke the camel’s back’: United CEO’s frustration with Boeing’s problems
body: United Airlines, one of the biggest buyers of Boeing jets, is losing patience with the troubled aircraft maker.

headline: Boeing faces new safety alert over earlier generation of 737s
body: The US Federal Aviation Administration has urged airlines to inspect so-called door plugs on an earlier version of Boeing 737 airplanes, after one blew out of the side of the newer Max model during an Alaska Airlines flight earlier this month.

headline: FAA warns airlines earlier 737 may have door plug issue
body: The Federal Aviation Administration is warning airlines that an earlier generation of the Boeing 737 aircraft has the same door plug design as the 737 Max 9, which recently failed on an Alaska Airlines flight. The Max 9s continue to be grounded while they are inspected for safety.

headline: Four survive charter jet crash in Afghanistan but condition of two others unclear, Russia says
body: Russia’s aviation watchdog said on Sunday four people survived the crash of a charter plane bound for Moscow in northern Afghanistan, citing the Russian embassy there, and it said the condition of two other passengers on board was not yet clear.

headline: JetBlue and Spirit appeal court decision blocking their merger
body: JetBlue Airways and Spirit Airlines filed an appeal late Friday of the federal court ruling from earlier this week that had blocked their proposed merger on antitrust grounds.

headline: A cargo plane was forced to land in Miami after a reported engine fire sent sparks flying midair
body: An Atlas Air cargo flight en route from Miami to Puerto Rico made an emergency landing late Thursday after a reported engine failure, the Federal Aviation Administration said.

headline: 'Oh my god, it's on fire!': Flames seen coming from a plane in the air
body: An Atlas Air cargo flight en route from Miami to Puerto Rico made an emergency landing after a reported engine failure, the Federal Aviation Administration said. CNN’s Pete Muntean reports.

headline: Indonesia allows Boeing 737 MAX 9 planes to fly again after checks
body: Indonesia has allowed three Boeing 737 Max 9 planes to fly again after grounding them, as they have different configurations from a jet that was forced to make an emergency landing in the United States on January 5, its transport ministry said on Thursday.

headline: Lionel Messi officially unveiled by new club Inter Miami

His former Barcelona teammate, the Spanish defender Sergio Busquets, was also welcomed to Miami on Sunday night. The league’s commissioner Don Garber told CNN earlier why Messi’s arrival is such a boon for the beautiful game.

headline: Passenger lands plane without landing gear after pilot suffers medical emergency

Police say the woman, 68, suffered minor injuries, and the man was extricated from the plane and flown to a Boston hospital in serious, life-threatening condition. The Federal Aviation Administration and National Transportation Safety Board are investigating the incident, the FAA said in a statement to CNN.

headline: Aaron Rodgers traded to New York Jets in blockbuster deal
body: The Green Bay Packers and New York Jets have agreed to trade longtime Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers to the Big Apple, Packers general manager Brian Gutekunst told reporters Monday. Gutekunst said the trade has not yet been finalized as the two sides work out the details, but he expects the trade to be completed soon. The long-awaited trade will reportedly see the four-time NFL Most Valuable Player sent to the Jets along with the Packers’ 15th overall pick in the 2023 NFL Draft. Rodgers, 39, has spent his entire 18-season NFL career with the Packers, where he led the team to a 31-25 victory in Super Bowl XLV in 2011. CNN Sport’s Coy Wire, who played for nine years in the NFL, discussed the big offseason news with CNN World Sport Anchor Don Riddell.

headline: Flames during American Airlines flight come amid increased bird strikes

headline: CNN 10: The big stories of the day, explained in 10 minutes
body: Today CNN 10 is looking at population size in India and China. While both countries have more than 1.4 billion people, India is set to overtake China as the world’s most populous nation this year. Then, CNN 10 is looking at California’s Central Valley, where severe rain has changed the terrain. Plus, the latest news on SpaceX’s Starship, the most powerful rocket ever built, and when it will launch. All that and cardboard boats that are trying to float, on this episode of CNN 10.

headline: Alibaba’s restructuring and Jack Ma’s homecoming are all part of China’s plan
body: Alibaba’s landmark restructuring has sent its shares soaring in New York and Hong Kong, as investors bet on the return of regulatory support for China’s tech industry and private businesses after more than two years of a brutal crackdown.

headline: Alibaba will split into six units, reshaping Jack Ma’s business empire
body: Alibaba on Tuesday said it plans to split its business into six separate units, in a move that promises to radically reshape the sprawling Chinese e-commerce firm that Jack Ma founded nearly 25 years ago.

headline: Pepsi has a new logo
body: If someone were to ask you to draw the Pepsi logo from memory, what would you draw? A circle, perhaps, with the red, white and blue stripes that are emblematic of the brand. The word “Pepsi,” probably, in that globe.

headline: Fintech withdraws funds from Israel
body: The CEO of Papaya Global talks to Julia Chatterley to the unrest in Israel

headline: Delta passenger opens door, deploys emergency exit slide on plane at Los Angeles airport
body: A Delta Air Lines passenger was arrested after opening one of the plane’s doors and sliding down an emergency exit slide as the plane prepared for takeoff from Los Angeles to Seattle Saturday, officials said.

headline: In a second attack, 10 rockets targeted US base in Syria
body: President Joe Biden emphasized that the US will “forcefully protect our people,” a day after approving retaliatory airstrikes in response to a drone attack by an Iranian-backed group in Syria. CNN’s Oren Liebermann has the latest.

headline: U.S. launches retaliatory strikes on Iran-backed facilities in Syria
body: The U.S. conducted airstrikes in Syria against what it said were Iranian-affiliated facilities after a suspected Iranian-made drone on Thursday struck a facility housing U.S. personnel in the country, killing an American contractor and wounding five U.S. service members and another U.S. contractor. Eleni Giokos breaks it down with analysis from CNN’s International Diplomatic Editor Nic Robertson and CNN National Security Reporter Natasha Bertrand from the Pentagon.

headline: Ambulances race to scene of suspected drone strike that killed a US contractor
body: The Pentagon says an Iranian-made drone killed an American contractor and wounded five US service members after it struck a base in Northeast Syria. President Joe Biden responded with airstrikes against groups affiliated with Iran’s Revolutionary Guard in Syria. CNN’s Natasha Bertrand has more.

headline: US launches retaliatory airstrike after deadly drone attack in Syria
body: The Pentagon announced the US has launched a retaliatory strike after a suspected Iranian-affiliated drone struck a facility housing US personnel in northeast Syria. CNN’s Oren Liebermann has more.

headline: Relativity Space attempts to launch 3D printed rocket for third time
body: After two previous attempts, startup Relativity Space managed to launch what it calls the “world’s first 3D-printed rocket.” See how it unfolded.

headline: Here's how much it costs to fly to space
body: Senior data report Harry Enten joins CNN’s Anderson Cooper to run the numbers on space travel.

headline: "World's first 3D-printed rocket" launched
body: The 3D printed Terran 1 lifts off in Florida, but fails to reach orbit

headline: US companies including Netflix and Boeing join ‘biggest’ business mission to Vietnam
body: Dozens of American companies are in Vietnam this week in hopes of pushing further into the fast-growing Southeast Asian economy, which has emerged as an attractive potential alternative to China as companies seek to diversify their markets and supply chains.

headline: Latest on the banking crisis and global markets
body: US stock futures and global markets rose Tuesday after coordinated action by the Federal Reserve and other leading central banks to keep dollars flowing around the financial system appears to have calmed nerves for now.

headline: Flight attendant unions want to ban "lap-babies" on planes
body: Pete Muntean reports renewed push is due to recent cases of turbulence.

headline: Will UBS move stave off panic? Economy reporter weighs in
body: New York Times Federal Reserve and economy reporter Jeanna Smialek says that UBS buying its rival Credit Suisse in an attempt to the ease fallout resulting from the failure of two American banks should be a comfort for markets in Asia and Europe.

headline: Pilot makes history after landing on top of a 56-story hotel
body: Polish pilot Lukasz Czepiela made history after landing a plane on a helipad at the top of a 56-story hotel in Dubai.

headline: Latest on banks and global markets
body: Shares in Credit Suisse surged on Thursday after it agreed to a $53 billion loan from the Swiss central bank. And in the US, First Republic Bank is set to receive a $30 billion lifeline from a group of 11 large banks. Follow for live updates.

headline: US airplane near misses keep coming. Now officials are talking about averting ‘catastrophic’ incidents
body: A series of concerning aviation incidents have hit the headlines in the United States this year, prompting top officials to hold a safety summit. So what’s going on and is it anything passengers should be worried about?

headline: Baidu stock rebounds after falling sharply in wake of ChatGPT-style bot demo
body: Shares in Chinese search giant Baidu rebounded sharply a day after it unveiled ERNIE Bot, its answer to the ChatGPT craze.

headline: U.S. Military is assessing its drone operations in the Black Sea region
body: US releases video of a Russian jet buzzing and then apparently hitting a drone over the Black Sea.

headline: See pilot's runway view and how he navigates close calls
body: CNN’s Pete Muntean, a licensed pilot, takes to the runway and then the skies to illustrate a pilot’s view of taking off and landing at a busy airport following multiple recent close calls between planes around the US.

headline: Global markets react to Credit Suisse deal as fears hit bank stocks
body: Switzerland’s central bank said it was ready to provide financial support to Credit Suisse after shares in the country’s second-biggest lender crashed as much as 30%. Follow for live updates.

headline: Pilot makes first-ever plane landing on Burj Al Arab helipad
body: Polish pilot Lukasz Czepiela made aviation history on Tuesday, becoming the first person to land a plane on the helipad of the Burj Al Arab Jumeirah hotel in Dubai.

headline: US releases video of Russian fighter jet forcing down reaper drone
body: The US military’s European Command has released footage of the encounter between a US surveillance drone and Russian fighter jets over the Black Sea. The newly declassified video depicts critical moments of the mid-air encounter, which the Pentagon said lasted 30-40 minutes.

headline: FAA hold rare safety summit after a series of near runway misses
body: After a series of near runway misses, the FAA holds a rare safety summit. CNN’s Rosemary Church asks CNN Aviation Analyst Mary Schiavo if it’s safe to fly right now.

headline: March 15, 2023 Russia-Ukraine news
body: Russia said it will try to retrieve the wreckage of the US drone downed over the Black Sea on Tuesday.

headline: March 15, 2023 Global stocks and banking news
body: Credit Suisse on Wednesday said it would borrow 50 billion Swiss Francs ($53.7 billion) from the Swiss National Bank. Follow live updates on global markets.

headline: See drones used by Russian military China is selling on Alibaba
body: Ukraine’s Territorial Defense gives CNN an exclusive look at what was left of a weaponized UAV drone originally manufactured in China and sold on Alibaba.

headline: Austin says US will continue to fly drones over Black Sea and condemns Russian downing as ‘aggressive’
body: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin vowed on Wednesday that US aircraft will continue to “fly and to operate wherever international law allows,” one day after Russian aircraft hit a US drone over the Black Sea, forcing it to be brought down in international waters.

headline: Economist weighs in on the health of large US financial institutions
body: Shares in Credit Suisse dropped more than 20%, falling to a record low. Mark Zandi, Chief Economist at Moody’s Analytics, adds context to the situation.

headline: Photos: World’s best airports for 2023, according to Skytrax
body: See photos of the airports ranked as the best of the best in Skytrax’s 2023 World Airport Awards.

headline: Brex CEO on the Silicon Valley Bank collapse
body: CNN’s Julia Chatterley talks to the fintech firm’s CEO about the fall of SVB

headline: Russian fighter jet forces down US drone over Black Sea
body: A Russian fighter jet forced down a US Air Force drone over the Black Sea on Tuesday after damaging the propeller of the American MQ-9 Reaper drone, according to the US military.

headline: Russian fighter jet forces down U.S. drone
body: CNN’s Max Foster speaks  with CNN’s Chief U.S. Security Correspondent Jim Sciutto about the Pentagon saying a Russian fighter jet  hit a U.S. spy drone and forced it to crash.

headline: Russian fighter jet forces down U.S. drone
body: CNN Pentagon Correspondent Oren Liebermann and Military Analyst Cedric Leighton break down the potential consequences of Russia taking down a U.S. drone

headline: March 14, 2023 - Russia-Ukraine news
body: A Russian fighter jet forced down a US Air Force drone over the Black Sea on Tuesday after damaging the propeller of the drone, the Air Force said. The White House called Moscow’s actions “unsafe, unprofessional and reckless.”

headline: Retired lt. general explains significance of Russian fighter jet forcing down US drone
body: A Russian fighter jet forced down a US Air Force drone over the Black Sea after damaging the propeller of the American MQ-9 Reaper drone, according to a US official familiar with the incident.

headline: Russian fighter jet forces down US drone over Black Sea after intercept
body: A Russian fighter jet forced down a US Air Force drone over the Black Sea on Tuesday after damaging the propeller of the American MQ-9 Reaper drone, according to the US military.

headline: Delta flight ‘exited’ one of the taxiways at Syracuse Hancock International Airport
body: A Delta flight “exited” one of the taxiways at Syracuse Hancock International Airport in New York just after 7:30 a.m. ET Tuesday, according to a news release from Syracuse Regional Airport Authority. Taxiways are the paths that airplanes take to the runway.

headline: Innovative aviation ideas shortlisted for 2023’s Crystal Cabin Awards
body: From a cabin concept that completely eradicates the middle seat to a swanky design that takes single-aisle aircraft business class to a new level, this year’s Crystal Cabin Awards shortlist offers an exciting glimpse at aviation’s potential future.

headline: Chinese companies are hiring AI-employees
body: Search engine giant Baidu is behind a number of digital employees in China, from McDonald’s ambassadors to financial advisers. Others in the country are also experimenting with a more virtual workforce, including in the C-suite.

headline: March 13, 2023 Latest on the Silicon Valley Bank collapse
body: The Federal Reserve announced Monday it has launched a review of the supervision and regulation of Silicon Valley Bank following the lender’s sudden implosion.

headline: Hear what former Goldman Sachs president thinks should happen in response to SVB collapse
body: Gary Cohn, the previous director of the National Economic Council under former President Donald Trump, discusses the Silicon Valley Bank collapse and why depositors have found it challenging to withdraw their money.

headline: What happened to flight MH370?
body: Flight MH370 disappeared 9 years ago with 239 aboard, and the wreckage was never found. Why? Was it the captain’s murder-suicide, or something else? “There are still questions that need to be asked,” says Jeff Wise, author of “The Taking of MH370.”

headline: Silicon Valley Bank Woes
body: Mike Mayo of Wells Fargo discusses the crisis facing Silicon Valley Bank

headline: See why tension is growing between Trump and Fox boss Rupert Murdoch
body: Former President Donald Trump fired back at Fox Corp. Chairman Rupert Murdoch after Murdoch testified in the Dominion Voting Systems lawsuit. CNN’s Tom Foreman reports.

headline: Two 10-year-old Boeing 787 Dreamliners are already being scrapped
body: If you’re in the market for a pair of lightly used widebody aircraft, you better head to Scotland fast and put in an offer — before two Boeing 787-8s formerly flying for Norwegian Air Shuttle get stripped for parts.

headline: Planes may not have been aware of each other before mid-air collision in Florida, NTSB says
body: The pilots of two small airplanes that collided mid-air in Florida Tuesday may not have been aware that the other was nearby when they crashed into each other, according to an air safety inspector.

headline: Hear passenger explain why he got into fistfight on plane
body: Two passengers got into a fistfight while boarding a Southwest Airlines flight in Dallas, Texas. The video also shows the man who threw the first punch explaining why he did it.

headline: Stocks close mixed after Powell’s testimony and fresh jobs data
body: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell testified before the House Financial Services Committee on Wednesday in day two of his semiannual monetary policy testimony before Congress.

headline: FAA administrator unclear whether airliner close calls are on the rise
body: After at least six incidents this year, the nation’s top aviation official says he does not know whether close calls involving airliners are on the rise, but says the issue and its causes will be examined at a safety conference next week.

headline: Passenger hits luggage jackpot after airline destroys her bag
body: Passenger shocked at what airline gives her to replace her ruined suitcase. CNN’s Jeanne Moos reports.

headline: Stocks close sharply down after Powell says rates will rise more than expected
body: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell appeared before the Senate Banking Committee Tuesday to deliver the first part of his two-day semiannual monetary policy testimony before Congress.

headline: US Justice Department sues to block JetBlue’s purchase of Spirit Airlines
body: The US Justice Department is suing to stop JetBlue’s proposed $3.8 billion deal to buy discount carrier Spirit Airlines, the first time in more than 20 years that the government has sought to block a US airline merger.

headline: Scientists come across ship missing for more than 120 years. See what they found
body: A 191-foot cargo ship was discovered by NOAA researchers over a century after it sank, taking the lives of all but two crew members.

headline: How dangerous are bird strikes to planes?
body: Carlos Suarez reports on bird strike impact on flight from Hvana.

headline: MH370 families urge new search for missing Malaysia plane
body: Families of those on board Malaysia Airlines flight 370, which disappeared mysteriously nearly nine years ago, called on the Malaysian government on Sunday to allow US seabed exploration firm Ocean Infinity to mount a new search for the missing plane.

headline: Boeing CEO Calhoun just missed out on a $7 million bonus. But he still got a raise
body: Boeing CEO David Calhoun missed out on a $7 million bonus last year, but still got a raise.

headline: Apple supplier Foxconn is on the hunt for semiconductor and EV deals in India
body: Apple supplier Foxconn says it is seeking Indian partners to cooperate in areas such as chips and electric vehicles, as its chief executive wrapped up a visit to the country.

headline: Airlines sue Schiphol Airport
body: A group of airlines sue Schiphol over flight caps.

headline: A new generation of airships is taking to the skies
body: Airships once ruled the skies – and now, a century after their golden age, the giant floating vessels are making a comeback. Companies like Flying Whales, Hybrid Air Vehicles, and H2 Clipper hope to revive this old technology and offer a low-impact solution for the global supply chain.

headline: A new generation of airships is taking to the skies
body: Airship technology has been around for over 150 years, but fell out of favor in the 1930s. Now, interest in the low-emission, lighter-than-air transport is reviving as a sustainable solution for logistics across the globe.

headline: 2 Americans arrested for allegedly sending aviation technology to Russia
body: Two US nationals were arrested in Kansas City on Thursday for allegedly sending US aviation technology to Russia, the Justice Department announced.

headline: NASA-SpaceX crew launches from Kennedy Space Center
body: John Vause talks with retired astronaut Leroy Chiao as the mission launches

headline: Plane passenger rushes in to help fight mid-air fire
body: A Spirit Airlines flight was diverted and landed safely in Jacksonville, Florida, after the crew reported a battery in an overhead bin was on fire. Passenger video from inside the flight shows a retired firefighter helping the crew extinguish the fire.

headline: World’s biggest plane flies again in Microsoft Flight Simulator
body: A year after it was destroyed during the Russian invasion of Ukraine, the Antonov AN-225 – the world’s biggest commercial plane – has taken flight once again in the Microsoft Flight Simulator program.

headline: SpaceX night launch produces stunning display
body: SpaceX and NASA launched a fresh crew of astronauts on a mission to the International Space Station, kicking off a roughly six-month stay in space.

headline: The 5 airplane near crashes under investigation
body: Phil Washington, the White House’s pick to lead the Federal Aviation Administration, is going to face tough questions in his confirmation hearing about his ability to lead an agency facing the challenges the agency faces.

headline: CEO of pharma giant on why the company is cutting cost of insulin
body: CNN’s Don Lemon speaks to Eli Lilly CEO Dave Ricks after the company announced a series of price cuts that would lower the price of the most commonly used forms of its insulin.

headline: Ex-Navy pilot says he saw UFOs that did things his plane could not do
body: Former Navy fighter pilot Ryan Graves tells CNN’s Alisyn Camerota about his unit’s experiences with UFOs and explains the problems they can pose for military and commercial aviation.

headline: 'A scary situation': Passenger on JetBlue flight about near collision with private plane
body: Air traffic controllers stopped a departing private jet from running into a JetBlue flight as it was coming in to land at Boston Logan International Airport, according to the Federal Aviation Administration. CNN correspondent Pete Muntean reports.

headline: Tesla, tech and travel stocks have ginormous gains this year
body: Last year’s stock market zeroes are so far turning out to be this year’s Wall Street heroes.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway earnings fall 8% in fourth quarter but rise 12% for full year
body: Berkshire Hathaway’s operating earnings fell during the fourth quarter of 2022, as inflation pressures and high interest rates bogged down businesses at the company run by investor Warren Buffett, though the full year profits reached a “record.”

headline: Watch: Chinese fighter jet's warning to US Navy plane in South China Sea
body: CNN’s Ivan Watson takes a ride on a US Navy jet over the South China Sea and witnesses tensions at play between the US and China during a close encounter with a Chinese fighter jet.

headline: Close call between two planes on runway at Burbank Airport under investigation
body: Another close call between commercial airliners at a major US airport is under federal investigation. The National Transportation Safety Board announced Friday that it is investigating a runway incursion this week at Bob Hope Burbank Airport in California.

headline: See Chinese fighter jet fly by US plane carrying CNN crew
body: A Chinese fighter jet intercepted a US plane carrying a CNN crew aboard a reconnaissance mission over the South China Sea. CNN’s Ivan Watson was aboard and reports from Okinawa, Japan.

headline: Boeing forced to halt 787 Dreamliner deliveries once again
body: Boeing has been forced to halt deliveries of the 787 Dreamliner once again, just months after it resumed deliveries to customers following a year-long halt.

headline: Washington Post: Bezos hires investment firm to explore possibility of NFL team bid
body: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos hired an investment firm to research a possible bid for the NFL Washington Commanders team, two people familiar with the situation told the Washington Post.

headline: Qantas reveals new first and business class cabins for ultra long-haul ‘Project Sunrise’ flights
body: As Qantas gears up for the 2025 launch of its ultra long-haul “Project Sunrise” flights, the airline is offering a sneak peek of what passengers in the front section of the plane will experience on the 19-hour record-breaking journeys.

headline: Two American Airlines flights diverted due to unruly passengers (September 2022)
body: Two separate American Airlines flights were diverted on Sunday due to unruly passengers. According to the FAA, more than 390 such incidents have been reported so far this year. CNN’s Whitney Wild reports.

headline: U.S. says Russia tested an ICBM
body: Oren Liebermann talks about U.S.-Russian relations

headline: Dow drops by nearly 700 points as retail earnings disappoint
body: US stocks plunged on Tuesday after fourth-quarter earnings and forecasts from mega-retailers like Walmart and Home Depot raised concerns about the strength of the US consumer.

headline: Japan’s H3 rocket launch aborted after booster engine glitch
body: Japan’s H3 rocket, the country’s first new medium-lift launcher in three decades, failed to lift off on Friday because two secondary booster engines strapped to the side of the space vehicle didn’t ignite.

headline: Brand new Boeing 747 scrapped after 16 flights
body: The world’s largest business jet, a Boeing 747 configured as a private VIP plane for a Saudi royal, is being scrapped after having spent just 30 hours in service over 16 flights.

headline: The retired Boeing 737 that’s been transformed into a private villa
body: Formerly part of the now defunct Mandala Airlines fleet, the retired Boeing 737 was purchased by developer Felix Demin in 2021 and transported to its remote location on a clifftop near Nyang-Nyang beach in Bali.

headline: Warren Buffett’s company sells major stake in Taiwanese chip giant TSMC
body: Shares in Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company fell as much as 4% on Wednesday, after Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway disclosed that it had sold most of its holdings in the chip giant.

headline: Boeing lands massive Air India order, but still loses out to Airbus
body: Boeing announced one of the largest orders in its history Tuesday. But it was still topped by rival Airbus.

headline: Ram reveals its electric truck and it looks just like the gas truck
body: Ram revealed the production version of its electric pickup in a Super Bowl commercial, and it turns out that it looks much like today’s internal combustion powered Ram 1500 truck, instead of the futuristic concept unveiled just last month.

headline: Alibaba sells remaining stake in top Indian online payment provider Paytm
body: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba has sold its remaining stake in Paytm, India’s top digital payment app, as it gradually divests from its Indian investments amid friction between Beijing and New Delhi.

headline: The retired Boeing 737 that’s been transformed into a private villa
How the pandemic killed off 64 airlines
body: Since the Covid-19 pandemic started in 2020, a massive number of airlines across the world have gone bankrupt, including national carriers in Italy and Namibia. Did covid kill them, or just hasten their deaths? It’s complicated, say industry experts.

headline: This could be the next battlefield in modern warfare
body: CNN’s Will Ripley looks back at China’s history of looking upward to near space for the future of their defense systems.

headline: Watch SpaceX fire 31 engines on the most powerful rocket ever
body: SpaceX completed what it says was a successful test after 31 of the 33 Raptor engines on its Starship rocket fired during a statis test. Starship is what SpaceX hopes to use to one day send humans to Mars.

headline: GM signs exclusive deal for US semiconductor production
body: General Motors has signed an agreement with tech manufacturer GlobalFoundries to make semiconductors for GM’s various electronics suppliers. The electronic components will be made in GlobalFoundries facilities in upstate New York.

headline: Bill Gates asked if he's a 'hypocrite' for flying on a private jet. See what he said
body: During an interview with BBC journalist Amol Rajan, Bill Gates argued against accusations he’s a hypocrite for using a personal private jet while also investing in climate change solutions.

headline: What’s the safest seat on a plane? We asked an aviation expert
body: The bottom line is air travel is very safe – much safer than road travel. But that doesn’t stop us from wondering which seat on the plane offers the most protection in an emergency.

headline: Boeing is cutting 2,000 HR and finance jobs, outsourcing some to India
body: Boeing plans to cut about 2,000 white-collar jobs in finance and human resources, and it will be shifting some of that work to an outside contractor in India.

headline: FAA proposes fining United $1 million for skipping safety steps
body: Airline regulators on Monday proposed slapping United Airlines with a $1.15 million fine for safety concerns about how it operated some 777 planes.

headline: Bank of America CEO predicts 'mild recession' next year
body: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan speaks with CNN’s Poppy Harlow in an exclusive interview about the US economy.

headline: Bank of America CEO predicts impact on economy amid China and US tensions
body: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan speaks with CNN’s Poppy Harlow about what he thinks the impact on the global economy will be if tensions continue to escalate between the US and China.

headline: SpaceX put a Tesla sportscar into space five years ago. Where is it now?
body: SpaceX launched a Tesla roadster belonging to company founder and billionaire Elon Musk in 2018, and what’s left of the car may still be in orbit today.

headline: Near-miss as FedEx plane landing almost hits Southwest flight taking off in Texas
body: CNN’s Pete Muntean takes a closer look at a near-miss incident between FedEx and Southwest Airlines in Texas.

headline: Foxconn January sales hit record high after production restored at world’s biggest iPhone factory
body: Apple supplier Foxconn says its January monthly sales hit a record high as it bounced back from Covid-19 disruptions in China.

headline: Hear what retired fighter pilot thinks about shooting down Chinese spy balloon
body: Retired Air Force Lieutenant General David Deptula discusses how the US military could shoot down a Chinese spy balloon floating over the continental United States.

headline: ‘Queen of the skies’ gets a crown in the sky
body: The last-ever Boeing 747 jumbo jet to be produced drew a crown in the sky on its maiden flight, as a nod to its “Queen of the Skies” nickname. It also formed a “747” nestled in the crown.

headline: Adani's wealth takes more hits as India's stock market plunges
body: Shares in Gautam Adani’s businesses plunged after a failed attempt by the Indian billionaire to reassure panicking investors about the stock market meltdown that has wiped $100 billion off the value of his business empire. CNN reporter Vedika Sud has the story.

headline: CNN 10: The big stories of the day, explained in 10 minutes
body: What is the debt ceiling and how could it affect the U.S. government’s ability to fulfill its legal obligations?  We’ll examine that this Thursday as meetings in Washington determine what’s next.  Then, we’ll take to the skies to learn more about the history of this jumbo jet and what’s in store for airlines of the future.  Additionally, we’ll investigate a search that has been described as like trying to find a needle in a haystack.

headline: Boeing says farewell to ‘Queen of the Skies’ with last 747 delivery
body: More than half a century since the original jumbo jet “shrank the world” to transform commercial aviation, the last ever Boeing 747 is being delivered, marking the start of the final chapter for the much-loved airplane.

headline: Boeing 747: How the 'Queen of the Skies' redefined the way we fly
body: When it was revealed in 1969 the Boeing 747 broke the mould, redefining commercial flight and transporting everything from world leaders to space craft. Now, after half a century of service, the ‘Queen of the Skies’ is beginning to approach its final touchdown.

headline: This budget airline is making record profits
body: Ryanair expects it will be able to charge higher prices for flights over Easter and the summer, thanks to strong demand from American and Asian tourists and less competition from rivals.

headline: On GPS: How India and China view Russia's aggression
body: New America CEO Anne-Marie Slaughter, former Swedish Prime Minister Carl Bildt and former Singaporean diplomat Kishore Mahbubani discuss the strategic dimensions of the reaction India and China have had to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

headline: Inside Air France’s new business class cabin
body: The airline debuted its impressive 48-seat business class cabin on a flight from Paris to New York. The new seats can be converted into a flat bed measuring almost two meters long, and come with a sliding door to create “a totally private space.”

headline: Goldman Sachs CEO got 30% pay cut – but still made $25 million
body: Goldman Sachs had a rough year in 2022. And CEO David Solomon was punished for that. Sort of.

headline: Why NASA tested a plane with a pivoting wing
body: Not many aircraft can claim to be truly one of a kind, but the NASA AD-1 is undoubtedly one of them. No other piloted plane has ever been built with a wing that could turn to a lopsided 20 to 2 angle – but the fascinating story is why it did at all.

headline: United CEO: Air travel system is ‘stressed to the max’
body: If airlines are to avoid repeats of recent service problems, they’ll need to have a lot more back-up in place, according to United CEO Scott Kirby.

headline: 'The system is stressed to the max': United CEO weighs in on industry woes
body: CNN’s Christine Romans speaks with United Airlines CEO Scott Kirby about the service and training problems across the airline industry.

headline: Toyota names new CEO as Akio Toyoda steps down
body: Toyota’s longtime president and CEO Akio Toyoda is stepping down and handing over the reins of the world’s largest automaker to Lexus chief Koji Sato.

headline: Why Goldman Sachs says a recession isn't coming
body: CNN’s Matt Egan talks with Goldman Sachs’ chief economist Jan Hatzius about why the global investment bank is more optimistic than just about everyone else.

headline: Rocket Lab launches Electron rocket from the US for the first time
body: Rocket Lab, a prolific launch company that routinely blasts its 60-foot tall Electron rockets into orbit out of New Zealand, conducted its first liftoff from US soil from Virginia on Tuesday.

headline: Here’s what Boeing blames for its big loss
body: Boeing reported a $650 million operating loss in the fourth quarter, surprising Wall Street analysts who had expected the aircraft giant to turn a profit.

headline: Photo of Delta flight attendant goes viral. See why
body: Floyd Dean-Shannon, a Delta flight attendant, joins “CNN This Morning” to discuss a viral photo of him comforting a nervous passenger mid-flight.

headline: Virgin names plane after Queen Elizabeth II
body: The airline’s Airbus A330neo aircraft has been named Queen of the Skies in honor of the late monarch.

headline: The world’s longest flight spent more than two months in the air
body: This is one aviation record that will likely never be broken. In the late 1950s, two men flew in a little four-seater plane for 64 days, 22 hours and 19 minutes, clocking up 150,000 miles over the Las Vegas desert.

headline: The world’s longest flight was more than two months long
After a historic first mission, what does the future hold for this controversial rocket?
body: Boeing has been mired in controveries, including delays and myriad issues with a spacecraft it built for one NASA program and scandals plaguing its airplane division. But it is one of the key contractors that built NASA’s new moon rocket.

headline: This small airplane could hold the key to zero-carbon flying
body: Low-carbon flying has taken another step forward with ZeroAvia’s successful test flight of a 19-seater airplane run entirely on a hydrogen-electric engine.

headline: Aviation museum renamed for Captain ‘Sully’ Sullenberger
body: The former Carolinas Aviation Museum is home to the famous ‘Miracle on the Hudson’ plane.

headline: Boeing ordered to appear in court next week on fraud conspiracy charge
body: A federal judge has ordered Boeing to appear in federal court in Texas next week for an arraignment on a fraud charge involving the certification of the 737 MAX.

headline: Remember Yahoo? Here's an inside look at the company's start more than 25 years ago
body: Yahoo, one of the most popular early internet search engines, was founded nearly 30 years ago. It might not be as popular today, but when CNN visited in 1997, the company’s co-founders were each worth $120M. Here’s what those early days looked like.

headline: New aircraft design from NASA and Boeing could benefit passengers in the 2030s
body: NASA and Boeing will work together on the Sustainable Flight Demonstrator project to build, test and fly a single-aisle aircraft that reduces emissions, according to an announcement from the agency on Wednesday.

headline: How to recycle the world’s largest passenger plane
body: It’s no easy task recycling an A380, but someone’s got to do it. Here’s how one company breaks down the world’s largest passenger plane, recycling around 90% of the aircraft, and occasionally – if avgeeks get lucky – upcycling parts for auction.

headline: Video inside plane of Nepali crash may shed light on what exactly happened
body: A Facebook Live video purportedly shows the last terrifying moments inside the cabin on Yeti Airlines Flight 691 before it crashed in Nepal. CNN has corroborated the video based on geolocation, a flight manifest and information on the Yeti Airlines website. CNN’s Vedika Sud has more.

headline: The rich should pay higher fares to clean up aviation, says Heathrow boss
body: Rich travelers will have to pay more to fly if the aviation industry is to transition to greener fuels, the boss of one of the world’s biggest airports said Tuesday.

headline: Heathrow CEO says wealthy 'should pay' aviation transition to greener fuels
body: During a panel at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Heathrow CEO John Holland-Kaye explains to CNN’s Richard Quest why the “wealthy people in this room” should pay more to fly.

headline: Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley both hit hard by deal drought
body: Let’s not make a deal? Investment banking powerhouses Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley both reported substantial drops in revenue and profit for the fourth quarter on Tuesday, largely due to the dearth of merger activity and initial public offerings in the final three months of the year.

headline: Video inside cabin purportedly shows moments before Nepal plane crash
body: A Facebook Live video purportedly showing the last terrifying moments inside the cabin on Yeti Airlines flight 691 before it crashed in Nepal on Sunday has circulated widely online, as search and recovery efforts continue on the ground.

headline: At least 68 killed in Nepal’s worst airplane crash in 30 years
body: At least 68 people were killed Sunday when an aircraft went down near the city of Pokhara in central Nepal, a government official said, the country’s deadliest plane crash in more than 30 years.

headline: Tragic twist discovered involving co-pilot in Nepal plane crash
body: Families mourn for their loved ones following the Yeti Airlines crash in central Nepal that killed at least 70 people. CNN’s Ivan Watson reports.

headline: Video appears to show plane rolling on its side before crash in Nepal
body: A video clip on social media appears to show the moments before an aircraft operated by Nepal’s Yeti Airlines crashed in the Nepali city of Pokhara leaving dozens dead. CNN reporter Vedika Sud has more.

headline: Black box recovered from Nepal plane crash wreckage
body: The flight data recorder has been recovered from the wreckage of the Yeti Airlines plane crash that occurred in central Nepal on Sunday where at least 69 have been confirmed dead, according to Nepal’s civil aviation authority.

headline: Close call between 2 planes at New York’s JFK airport is under investigation, FAA says
body: The Federal Aviation Administration announced it is starting a probe into how a commercial airliner taxied in front of a flight that was taking off from New York’s John F. Kennedy International Airport Friday evening.

headline: Radar animation shows near-miss between 2 passenger planes at JFK
body: The Federal Aviation Administration is starting a probe into how a commercial airliner taxied in front of a flight that was taking off from New York’s John F. Kennedy International Airport. CNN’s Pamela Brown discusses with Mary Schiavo, former inspector general of the US Department of Transportation.

headline: SpaceX’s most powerful rocket returns to flight and nails synchronized landing
body: SpaceX’s Falcon Heavy rocket, the towering launch vehicle known for its boosters’ aerial acrobatics and synchronized landings when returning to Earth, took to the skies Sunday, delivering national security payloads to orbit for the US military.

headline: Schumer says he will push to confirm Biden’s pick for FAA administrator following system outage
body: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said Sunday he would push to confirm President Joe Biden’s pick to lead the Federal Aviation Administration, following a computer system failure that triggered the delay of more than 10,000 flights last week.

headline: Aging, outdated technology leaves air travel at risk of meltdown
body: The massively disruptive computer outage at the Federal Aviation Administration this week that caused thousands of cancelled or delayed flights has put Americans uncomfortably face-to-face with the technology behind US air travel — for at least the second time in a month.

headline: Bank earnings fail to impress investors as recession worries rise
body: JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, Citigroup and asset management giant BlackRock posted results that topped Wall Street’s forecasts Friday, but investors were nonetheless a little disappointed at first.

headline: Delta decided against using ‘fairly old’ backup system during FAA outage
body: Delta Air Lines has a backup to the federal aviation safety system that failed this week, but the airline decided against using it, CEO Ed Bastian said Friday.

headline: Delta trims guidance on cost of pilots labor deal
body: Delta Air Lines reported very strong fourth-quarter results Friday that beat forecasts, capping its first profitable year since before the pandemic. But a new labor deal with its pilots union will trim profitability going forward.

headline: Why Goldman Sachs isn’t too worried about a recession
body: America’s largest financial institutions are pivoting into a new industry: Meteorology.

headline: Boeing 737 Max 8 takes off in China for the first time since 2019
body: A Boeing 737 Max 8 took off in China on Friday, for the first time since the government grounded all 737 Max 8 planes in 2019, according to the flight tracking website, Flightradar24.

headline: World’s top chip maker mulls global expansion with plants in Europe, Japan
body: Semiconductor giant Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) may expand its global manufacturing footprint even further.

headline: FAA is years away from upgrading the system that grounded all US flights
body: The Federal Aviation Administration software that failed Wednesday causing thousands of flight delays and cancellations is 30 years old and at least six years away from being updated, a government source familiar with the situation tells CNN.

headline: How technology is helping aviation to be more sustainable
body: From fighting contrails to pursuing hydrogen propulsion, the aviation industry is looking at new technologies to support its efforts to decarbonize

headline: FAA system outage causes thousands of flight delays and cancellations across the US
body: The airline industry slowly resumed service after a Federal Aviation Administration system outage caused disruptions across the United States. Thousands of flights were delayed with more than 1,300 cancellations by Wednesday evening.

headline: Disney names Nike executive Mark Parker as new chairman
body: The Walt Disney Company has named Nike executive chairman Mark Parker as its new board chair, replacing longtime director Susan Arnold, whose term limit is expiring.

headline: Pete Buttigieg asked if FAA system is out-of-date. Hear his reply
