body: Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg talks with CNN’s Kate Bolduan about the Federal Aviation Administration ground stop that it issued following an outage to a system that provides pilots with notices they need before flying. The group stop caused more than 6,700 US flight delays.

headline: What is NOTAM, the FAA computer system that halted all US flights?
body: A critical Federal Aviation Administration computer system that experienced an outage Wednesday and briefly halted all US flights provides airlines with a digital bulletin board of crucial safety updates.

headline: Passengers stuck on runway as their flight takes off without them
body: A group of 55 travelers at India’s Bengaluru airport were left stuck on a shuttle bus as their Go First flight to Delhi took off without them.

headline: Over 4000 flights delayed before FAA's ground stop was lifted
body: The Federal Aviation Administration lifted their pause on all domestic flight departures across the US that they issued after the system that provides pilots with pre-flight safety notices went offline. CNN’s aviation correspondent Pete Muntean reports on the impacts.

headline: 'I've never seen something like this': CNN reporter on FAA outage
body: A Federal Aviation Administration system that provides pilots with notices they need to read before flying is experiencing an outage, affecting flights across the US.

headline: Rocket start-up fails attempt to launch satellites off Alaska’s coast
body: A rocket operated by a California-based start-up failed near the coast of Alaska Tuesday, marking yet another mishap for companies hoping to offer their services to launch scores of small satellites into orbit.

headline: Chinese rocket startup Galactic Energy sends five satellites into space
body: Galactic Energy, a rocket startup in China, launched five satellites into orbit on Monday, boosting the private company’s ambition to become the Chinese rival to SpaceX.

headline: Canada agrees $14 billion deal for F-35 stealth fighter jets
body: Canada is buying 88 F-35 stealth fighter jets in a $14.2 billion deal announced Monday by the Ottawa government.

headline: Goldman Sachs will lay off up to 3,200 workers this week
body: Goldman Sachs will lay off as many as 3,200 employees this week as an uncertain economic and market climate pushes the bank to hunt for cost savings, according to a person familiar with the matter.

headline: Alibaba, US-listed Chinese firms make roaring comeback in 2023
body: Chinese tech giants are witnessing a dream start to the year.

headline: Stocks surge after better-than-expected jobs report
body: The jobs report Friday showed the US economy added another 223,000 jobs. Stocks rallied for most of the day on the news.

headline: This airline has new designer uniforms – including jumpsuits
body: British Airways has announced a new uniform for its staff for the first time in nearly 20 years. The new threads, designed by Ozwald Boateng, include a jumpsuit for female crew members.

headline: Ram unveils electric pickup truck concept with three rows of seats
body: Stellantis’s Ram truck brand is behind its competitors on launching an electric pickup, with trucks from major rivals already on the market or coming soon.

headline: This electric Ram truck concept has a fold-away third row
body: Ram unveiled its concept electric pickup truck at CES in Las Vegas with hopes to compete with Fords F-150 Lightning and the Rivian R1T which have already gone into production.

headline: Delta Air Lines is rolling out free Wi-Fi
body: Delta Air Lines is rolling out free Wi-Fi to most of its planes beginning February 1.

headline: The world’s most punctual airlines in 2022 were…
body: A South American airline had the best on-time performance in 2022, according to a new report by aviation analytics firm Cirium, while a US airline was singled out for its global operational excellence.

headline: The new aircraft, routes and airplane cabins taking off in 2023
body: After a chaotic year for aviation, airlines and passengers look forward to smoother skies in the 12-months ahead, with new aircraft, routes and flying experiences on the horizon.

headline: China’s new supercarrier will soon undergo first sea trials, officer says
body: The Chinese navy’s massive new aircraft carrier, the CNS Fujian, is expected to head to sea for the first time this year, the ship’s executive officer said in an interview with state media.

headline: Insiders at Southwest reveal how the airline’s service imploded
body: Ask Southwest Airlines employees about their company’s technology, and one word keeps coming up: “antiquated.”

headline: New species discovered in 2022
body: California Academy of Sciences researchers and their international collaborators discovered 146 new species in 2022.

headline: Tesla shares are down 70% for the year as Morgan Stanley cuts price target
body: Tesla’s stock is finishing out its tumultuous year with yet more turbulence: It’s up almost 6% Thursday, but still down more than 10% since last week. And a new cut to its price target from Morgan Stanley isn’t helping.

headline: Southwest CEO responds to backlash over cancellations
body: Southwest Airlines CEO Bob Jordan released an apology to stranded travelers as the beleaguered airline continues to grapple with what US Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg has referred to as a complete “meltdown” of the system. In all, Southwest has canceled more than 15,700 flights since winter weather began disrupting air travel on December 22.

headline: Covid and chaos: 22 ways flying had a bumpy ride in 2022
body: It’s been another tough year for aviation, as the world returned to flying after the Covid-19 pandemic, only for the industry to be beset by chaos and cancellations. Here are the highs and lows of what’s been a bumpy ride.

headline: 'Completely melted down': Buttigieg reacts to Southwest Airlines chaos
body: Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg talks to CNN’s Wolf Blitzer about the “unacceptable situation” unfolding at Southwest Airlines as they canceled thousands of flights and describes a conversation he had with the airline’s CEO.

headline: Southwest canceled about two-thirds of its flights. See how travelers are faring
body: CNN’s Carlos Suarez reports from Atlanta’s Hartsfield-Jackson Airport, where travelers are braving long lines and flight cancellations after a massive winter storm swept through the US.

headline: "A great deal of anger and frustration toward the airline."
body: Southwest Airlines canceled more than half its flights today – and passengers are deeply frustrated. CNN’s Carlos Suarez reports.

headline: Mike Sievert of T-Mobile is the CNN Business CEO of the Year
body: Investors saw a lot of red in 2022. But a company known for its magenta logo was a stock market darling this year.

headline: Fire on board a JetBlue plane forces the evacuation of more than 160 passengers at New York’s JFK airport
body: A fire on board a JetBlue Airways plane forced more than 160 passengers to evacuate using emergency slides at New York’s John F. Kennedy International Airport on Saturday, fire department officials said.

headline: Photos: They met on an airplane on Christmas Day and fell in love
body: Catalina Bernal Andrade and Mauricio García Marulanda were strangers who ended up on the same JetBlue airplane flying from Bogotá, Colombia to Orlando, Florida on December 25, 2009. See photos of their life together here.

headline: Analyst: Tech stocks will rise 20% in 2023
body: Tech stocks have had a brutal year, but Dan Ives, managing director and senior equity research analyst at Wedbush Securities, explains why he’s bullish about them for 2023.

headline: B-2 nuke bomber fleet is temporarily grounded due to safety issue
body: The Air Force’s fleet of B-2 Spirit bombers is temporarily grounded after one of the aircraft had an in-flight malfunction earlier this month.

headline: Shoppers are still buying Nike sneakers
body: Nike’s stock jumped around 11% after the company beat analyst forecasts during its latest quarter.

headline: See inside of Hawaiian Airlines plane rocked by turbulence
body: At least 36 people on a Hawaiian Airlines flight were injured, with 20 taken to emergency rooms, after their plane encountered “severe turbulence” on a flight from Phoenix to Honolulu. KHNL’s Jolanie Martinez reports.

headline: Hear what the FAA is saying about the flight where dozens were hurt
body: Dozens of people on a Hawaiian Airlines flight were injured after their plane encountered “severe turbulence” on a flight from Phoenix to Honolulu. CNN’s Pete Muntean reports.

headline: Brand it like Beckham: How has this World Cup affected the ‘brands’ associated with it?
body: Traditionally billions of viewers watch the World Cup, and as they concentrate on what is happening on the pitch, the names of some of the world’s biggest companies flash behind the players on a rolling, technicolored loop – Budweiser, Visa, Coca-Cola, Qatar Airways, Adidas, McDonalds, Wanda, Vivo, Hyundai Kia.

headline: Airlines are cutting back on these frequent flyer perks
body: Frequent flyers are preparing to be frequently frustrated as major airlines including Delta and United begin cutting back on some loyalty program perks. CNN’s Pete Muntean reports.

headline: Virgin to fly ‘net-zero’ transatlantic Boeing 787
body: Virgin Atlantic is set to operate a Boeing 787 from London to New York, powered solely by sustainable aviation fuel made of waste oils and fats.

headline: In pictures: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk
body: Elon Musk built a commercial rocket company from scratch and upended the auto industry as a high-profile evangelist for electric cars.

headline: Elon Musk sells another 22 million Tesla shares for $3.6 billion
body: Elon Musk just sold another 22 million shares of Tesla, raising $3.6 billion.

headline: United places order for 200 Boeing planes, giving two troubled jets a vote of confidence
body: United Airlines placed a massive order for at least 200 Boeing planes on Tuesday, split between two models dogged by recent problems: the 737 Max and the 787 Dreamliner.

headline: United Airlines places largest widebody aircraft order ever
body: United Airlines ordered up to 200 Boeing planes. The company’s CEO Scott Kirby joins CNN This Morning to discuss the recession and what is being calling the largest widebody aircraft order ever.

headline: Watch NASA's Orion spacecraft splashdown in Pacific Ocean
body: The Artemis I mission, an uncrewed test flight around the moon, ended successfully as NASA’s Orion spacecraft landed in the Pacific Ocean.

headline: As the world courts TSMC, Taiwan worries about losing its ‘silicon shield’
body: Semiconductor giant TSMC was feted this week by US President Joe Biden and Apple CEO Tim Cook during a ceremony to unveil its $40 billion manufacturing site in Arizona — a huge investment designed to help secure America’s supply of the most advanced chips.

headline: Etihad’s ‘Greenliner’ shows a glimpse of a more sustainable future for aviation
body: Etihad Airways is aiming to spearhead sustainability in aviation through a program called “Greenliner.”

headline: Japan, Britain and Italy plan sixth-generation fighter jet to rival world’s most-advanced warplanes
body: The United Kingdom, Japan and Italy announced Friday they are teaming up to build a sixth-generation fighter jet, designed to rival or eclipse the best warplanes now employed by the likes of China and Russia – and possibly even the United States, the main ally of the trio.

headline: China Eastern takes delivery of the world’s first made-in-China C919 jet
body: The world’s first C919, a Chinese-made narrowbody jet, was delivered to launch customer China Eastern Airlines in Shanghai on Friday and took off for a 15-minute flight to mark the historic moment.

headline: Google Flights top trending destinations for 2022
body: These were the destinations Americans were interested in for 2022.

headline: See Brittney Griner on flight back to US
body: WNBA star Brittney Griner was released from Russian detention in a prisoner swap for convicted Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout. CNN’s Kylie Atwood reports on video of her flight returning to the US.

headline: The very last 747 jumbo jet just rolled off Boeing’s assembly line
body: After 53 years and more than 1,570 planes, the last Boeing 747 rolled off the assembly line in Washington state Tuesday evening, on its way to serve as a cargo plane.

headline: Why the world’s top chip maker is doubling down on American manufacturing
body: The world’s leading producer of advanced computer chips, Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company, announced an expanded $40 billion investment in its US production hub in Phoenix.

headline: NTSB says pilot that hit power lines was too low for miles
body: Investigators say the pilot of a private plane that crashed into power lines and cut electricity to 120,000 people was flying too low for miles.

headline: Airlines will be making money again in 2023 as travel recovers
body: The global airline industry is expected to return to profitability in 2023 for the first time in four years.

headline: Video shows explosion at air base in Russia
body: Explosions at two Russian air bases have focused attention on Ukraine’s efforts to develop longer-range combat drones. Retired Lt. Gen. Ben Hodges explains why this development could be significant in the war with Russia.

headline: Delta, pilots reach labor deal with 34% pay hike
body: Delta Air Lines has offered a 34% cumulative pay increase to its pilots over three years in a new contract, demonstrating the bargaining power aviators are enjoying in a short-staffed industry with booming travel demand.

headline: Air Force unveils newest stealth bomber aircraft
body: The Air Force on Friday unveiled its newest stealth bomber aircraft, the B-21 Raider, in Palmdale, California. Built by Northrop Grumman, the bomber was named in honor of the “courageous spirit” of airmen who carried out the surprise World War II Doolittle Raid.

headline: Saudi Arabia plans one of the world’s biggest airports
body: The planned King Salman International Airport outside Riyadh, which will be designed by Foster + Partners, will be one of the world’s biggest airports with no fewer than six runways, carrying 185 million passengers by 2050.

headline: Dow in bull market after Powell suggests rate hikes will ease
body: The stock market will respond to reports on GDP and jobs, speeches by Jerome Powell and Janet Yellen, and to business leaders speaking at the DealBook conference Wednesday.

headline: Tesla delivers its first electric Semi trucks promising 500 miles of range
body: Tesla made the first deliveries of its Semi truck to customers Thursday evening, five years after the heavy-duty hauler was first unveiled. The event included two truck cabs decked out in the livery of Pepsi and Frito-Lay, PepsiCo’s snack foods subsidiary.

headline: Airbus reveals plans for hydrogen fuel cell aircraft
body: Airbus has announced plans for a new hydrogen-powered fuel cell engine which it will test on its largest plane, the A380 superjumbo.

headline: The innovations making aviation greener
body: As the industry aviation attempts to decarbonize, a new generation of aircraft is emerging, which does away with fossil fuels.

headline: Why China launched three astronauts into space
body: China marked a major achievement for its space program after launching three astronauts to its nearly completed space station. CNN’s Kristin Fisher reports.

headline: FULL SHOW 11/30/2022: Why the worst probably isn't over for stocks
body: Rosenberg Research’s David Rosenberg weighs in on what to expect next from the Fed. Plus, BlackRock’s Gargi Chaudhuri shares her 2023 investor guide. And Trivago CEO Axel Hefer describes surging travel demand this holiday season.

headline: Richard Branson on the risk of starting a new airline in the '70s
body: Billionaire CEO Richard Branson talks to CNN about the risk he took when launching Virgin Atlantic in the 1970s.

headline: Fans around the world flock to watch Lionel Messi play at Qatar 2022
body: Walk around Doha and it isn’t long before you hear people talking about Lionel Messi.

headline: In pictures: The rise and fall of Sears
body: Sears was both the Walmart and Amazon of its time.

headline: 'High-stakes rescue from high voltage power lines': Responders save 2 in plane crash
body: Responders managed to rescue both the pilot and the passenger after a private plane crashed into a transmission tower in Maryland, resulting in a power outage for 120,000 people. CNN’s Pete Muntean reports.

headline: A new airline is planning low-cost transatlantic flights
body: Fly Atlantic, a new budget airline offering low cost transatlantic flights, plans to start operating in summer 2024. It will fly to the US from its Belfast base, as well as launching short-haul intra-European routes.

headline: Hasbro CEO: What games are hot — and not — this holiday season
body: Hasbro CEO Chris Cocks sits down with CNN Business’ Paul R. La Monica to break down what toy and game shoppers can expect on shelves ahead of this Black Friday and holiday season.

headline: The innovations making aviation greener, one flight at a time
body: As the industry aviation attempts to decarbonize, a new generation of aircraft that does away with fossil fuels is emerging.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway: Warren Buffett further unwinds BYD investment in China
body: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway is continuing to unwind its long position in BYD, China’s largest home-grown EV maker and Tesla’s major rival, after holding it for 14 years.

headline: What is Bud Zero, the only beer Budweiser can sell at the World Cup?
body: In a surprise reversal, Qatar announced a ban of alcoholic beer at the eight stadiums hosting the World Cup. That leaves fans with just one “beer” choice — albeit one that isn’t boozy.

headline: FIFA confirms no alcohol to be sold at Qatar World Cup stadiums
body: Just two days before the World Cup kicks off in Qatar, soccer’s world governing body FIFA confirmed that no alcohol will be sold at the eight stadiums which will host the tournament’s 64 matches.

headline: India’s first private rocket Vikram-S is launched into space
body: Indian startup Skyroot Aerospace launched the country’s first privately developed rocket, Vikram-S, into space on Friday with support from the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO).

headline: Porsche unveils 911 Dakar, an off-road beast
body: Porsche introduced the 911 Dakar, a special off-road version of its classic 911 sports car. Porsche says the model has been tested over 10,000 KM and can handle extreme conditions.

headline: Analyst: Musk 'circus' is hurting Tesla
body: Wedbush research analyst Dan Ives explains why Tesla shares have been removed from his company’s Best Ideas List after Elon Musk’s Twitter takeover.

headline: Jeff Bezos’ top tips for managing the economic downturn
body: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos recently warned consumers and businesses they should consider postponing large purchases in the coming months as the global economy contends with a downturn and faces a possible recession.

headline: Warren Buffett’s company buys $4 billion stake in Taiwanese chip giant TSMC
body: Shares of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company surged on Tuesday after Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway disclosed that it had purchased a $4.1 billion stake in one of the world’s largest chipmakers.

headline: New York Times: Amazon plans to lay off thousands of employees
body: Amazon is planning to lay off some 10,000 employees in corporate and technology jobs, the New York Times reported on Monday, citing anonymous sources with knowledge of the matter.

headline: Tech stocks have been crushed. What’s next for the FAANGs?
body: The great bull run for tech stocks may finally be over. It has been a brutal year for the leading companies of Silicon Valley. How bad as it been? Consider this. Apple is down about 16% in 2022…and that makes it the “best” performer in Big Tech.

headline: Video shows moments before planes crash during airshow
body: Two World War II-era military planes collided in mid-air and crashed at Dallas Executive Airport during an airshow, killing all on board, officials said.

headline: Exclusive: Jeff Bezos offers his advice on taking risks right now
body: In an exclusive interview with CNN’s Chloe Melas, Jeff Bezos, Executive Chair of Amazon, explains what he meant when he tweeted that folks should “batten down the hatches.”

headline: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez tell CNN why they chose Dolly Parton for $100 million award
body: CNN entertainment reporter Chloe Melas asks Amazon.com founder Jeff Bezos and his longtime partner Lauren Sanchez why they chose country music star Dolly Parton as the latest Bezos Courage and Civility Award recipient.

headline: Exclusive: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos says he'll give away his wealth
body: In an exclusive interview, Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and partner Lauren Sanchez tell CNN’s Chloe Melas why they awarded Dolly Parton $100 million for charitable causes and what other plans they have for Bezos’ massive net worth.

headline: Vintage military aircraft collide mid-air at Dallas air show
body: A Boeing B-17 Flying Fortress and a Bell P-63 Kingcobra collided and crashed at the Wings Over Dallas airshow around 1:20 p.m. on Saturday, according to the Federal Aviation Administration.

headline: Watch divers discover Space Shuttle Challenger wreckage from 1986
body: Divers searching for sunken World War II aircraft instead find space-age wreckage

headline: Piece of 1986 Space Shuttle Challenger found in Atlantic by film crew
body: Explorers trudged the Atlantic Ocean searching for World War II artifacts lost at sea, but they stumbled on something else — a 20-foot-long piece of debris from the Space Shuttle Challenger, which exploded shortly after liftoff in 1986. CNN’s Kristin Fisher has the details.

headline: Indonesian plane’s faulty throttle reported 65 times before fatal crash: investigators
body: A faulty automatic engine throttle system that was not properly monitored by pilots led to a deadly January 2021 crash of a Sriwijaya 737-500 jet, Indonesia’s air accident investigator KNKT said in a final report on Thursday.

headline: AN-225: Plans to rebuild world’s largest plane confirmed
body: The Antonov AN-225, which was destroyed in the early stages of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, will be rebuilt to the tune of $500 million, its manufacturer has announced.

headline: This jet fuel is made from CO2 pulled from the atmosphere
body: Air Company is on a mission: to help lower the airline industry’s global carbon emissions with carbon-neutral jet fuel made from CO2 already in our atmosphere. CNN Business’s Clare Duffy visited the company’s facility in Brooklyn, New York to see if fuel made from thin air could power airplanes in the future.

headline: This company wants to make air travel sustainable
body: In 2019, Air Company made a splash when it launched vodka derived from recaptured carbon, in an effort to reduce the amount of the harmful greenhouse gas in the atmosphere.

headline: FULL SHOW 11/09/2022: What the midterm results mean for the stock market
body: Stocks have been volatile since Fed Chief Jerome Powell signaled more big rate hikes ahead. Defiance ETF’s CEO & CIO Sylvia Jablonski weighs in. And high inflation is causing consumers to make choices. Stew Leonard Jr., CEO of the supermarket chain of the same name, discusses rising prices and his outlook for the grocery industry.

headline: CNN reporter measures airline seats and puts them to the comfort test
body: Experts say airline seats have gotten smaller over the years while Americans grow larger. Under pressure from Congress and passengers, the Federal Aviation Administration is now looking into whether seats are too tight to rapidly evacuate as well as comfort complaints. CNN’s Pete Muntean reports.

headline: Elon Musk sold nearly $4 billion worth of Tesla stock since Twitter deal closed
body: Elon Musk sold $3.95 billion worth of Tesla stock since completing his purchase of Twitter late last month.

headline: Covid restrictions cloud airshow debut of China’s Comac C919 jet
body: China staged a low-key but historic debut of its C919 civil jet at its biggest airshow on Tuesday, with some delegates unable to attend the scaled-down event because of Beijing’s zero-Covid policy as cases reached the highest level in six months.

headline: A recession in the US is not a slam dunk, Goldman Sachs says
body: While investors, business leaders and some economic models continue to warn a recession is imminent, Wall Street’s most powerful investment bank remains cautiously optimistic.

headline: Ryanair is booming as flyers ditch pricier airlines
body: Ryanair carried a record number of passengers over the summer and says its budget friendly airfares will attract even more customers as Europe falls into a recession.

headline: World Bank president: We're facing a global recession in 2023
body: The US economy added 261,000 jobs in October and the unemployment rate rose to 3.7%, according to the latest monthly jobs report from the Bureau of Labor Statistics. CNN’s Jim Sciutto spoke with World Bank President David Malpass for his perspective on what this means for the global economy.

headline: The latest in luxurious first-class airplane suites: Building up
body: The latest development in making airlines’ ultraswanky first-class experiences even more luxurious isn’t about adding more width or length to the suites. It’s about private, high-wall supersuites.

headline: Shipping giant Maersk warns of ‘dark clouds on the horizon’
body: The spike in shipping rates since the onset of the pandemic has been a huge boon for Maersk. But the Danish shipping giant is warning its business will have to endure tougher times soon.

headline: United pilots reject contract as airline negotiations ramp up
body: A shortage of airline pilots is leading pilots at America’s largest carriers to push for better pay and benefits.

headline: Watch: SpaceX completes first Falcon Heavy mission in three years
body: SpaceX completed its first mission with the Falcon Heavy rocket since 2019, launching satellites into space for the US military.

headline: SpaceX’s Falcon Heavy rocket, world’s most powerful rocket, launches after three-year hiatus
body: SpaceX’s Falcon Heavy, the most powerful operational rocket in the world, launched out of Florida on Tuesday morning, marking the first flight for the rocket in more than three years.

headline: Gareth Southgate: Workers in Qatar are united in wanting World Cup to happen
body: Engalnd manager Gareth Southgate says he has met ‘a lot of workers’ in Qatar and they ‘want the football to come’ to the Gulf state.

headline: Delta pilots say they’re willing to strike, but no impact to Thanksgiving travel is expected
body: Delta Air Lines pilots intensified their push for improved pay by insisting they will strike if they do not get a new contract.

headline: Video shows frightening moment before damaged plane makes emergency landing
body: A LATAM Airlines plane was damaged traveling from Santiago, Chile, to Asunción, Paraguay. The vessel had to make an emergency landing after experiencing “severe weather conditions during its flight path,” the airline said in a statement. CNN’s Kim Brunhuber reports.

headline: Dow bursts higher after US economy grows more than expected
body: Here’s the latest news on what stocks are doing.

headline: See moment Elon Musk entered Twitter's headquarters holding a sink
body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, who is the process of acquiring Twitter, entered the company’s headquarters carrying a sink.

headline: Boeing reports unexpected loss after taking hits from Air Force One, Starliner programs
body: Boeing reported an unexpected loss in the third quarter Wednesday after taking a massive $2.8 billion charge related to its high profile defense and space businesses, including completing the new versions of Air Force One and its much delayed Starliner space capsule.

headline: How Disney bought the crown jewel of Murdoch's empire
body: “The Murdochs: Empire of Influence” explores one of the world’s most powerful media families and it complicated history. The series finale airs this Sunday 10 p.m. ET.

headline: Investigators find a ‘possible safety issue’ with tail section of the seaplane that killed 10 after crashing in Mutiny Bay, Washington
body: Federal investigators are asking the manufacturer of a seaplane that plunged into a Washington state bay last month to mandate inspections of the plane’s tail section, citing an issue that could potentially lead to a possible loss of airplane control.

headline: Passengers in fatal Boeing 737 MAX crashes are ‘crime victims,’ US judge says
body: A US judge in Texas ruled on Friday that people killed in two Boeing 737 MAX crashes are legally considered “crime victims,” a designation that will determine what remedies should be imposed.

headline: Donald Trump’s Boeing 757 rehabbed and back in West Palm Beach
body: Whether Donald Trump is prepared to take-off on another bid for the presidency remains up in the air, but his fabled Boeing 757 is definitely getting off the ground.

headline: This man built a plane for his family in his garden
body: Mechanical engineer Ashok Aliseril Thamarakshan built an aircraft from scratch during the pandemic and now hopes to use it fly his family around Europe.

headline: Stocks soar on hopes that Fed will slow rate hikes
body: A disastrous earnings report from Snap and less than inspiring results from Dow components American Express and Verizon weren’t enough to keep the Wall Street bulls at bay Friday. Stocks surged on hopes that the Federal Reserve may soon come to the rescue by slowing the pace of its rate hikes.

headline: Flight data reveals Trump's jet has been taking pattern flights
body: Donald Trump’s Boeing 757 has a new paint job and has been seen on the tarmac in West Palm Beach, Florida. CNN’s Kate Bennett explains.

headline: American Airlines: Our customers aren’t buying international first class tickets. So we’re eliminating them
body: American Airlines expanded on its plan to drop first-class seats on its international flights and replace them with more business class seats.

headline: Twitterverse vigilance scares LVMH CEO into dumping his private plane
body: Luxury goods mogul and LVMH CEO Bernard Arnault has dumped his private jet after Twitter users took to tracking his every plane trip to make an example of how the rich and their rarefied lifestyles are polluting the environment.

headline: Virgin Boeing 747 to launch rocket into space
body: Virgin Orbit arrives in the UK: The space company’s first international launch will see a jumbo jet take off from the runway of Newquay Airport, before launching seven satellites into space.

headline: Watch this rocket ignite using fuel that you can eat
body: In Maine, far from NASA’s Cape Canaveral, bluShift Aerospace is working on sending rockets to space using bioderived, carbon-neutral fuel. And yes, you can even eat it. The company gave CNN exclusive camera access to its third rocket engine test to see if the future of suborbital launches could be bio-powered.

headline: The US is spending billions to boost chip manufacturing. Will it be enough?
body: The United States government is pulling out all the stops to boost domestic semiconductor manufacturing, injecting billions of dollars into the beleaguered sector and flexing all policy muscles available to give it a leg up over competition from Asia.

headline: Goldman Sachs overhauls banking and trading units
body: Goldman Sachs announced a major reorganization Tuesday as the Wall Street powerhouse grapples with market volatility.

headline: Video shows scene where Russian jet crashed into building
body: At least 13 people have died after a Russian SU-34 fighter jet crashed into a residential building in the western city of Yeysk during a training flight Monday, according to Russian state media and authorities. CNN’s Salma Abdelaziz reports.

headline: 'I suddenly started to weep': Shatner describes feeling of grief coming back from space
body: William Shatner joins CNN’s Anderson Cooper to talk about his new book “Boldly Go: Reflections on a Life of Awe and Wonder.”

headline: Massive whale-shaped plane appears in the sky for first time in over a decade
body: Airbus’ unusual “Beluga” cargo plane made its first delivery to the US since 2009, transporting a satellite to the Kennedy Space Center.

headline: Dow soars back above 30,000
body: Stocks rallied sharply Monday, thanks to more strong earnings from big banks and a sigh of relief about new plans by the United Kingdom to scrap a controversial tax cut plan.

headline: Tesla investors try to look past Elon Musk’s many, many distractions
body: Elon Musk now wants to buy Twitter after all. While that’s good news for Twitter’s long-suffering shareholders, Tesla investors hope he still has some time for them. They need a little help, too.

headline: Bird strike after takeoff sends United Airlines flight back to Chicago
body: A bird strike shortly after takeoff sent a United Airlines flight back to Chicago’s O’Hare International Airport on Friday, the airline said.

headline: Stocks roar back after plunging at the opening bell
body: Here’s the latest news on what stocks are doing.

headline: 'Bad timing': Elon Musk's company can no longer fund its vital service to Ukraine (2022)
body: Elon Musk’s company SpaceX, which services one the most critical pieces of technology in Ukraine’s fight against Russia, says it can no longer donate terminals for financial reasons. This statement comes amid questions around Musk’s support for Ukraine. CNN’s Alex Marquardt has the story.

headline: Stocks dip after JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon warns of recession
body: So much for a sleepy Columbus Day on Wall Street. Stocks weren’t doing much Monday morning but took a turn lower in the afternoon following stark comments from JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon, who warned that the United States is likely to enter a recession within the next six to nine months.

headline: Air France and Airbus charged with involuntary homicide for Rio-Paris crash in 2009
body: The trial of two of France’s biggest companies began Monday over the crash of Air France flight 447 in 2009 that killed 228 passengers and crew.

headline: Stocks sink after hotter-than-expected jobs report
body: Here’s the latest news on what stocks are doing.

headline: Tesla set to deliver long-delayed electric trucks to Pepsi in December
body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said Thursday that production of its Semi truck has begun, and deliveries to one customer, Pepsi, will occur in December.

headline: Big companies keep leaving Chicago. What’s going on?
body: Tyson Foods is the latest company closing its Chicago-area offices, joining Boeing, Caterpillar and Citadel among others.

headline: In pictures: SpaceX’s historic Crew-5 launch
body: SpaceX and NASA launched a crew of astronauts on a trip to the International Space Station on Wednesday from the Kennedy Space Center in Florida.

headline: These vehicles are powered by hydrogen fuel cells
body: From trains and planes to passenger cars and haul trucks, hydrogen fuel cells are powering more and more transport options.

headline: A look at the world's first hydrogen-powered haul truck
body: First Mode has developed a hydrogen-powered haul truck, the first of its kind to be used in the mining industry.

headline: SpaceX and NASA send international astronauts to space
body: SpaceX and NASA launched a crew of astronauts who hail from all over the world on a trip to the International Space Station Wednesday.

headline: StockX CEO: Here's how we authenticate sneakers, trading cards before sale
body: StockX is a platform to buy and sell sneakers, trading cards and other high-priced collectibles. CEO Scott Cutler breaks down how the company authenticates the products before sale.

headline: US Navy’s latest and most advanced aircraft carrier deploys for first time
body: The US Navy’s newest and most advanced aircraft carrier left on its first deployment Tuesday from Norfolk, Virginia, designed to put the ship through its paces and exercise with allies in North America and Europe.

headline: Micron to invest up to $100 billion to build chip factory in upstate New York
body: Micron on Tuesday said it would invest up to $100 billion over the next two decades to build a massive semiconductor factory in upstate New York. The move comes in the wake of US government efforts to boost domestic chip production.

headline: Video: Tesla debuts robot 'Optimus' that can dance and water plants
body: Elon Musk says “Optimus,” the AI humanoid robot teased by Tesla in 2021, can now complete simple tasks – thanks in part to the company’s “full self-driving” technology.

headline: Video: Tesla debuts robot 'Optimus' that can dance and water plants
body: Elon Musk says “Optimus,” the AI humanoid robot teased by Tesla in 2021, can now complete simple tasks – thanks in part to the company’s “full self-driving” technology.

headline: Firefly successfully launches unmanned rocket
body: Texas-based commercial rocket company Firefly launched a rocket into space Friday morning, about a year after a previous attempt ended in an explosion.

headline: Another major brand is discounting its extra inventory
body: Add Nike to the list of brands and stores discounting excess merchandise to clear it off shelves.

headline: Here’s how to get your hands on a piece of an Airbus A380
body: An Airbus A380 has its parts up for auction. The Emirates airplane MSN13 was in operation from 2008 to 2020, and was scrapped in October 2021. Now you can own a piece of it.

headline: Watch world's first all-electric plane soar through test flight
body: Alice, the world’s first all-electric passenger plane developed by Israeli company Eviation, completed its first test flight. The company says it will now work on developing an FAA-certified aircraft.

headline: Alice, the first all-electric passenger airplane, takes flight
body: The world’s first all-electric passenger aircraft has successfully taken to the sky.

headline: Intel is the Dow’s biggest loser
body: Semiconductors are in everything. Our phones, our laptops, our televisions. Even our cars. But concerns about a global recession and continued worries about supply shortages stemming from lingering pandemic-related shutdowns in Asia over the past two years are hurting top chip companies.

headline: The airports that travelers dread
body: A Middle Eastern airline has been named the best in the world, a New York-area airport has been named the worst for US customer satisfaction and Canada was the world leader for airport delays this summer.

headline: The world’s best airline for 2022 named
body: Airline review site Skytrax has revealed its 2022 rankings of the world’s best airlines, with an old favorite taking the number one spot and a controversial newcomer to the awards being named the best low-cost carrier in Europe.

headline: Goldman Sachs warns of more trouble for US stocks
body: Even Goldman Sachs is succumbing to the gloomy mood on Wall Street by abandoning its previously optimistic stance and warning that US stocks will end the year deeply in the red.

headline: NYT writer: Murdoch turning on Trump, giving airtime to DeSantis
body: Based on Jonathan Mahler and Jim Rutenberg’s New York Times Magazine article, the new CNN series “The Murdochs: Empire of Influence” explores the world’s most powerful media family. It premieres Sunday, September 25, at 9 p.m. ET.

headline: Boeing agrees to pay $200 million for misleading the public about the 737 Max
body: Boeing and its former CEO Dennis Muilenburg agreed to pay hefty fines to settle charges from the Securities and Exchange Commission that they misled the public about the safety of the 737 Max following two fatal crashes in 2018 and 2019.

headline: Skytrax ranks the world’s best airlines for 2022 (photos)
Mix of boat and plane: See an electric seaglider take flight
body: Boston-based startup REGENT completed a test flight of its all-electric seaglider using a quarter-scale prototype. This vehicle is a mix of boat and plane that will “float, foil and fly” above the water.

headline: JPMorgan Chase CEO warns policy makers to be 'prepared for the worst'
body: CEO of JPMorgan Chase Jamie Dimon told policy members during a House Financial Services Hearing to be “prepared for the worst” when asked about the likelihood that the Fed would achieve a “soft landing” in their efforts to combat inflation.

headline: American Airlines reveals new premium suites with privacy doors
body: Privacy doors and lie-flat seats with a chaise lounge option are features of the new premium Flagship Suites that American Airlines plans to roll out on its long-haul fleet in 2024.

headline: Saudi Arabia buys pair of SpaceX astronaut seats from Axiom
body: Saudi Arabia is planning to launch two astronauts to the International Space Station aboard a space capsule from Elon Musk’s SpaceX, becoming the latest Gulf nation to strengthen ties with private U.S. space companies, according to three people familiar with the arrangement.

headline: Is a recession coming? Look to corporate earnings
body: CNN’s Chief Business Correspondent Christine Romans explains what corporate America can tell us about the health of the US economy going forward.

headline: Wonder where the economy is heading? Keep an eye on earnings
body: Corporate America is starting to brace for a recession.

headline: An Indian tycoon just ousted Jeff Bezos as world’s second-richest person
body: Jeff Bezos just lost his status as the world’s second-richest person, dropping to No. 3 as Indian business mogul Gautam Adani rapidly climbs the ranks of Bloomberg’s Billionaire Index.

headline: Video shows moment US military jet is taken down over neighborhood
body: A routine training military jet was supposed to land at Naval Air Station Joint Reserve Base Fort Worth. Instead, a bird flew into the aircraft and caused a crash in a Lake Worth neighborhood that hospitalized the pilot instructor and the student.

headline: Stocks fall after FedEx warns of global recession
body: US stocks fell on Friday after FedEx served investors a brutal pre-earnings announcement about the state of the global economy.

headline: United CEO on FAA air traffic controllers: ‘They need more’
body: United Airlines considers government air traffic controller staffing shortages its top concern and says there is still time to minimize the impact on holiday travel this winter.

headline: Dow tumbles as America’s prices keep rising
body: Here’s the latest news on what stocks are doing.

headline: Chevron CEO: 'Painful' energy crisis could push Europe into recession
body: Chevron Chairman and CEO Mike Wirth speaks with CNN anchor Poppy Harlow about Europe’s energy “vulnerability” and responds to calls for an export ban on US oil.

headline: See moment Blue Origin rocket catches fire during launch
body: A Blue Origin rocket experienced a “booster failure” during an uncrewed launch of its New Shepard rocket, triggering an abort system that allowed the capsule to parachute to earth. CNN space and defense correspondent Kristin Fisher explains how this could impact the company.

headline: Bash asks Senate Intel chair for answers on Mar-a-Lago search
body: On CNN’s State of the Union, Senate Intelligence Committee Chairman Mark Warner tells Dana Bash that his committee has still not been briefed on the search at President Trump’s Mar-a-Lago home.

headline: Pentagon halts deliveries of F-35 fighter jets after discovering a component manufactured in China
body: The Pentagon says it’s temporarily stopping deliveries of Lockheed Martin Corp’s F-35 aircraft after learning from the manufacturer an alloy made in China was in a component of the stealth fighter jet, violating federal defense acquisition rules.

headline: These companies are looking at using rockets to blast cargo across the planet
This country expanded its Navy fleet in a major way
body: After a seventeen-year wait, India has inducted its first domestically built aircraft carrier, the INS Vikrant. India now joins only a small number of nations with more than one aircraft carrier or helicopter carrier in service. CNN’s Vedika Sud reports.

headline: Porsche plans blockbuster IPO in the coming weeks
body: The iconic Porsche brand is officially going public despite stomach-churning stock market turbulence that’s frozen out other big deals.

headline: Private Cessna aircraft crashes off coast of Latvia after NATO jets scrambled
body: A private jet crashed into the Baltic Sea off the coast of Latvia on Sunday, hours after NATO jets were scrambled to follow the plane.

headline: Stolen plane 'mostly intact' after crashing into field
body: Officials in Tupelo, Mississippi, provide an update on the person suspected of stealing a small plane and threatening to intentionally crash into a local Walmart. CNN’s Pete Muntean has the details.

headline: Man in custody after threatening to crash plane into Mississippi Walmart, police say
body: A Tupelo Aviation employee allegedly stole a plane at the Mississippi city’s airport early Saturday and threatened to crash into a local Walmart, police say. Follow news updates here.

headline: How airlines give you internet access at 35,000 feet — and why it still needs a lot of work
body: Flights used to be a chance to sit back (albeit a bit cramped) and watch a recently released movie or catch up on some reading. Now they’re just another place to log on.

headline: Why NASA canceled launch of massive new rocket
body: CNN’s Kristin Fisher explains the issues that led to NASA calling off the Artemis I launch for a second time.

headline: India’s first homegrown aircraft carrier puts it among world’s naval elites
body: India joined an elite league of the world’s naval powers on Friday, when it commissioned its first domestically built aircraft carrier, the INS Vikrant.

headline: A Delta airliner and a small plane came within ‘close proximity’ last month in Orlando. The FAA is investigating the incident
body: The Federal Aviation Administration is investigating an incident at the Orlando airport last month in which a Cessna single-engine plane and a Delta Boeing 757 came within “close proximity” to one another, the agency said.

headline: Starbucks names new CEO
body: Starbucks has tapped Laxman Narasimhan as its next CEO.

headline: US orders Nvidia and AMD to stop selling AI chips to China
body: Two of America’s top chipmakers have been ordered to stop selling some of their technology to China that can be used for artificial intelligence.

headline: FULL SHOW 8/31/2022: Inflation, the Fed, and market jitters: What's next for stocks?
body: Klarna CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski discusses the future of the ‘buy now, pay later’ business model. And Goldman Sachs’ Joe Duran talks strategy as stocks close the books on August.

headline: Stocks sink as Fed Chair Jerome Powell promises ‘forceful and rapid’ action on inflation
body: Here’s the latest news on what stocks are doing.

headline: Pilots from a bankrupt airline were just offered jobs by a competitor without a single interview
body: Pilots are in high demand lately – such high demand, in fact, that pilots from the recently defunct ExpressJet Airlines are finding themselves with new job offers, without so much as an interview, days after their employer declared bankruptcy.

headline: NASA and Boeing push back first Starliner astronaut mission to 2023
body: NASA and Boeing are now targeting early 2023 for the first crewed flight of Boeing’s long-delayed Starliner spacecraft, officials said during a joint press conference Thursday.

headline: Video: Satellite images show US launching retaliatory airstrikes in Syria
body: The United States carried out more airstrikes in Syria following a rocket attack that injured US troops, according to a US official. The conflict between the US and Iranian-backed groups in Syria is escalating and unfolding quickly, reports CNN’s Oren Liebermann.

headline: United Airlines CEO puts some flight cancellation blame on the federal government. Here's why.
body: With Labor Day around the corner, the pressure is ramping up for airlines to perform. CNN’s Pete Muntean sits down with the CEO of United Airlines for an exclusive look at how they are trying to attack the issue.

headline: A company that operates thousands of crypto ATMs plans to go public
body: Fintech Bitcoin Depot plans to list in the United States by merging with blank check company GSR II Meteora Acquisition Corp in a deal valued at $885 million, the companies said on Thursday.

headline: Why Tesla’s stock is so much cheaper today
body: Tesla’s stock price is set to drop at the opening bell Thursday, but not because of anything Elon Musk tweeted about demand for electric vehicles, ‘full self-driving’ features, SpaceX updates, silly memes or his legal battle with Twitter.

headline: The best sales to shop today: Thermacell, Casper, Tweezerman and more
body: Today, you’ll find a deal on the Sony A90J TV (65-Inch), discounted Beats Studio 3 and savings on Casper. All that and more below.

headline: ExpressJet Airlines, formerly under United, files for bankruptcy
body: ExpressJet Airlines, which calls itself a “reboot” of the company formerly flying as Delta Connection and United Express, filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy Monday in Delaware and ceased operations, according to the company website.

headline: Photos: Inside the world’s largest model airport and model railway
body: Take a peek inside Miniatur Wunderland in Hamburg, Germany, a tourist attraction which offers a bird’s eye view of our world, including a scaled down airport where tiny aircraft take off and land.

headline: Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway wins OK to buy 50% Occidental stake
body: A US energy regulator on Friday gave Berkshire Hathaway, the company controlled by billionaire Warren Buffett, permission to buy up to 50% of oil company Occidental Petroleum Corp’s common stock.

headline: DeLorean is back with its first prototype in 40 years
body: Legendary and long-defunct automaker DeLorean comes back with its all-electric prototype Alpha5. The newly-revived brand says it plans to put a version of the Alpha5 into production.

headline: Missile strikes wine warehouse. See how company is fighting back
body: When a Russian missile hit this warehouse outside of Kyiv, owned by a well-known Ukrainian wine importer, it caused an estimated loss of $15 million. CNN visits to see how the company is saving many of the bottles once stored here, despite the destruction.

headline: Photos: Traveling the world as one of the first Black Pan Am flight attendants
body: In the summer of 1969, 20-year-old Sheila Nutt was selected to be one of the first Black flight attendants on Pan American World Airways. See photos of Nutt’s career here.

headline: NASA rolls out mega rocket Artemis I ahead of lunar mission
body: NASA crawlers transport the massive Artemis I rocket from the assembly building to the launchpad at Kennedy Space Center in Florida. CNN’s Kristin Fisher reports.

headline: American Airlines agrees to purchase 20 supersonic jets
body: American Airlines is placing a bet on a future in which supersonic jets might return to the skies, shuttling passengers on some routes at speeds roughly twice as fast as current commercial aircraft.

headline: Walmart+ has an Amazon Prime Video competitor
body: Walmart+ — in its effort to become a true competitor to Amazon Prime — will offer Paramount+ as part of its membership offering, the companies announced Monday.

headline: American Airlines cuts 31,000 flights from its November schedule
body: American Airlines is once again cutting its flight schedule, slashing 16% or 31,000 flights during November.

headline: La FIFA destaca a 5 delanteros que debutarán en Qatar 2022, conócelos aquí
body: La FIFA destacó a 5 jóvenes delanteros que jugarán su primer mundial en Qatar 2022. Hay dos jugadores sudamericanos en el listado, mira de quién se trata.

headline: Beasts of the skies and bomb-ravaged city tours
body: This week in travel news: A tour company is urging travelers to visit Ukraine’s bomb-ravaged cities – against international advisories. And Emirates CEO Tim Clark tells CNN he wants Airbus to build a new super-jumbo to replace the A380.

headline: United Airlines puts $10 million behind plan to shuttle customers by electric aircraft
body: United Airlines gave a $10 million deposit to a startup developing electric aircraft — all for the goal of shuttling customers to and from the airport by air rather than gridlocked roadways.

headline: United Airlines put a deposit on these 'flying taxis.' Here's what they can do
body: Adam Goldstein, founder and CEO of Archer Aviation Inc., says the company is building an Electric Vertical Take-off and Landing (eVTOL) aircraft meant to be used for trips that are less than 100 miles.

headline: The A380’s biggest supporter is asking Airbus to build a new super jumbo
body: With the A380 out of production, the two biggest planes on the market are the Airbus A350-1000 and the upcoming Boeing 777-9, and deliveries for both are delayed. Emirates boss Tim Clark thinks they’re too small to replace the A380s in his fleet.

headline: This airline is restarting flights to Russia
body: Wizz Air Abu Dhabi is restarting flights to Moscow. But although it’s a legal move, experts warn it could turn into disastrous PR for the European budget airline Wizz Air, its umbrella company.

headline: Dow surges as inflation finally cools off
body: Here’s the latest news on what stocks are doing.

headline: Elon Musk sells nearly 8 million Tesla shares
body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk sold 7.9 million shares of Tesla in recent days, raising $6.9 billion with the sales.

headline: Warren Buffett’s company lost $44 billion last quarter, but it’s not really bad news
body: Warren Buffett is just like the rest of us. He got crushed by the plunge in the stock market during the first half of the year. But the Oracle of Omaha is undeterred by the wildness on Wall Street. Berkshire Hathaway is still buying.

headline: JetBlue airplane clips wing of Southwest jet at LaGuardia Airport, FAA says
body: The wing of a JetBlue Airways plane clipped the wing of a Southwest Airlines jet at New York’s LaGuardia Airport Sunday morning, the Federal Aviation Administration said.

headline: This is a great time to be an airline. It’s the worst time to be a passenger
body: US airlines just had one of the most lucrative quarters in history. Passengers are suffering for it.

headline: How a wood-fueled restaurant made it into the Michelin Guide
body: The Michelin Guide has finally arrived in Dubai, and among its starred restaurants is 11 Woodfire.

headline: Alibaba shares pop as revenue beats expectations
body: Alibaba just posted flat revenue growth for the first time since becoming a public company, but investors don’t seem to mind.

headline: FULL SHOW 08/03/2022: Veteran strategist thinks worst is over for stocks
body: Is the worst over for the market? Yardeni Research’s Ed Yardeni says yes. Plus, Sofi’s Liz Young offers strategy for investing in this volatile market. And what’s the plan for Frontier Airlines now that its planned merger with Spirit Airlines has fallen through? CEO Barry Biffle weighs in.

headline: How a little-known stock soared 21,000% to overtake Costco
body: The Wallstreetbets army is back.

headline: Here's why Speaker Pelosi took a longer route to Taiwan
body: The US air force jet carrying US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi to Taiwan was seen on an air traffic tracking website taking a longer than usual route, potentially avoiding flying northeast over the South China Sea, where China has been building up its military presence in recent years. CNN’s Will Ripley has more.

headline: Private jet aviation is soaring across West Africa
body: With private travel demand on the rise in Africa, young airlines across Senegal and Nigeria are looking to capitalize.

headline: What it’s like inside Boeing’s new 777X
body: Described as “the world’s largest and most efficient twin-engine jet,” the Boeing 777X was originally scheduled to enter into service in 2020, but the launch of the jetliner has been beset by delays.

headline: Alibaba stock slides in Hong Kong after US delisting threat
body: Alibaba shares fell after US regulators added the stock to a growing list of Chinese firms that might be kicked off Wall Street if US auditors can’t inspect their financial statements.

headline: Boeing averts strike at three defense plants, for now
body: A union representing nearly 2,500 employees at three Boeing defense locations in the St. Louis area said on Saturday they will vote on the company’s revised contract offer, canceling a strike that was set to start early Monday.

headline: Video appears to show Chinese rocket debris burning up in atmosphere
body: Remnants of the massive Chinese rocket that was descending uncontrollably back to Earth re-entered the atmosphere over the Indian Ocean, the US Space Command said on Twitter.

headline: US approves Boeing inspection and modification plan to resume 787 deliveries
body: The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration on Friday approved Boeing’s inspection and modification plan to resume deliveries of 787 Dreamliners, two people briefed on the matter told Reuters.

headline: Late night hosts roast JetBlue's deal to buy Spirit
body: Late night hosts poked fun at JetBlue’s deal to buy Spirit Airlines for $3.8 billion, a merger that could create the fifth-largest airline in the US.

headline: Congress passes bill boosting US semiconductor production
body: The House of Representatives on Thursday passed a long-awaited bill aimed at boosting US semiconductor production in a bid to increase American competitiveness, a bipartisan achievement that will send tens of billions of dollars into American manufacturing and scientific research.

headline: How new legislation would help US semiconductor maker
body: Semiconductor maker GlobalFoundries says the industry will “double between now and 2030.” CNN’s Miguel Marquez takes a look at how the Chips Act funding will benefit the company and the economy.

headline: Amazon beats expectations to avoid tech earnings slump
body: Amazon appears to still be going strong even as other Big Tech companies stumble amid pressure from inflation and an economic downturn.

headline: JetBlue announces a deal to buy Spirit Airlines. Fares could surge
body: JetBlue Airways on Thursday announced it would purchase Spirit Airlines, a combination that would create America’s fifth-largest airline.

headline: South Korea joins supersonic fighter club as KF-21 jet takes to skies
body: South Korea’s homegrown KF-21 Boramae fighter jet flew for the first time on Tuesday, putting the country among the few nations to have developed and flown an advanced supersonic fighter.

headline: Stocks rise as Fed announces historic rate hike
body: Here’s the latest news on what stocks are doing.

headline: See CNN's coverage of the first crew on the International Space Station in 2000
body: Russia announced it will quit the International Space Station after 2024, ending decades of partnership with the US and other nations. Watch CNN’s coverage in 2000 when the first US-Russian crew boarded the ISS.

headline: This counts as good news for Boeing
body: Boeing has become so embattled, the company’s stock rose even after reporting a worse-than-expected loss and sales that came in $900 million short of forecasts.

headline: What it’s like inside Boeing’s new 777X
Delta wants to eliminate current crowded airport screens
body: Delta wants to eliminate current airport screens cluttered with information from dozens of flights. Instead, the company is testing technology at Detroit Metropolitan Wayne County Airport that allows up to 100 travelers to privately see their personal flight information on the same screen.

headline: Alibaba stock jumps after announcing Hong Kong primary listing
body: Alibaba announced a plan to allow more mainland Chinese investors to invest in the stock.

headline: First on CNN: Elizabeth Warren demands airline crackdown amid travel chaos
body: Air travel is a mess right now and Sen. Elizabeth Warren is demanding that federal regulators do something about it.

headline: This delivery startup was valued at more than $11 billion. Then it slashed thousands of workers
body: In early March, after two ultra-fast delivery startups shut down in New York City in a single week, a self-proclaimed pioneer in the space appeared to see an opportunity for some media attention.

headline: Boeing defense workers set to go on strike
body: Workers at Boeing’s defense plants in the St. Louis area are threatening to go on strike next week after union members rejected the company’s final contract offer.

headline: Video shows plane crash into ocean near crowded beach
body: A small plane glided down into the ocean while pulling a banner over Huntington Beach, California. CNN affiliate KCAL/KCBS has the story.

headline: A pilot was seriously injured after a small plane crashed near a San Jose neighborhood
body: A small plane crashed near a neighborhood by the Reid-Hillview Airport in California on Friday night.

headline: Boom Supersonic unveils new design for Overture supersonic jet
body: Almost two years after rolling out its prototype supersonic demonstrator, the XB1, Boom has unveiled a major redesign for its much anticipated Overture airliner, which will fly at twice the speed of today’s subsonic commercial jets.

headline: Billionaire Mukesh Ambani is bringing Pret A Manger stores to India
body: One of the world’s richest men is launching Pret A Manger in India, adding the British coffee and sandwich store brand to a huge business empire that spans energy, retail and telecommunications.

headline: American and United airlines return to profitability
body: American and United airlines both reported their first operating profit since the start of the pandemic, as strong demand for air travel and high fares allowed the carriers to overcome rising fuel prices.

headline: Hear Goldman Sachs CEO's message to the Biden administration
body: During an interview with CNN’s Poppy Harlow, Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon discusses what he wants the Biden administration to do to address nationwide economy and inflation concerns.

headline: The CEO of Goldman Sachs is worried about a recession
body: The CEO of one of America’s largest banks is worried inflation will remain problematic for a while longer — and he thinks there’s a growing chance of a recession.

headline: A380 superjumbo to test experimental open fan engine
body: The world’s largest passenger plane, the Airbus A380, has been recruited as a flight test demonstrator to trial new open fan engine architecture which could cut CO2 emissions by 20%, compared to today’s most efficient engines.

headline: Goldman Sachs CEO: Public safety is the fabric of our existence
body: Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon shares his stance on the Supreme Court’s ruling on abortion rights and gun laws with CNN’s Poppy Harlow.

headline: The world's 'most fuel efficient' commercial airplane wants to make flying cheaper
body: Otto Aviation says its aircraft is the “most fuel efficient” commercial aircraft in existence. The company announced it will soon be powered by hydrogen and offer “cheaper” travel for distances up to 1,000 miles.

headline: He went to orbit on a SpaceX rocket. Now, he’s working for its archrival
body: One of four passengers who joined SpaceX’s first-ever space tourism mission last year and who spent months training on the company’s spacecraft before taking a three-day trek to orbit is now working for Blue Origin, one of SpaceX’s top rivals.

headline: Delivery of new Air Force One planes delayed again
body: Boeing’s delivery of two new Air Force One planes has been delayed again, the Air Force announced Tuesday, with the completion of the first of the new presidential planes not expected for at least another four years.

headline: Opinion: The pilot shortage is about to get a lot worse
body: With too few pilots to meet demand, the industry is likely to be in store for even higher airfares, more reductions in schedules and routes, and a contraction of the nation’s regional airline network.

headline: Delta to buy 100 Boeing 737 MAX 10 planes
body: Delta Air Lines will buy 100 Boeing 737 MAX 10 jets worth about $13.5 billion at list prices and has options to buy another 30, the US carrier said on Monday.

headline: Goldman Sachs still rules Wall Street: Earnings blow away forecasts
body: Goldman Sachs is clearly still the top dog on Wall Street. The investment banking powerhouse reported earnings and revenue Monday morning for the second quarter that easily topped analysts’ forecasts.

headline: Google’s stock just got a lot cheaper
body: One share of Google’s parent company Alphabet is suddenly a lot more affordable for Main Street investors — following a massive stock split that took effect Monday.

headline: How an Adidas sneaker made this Dubai restaurant famous
body: In Dubai, Ravi is known for serving up authentic Pakistani dishes. But lately, the buzz has been around a pair of exclusive Adidas sneakers.

headline: Video: Pilot deploys parachute, plane crashes into sidewalk outside Bruges
body: Bruges Police say the two-seater aircraft landed nose first but caused minimal damage to a street sign and fence in the area.

headline: Dow sinks as recession fears grip Wall Street
body: Here’s the latest news on what stocks are doing.

headline: Summer travel: Airline bosses still hopeful despite surges and setbacks
body: Airlines and airports are scrambling to keep up with the pent-up demand for travel. Speaking at the IATA meetings in Qatar, aviation bosses are confident they can meet the challenge.

headline: 1,000 bags. Zero passengers. Delta flight from Heathrow latest sign of air travel hell
body: Delta Air Lines took what it called a “creative” step to solve a massive baggage problem for passengers flying through troubled Heathrow Airport. Others might call the move extreme: the airline flew a plane from London to its hub in Detroit packed with 1,000 lost bags and zero passengers.

headline: Emirates slams Heathrow ‘incompetence’ over summer ‘airmageddon’
body: Emirates airline has blasted one of the world’s busiest airports for its “incompetence” in failing to handle a surge in passengers.

headline: World’s best airlines for 2022, ranked by AirlineRatings.com
body: AirlineRatings.com has released its annual round-up of the best airlines. Find out which airline got the top spot and why.

headline: Photos: The world’s best airlines for 2022, according to AirlineRatings.com
body: Click through to see photos of the top 10 airlines, according to AirlineRatings.com’s 2022 ranking.

headline: Biden Cabinet official delivers blunt message on stalled semiconductor chips bill: ‘Time’s up. It’s time to make it happen’
body: Secretary of Commerce Gina Raimondo on Wednesday had a blunt message about stalled legislation that would address a critical shortage in semiconductor chips.

headline: Boeing delivers a 737 Max to one of the airlines that suffered a fatal crash of the plane
body: Ethiopian Airlines took delivery of a 737 Max from Boeing in June, the aircraft maker disclosed Tuesday.

headline: Is Warren Buffett ditching China’s electric car giant? Investors think so
body: It looks like Warren Buffett has given up on BYD, China’s biggest home-grown electric vehicle maker.

headline: Why the A380 superjumbo is staging a comeback
body: The world’s largest passenger plane seemed to be on the scrapheap as fleets were grounded during the pandemic. Now the A380 seems to be roaring back into the skies.

headline: Video shows Spirit Airlines flight on fire after landing
body: All passengers on a Spirit Airlines flight from Tampa to Atlanta are safe after the breaks on the plane’s landing gear ignited when it landed. In a statement, Spirit thanked first responders and said the plane will be temporarily removed from service for maintenance. CNN’s affiliate WSB has the story.

headline: The world’s biggest passenger plane is staging a comeback
body: Airbus sounded the death knell for the world's largest passenger plane when it ceased production in 2019, but while its fortunes faltered even further during the pandemic, the A380 is now back in demand.

headline: Flying hotel concept is designed to accommodate 5,000 passengers
body: Engineer Hashem Al-Ghaili shared a YouTube video of the nuclear-powered flying hotel concept, based on a 3D model created by artist Alexander Tujicov.

headline: Biden’s pick for FAA administrator would be the agency’s first Black permanent leader
body: The White House on Wednesday announced that President Joe Biden is nominating Phil Washington to lead the Federal Aviation Administration. If confirmed, he would be the first Black permanent administrator of the agency.

headline: Airbus A380 ‘flew 14 hours’ with hole in side
body: Passengers traveling on an Emirates flight to Brisbane, Australia were stunned when they noticed a huge hole in the side of the aircraft while they were disembarking.

headline: US and South Korean F-35 stealth fighter jets team up for first time in message to North Korea
body: Top-of-the-line F-35 stealth fighter jets from the United States and South Korea are teaming up for the first time in a 10-day exercise meant to send a message to North Korea.

headline: Airplane cabin innovations from saunas to sleeping pods
body: This week in travel news, there’s Air New Zealand’s economy sleeping pods, Lufthansa Technik’s superyacht-inspired airplane concepts, plus “flying” ferries, solar-powered cars and hybrid airships.

headline: Hear one travel analyst's tips for flying during the holiday weekend
body: Airline and travel analyst Henry Harteveldt tells CNN’s Pamela Brown his advice for navigating the busy travel season in the midst of airline cancellations and delays.

headline: SpaceX gets approval to bring Starlink internet to airplanes, RVs
World’s fastest passenger jet goes supersonic in tests
body: The race to resume supersonic passenger flights nearly two decades after the retirement of Concorde was offered a glimmer of excitement on Monday when plane manufacturer Bombardier revealed high speed achievements while confirming the launch of its new business jet.

headline: Pioneering NASA official on aerospace industry: ‘Bro-culture’ is bad for business
body: Lori Garver spearheaded the NASA program that paved the way for SpaceX to return human spaceflight to the United States after a decade-long wait. In her new book and in a recent interview she reflects on that success, the controversial cast of characters driving this new space race, and the cultural issues that permeate the aerospace industry at large.

headline: The stock market posted the worst first half of any year since 1970
body: Here’s the latest news on what stocks are doing.

headline: Schwab top strategist: Consumers 'much better prepared' for downturn compared to Great Recession
body: Schwab Asset Management CEO Omar Aguilar explains why companies and consumers are better positioned financially today to deal with an economic downturn compared to the Great Recession.

headline: Lufthansa is bringing back the A380 superjumbo
body: The German airline is reinstating the superjumbo on flight schedules beginning summer 2023, even as other carriers are looking to phase out the world’s largest passenger plane.

headline: Toyota pide a los propietarios no conducir sus camionetas eléctricas BZ4X
body: La Toyota advirtió a los propietarios de sus camionetas SUV eléctricas BZ4X que dejen de manera inmediata de conducirlas ya que las ruedas podrían aflojarse y caer. Aquí los detalles

headline: More than 700 flights canceled Sunday
Never mind China’s new aircraft carrier, these are the ships the US should worry about
body: China made a big statement about its naval ambitions with the recent launch of its third and most advanced aircraft carrier.

headline: Elon Musk says Tesla factories are 'losing an insane amount of money'
body: During an interview with a Tesla owner group, Elon Musk said supply chain issues are affecting Tesla factories in Germany and Texas. He claimed that the issues are causing the factories to lose billions of dollars.

headline: Warren Buffett must really love oil. Berkshire boosts Occidental Petroleum stake
body: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway is betting that the oil boom isn’t going to end any time soon.

headline: Jeff Bezos’ ship, named for his mom, will no longer be used to catch rockets
body: Jeff Bezos — the billionaire founder of Amazon and rocket company Blue Origin — made a grand public announcement a year ago that he purchased a ship to capture Blue Origin rockets after they return from space, and he named the vessel after his mother. But now the company says it is doing away with that plan, seeking a more “cost effective” alternative, Blue Origin spokesperson Linda Mills said.

headline: Plane crash-lands in Miami after landing gear failure
body: A plane crash-landed and caught on fire on a Miami International Airport runway after its landing gear collapsed. Three people were hospitalized with minor injuries. CNN’s Carlos Suarez reports.

headline: A new airline for China's Greater Bay Area
body: Kristie Lu Stout speaks to Greater Bay Airlines CEO Algernon Yau about his plans to launch passenger flights in Hong Kong.

headline: Naomi Osaka and LeBron James launch new media company
body: Four-time major winner Naomi Osaka is launching a new media company in partnership with NBA superstar LeBron James, the tennis star has announced.

headline: What sitting in economy on Qantas’ 20-hour flights will be like
body: New ultra-long-haul flights between Sydney and New York and London will break aviation barriers. But what will passengers in the cheaper seats have to endure?

headline: Tras la disolución del gobierno en Israel, ¿puede Benjamín Netanyahu volver alpoder?
body: Como consecuencia de la decisión que tomaron el Primer Ministro de Israel, Naftali Bennet, y el ministro de Asuntos Exteriores, Yair Lapid, de disolver el Parlamento y convocar a elecciones, Benjamín Netanyahu podría volver al gobierno a solo un año de su destitución. ¿Qué puede significar esto para Israel? José Levy cuenta los detalles en CNN Primera Mañana.

headline: Boeing unveils new 777 ‘ecoDemonstrator’ test jet
body: Boeing has just revealed its new 2022 ecoDemonstrator plane – a converted, 20-year-old 777-200ER tasked with testing new technologies aimed at making air travel more sustainable and safer.

headline: An unfinished building has been named 2022’s top attraction
body: This week in travel news, a double-decker airplane seat goes viral, America’s top restaurants are honored at the James Beard Awards, and Tripadvisor has named the top attractions for 2022.

headline: With thousands of flights canceled, Buttigieg privately urges airline CEOs to improve
body: Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg has urged airline executives in a private conversation to review their flight schedules and take other steps to soften the impact of summer flight cancellations, numbering in the thousands in the past two days.

headline: See China launch its most advanced aircraft carrier
body: The Fujian is equipped with catapult launch technology, similar to US carriers, and is named after a Chinese province close to Taiwan.

headline: China launches third, most advanced aircraft carrier named ‘Fujian’
body: China on Friday launched its third and most advanced aircraft carrier from Shanghai’s Jiangnan Shipyard, with new combat systems that experts say are fast catching up with the United States.

headline: Walgreens Boots Alliance CEO: I took steps down to advance my career
body: At a CNN Business live event about Juneteenth and Black leadership, Walgreens Boots Alliance CEO Rosalind Brewer shared with CNN’s Stephanie Elam the non-linear trajectory that her career took in order for her to be able to climb into the c-suite.

headline: Chipmakers brace for more trouble as Russia limits exports of rare gases
body: The semiconductor industry just can’t catch a break. After two years of pandemic-fueled supply bottlenecks, Russia, one of the world’s biggest suppliers of industrial gases used to make chips, has started to limit its exports.

headline: Lego is building up its manufacturing footprint in the US
body: Lego is planning to build a $1 billion factory in Virginia. CEO Neils Christiansen talks with CNN’s Julia Chatterley about expanding the company’s business.

headline: This European airline just ordered a fleet of airships
body: Air Nostrum, a Spanish airline, has ordered 10 Airlander 10 aircraft to make regional journeys around Spain.

headline: ‘Floating’ airplane cabin could be the future of travel
body: The Crystal Cabin Awards celebrate the most innovative new airplane cabin designs. The 2022 winners, announced June 14 at 2022 Aircraft Interiors Expo (AIX) in Hamburg, Germany, could revolutionize the way we fly.

headline: Stocks rise after the Fed takes historic action on inflation
body: Here’s the latest news on what stocks are doing.

headline: Caterpillar to move headquarters from Illinois to Texas
body: Industrial conglomerate Caterpillar, Inc. is moving its global headquarters from suburban Chicago to suburban Dallas, the company announced Tuesday.

headline: Here’s what it might be like to travel on a double decker airplane seat
body: Airplane seat designer Alejandro Núñez Vicente reckons his double-decker airplane seat could revolutionize budget air travel. CNN went to the 2022 Aircraft Interiors Expo in Hamburg to try it out.

headline: See a double decker airplane seat prototype
Transforming an A330 into a yacht-like luxury experience
body: The Airbus A330 is a classic widebody aircraft. It offers sufficient space for a large number of novel cabin ideas and also a sufficiently large range to fulfill special wishes.

headline: Transforming an A330 into a yacht-like luxury experience
body: Germany’s Lufthansa Technik has developed a cabin concept for customized private planes that takes inspiration from another must-have item for the wealthy – the superyacht.

headline: Tesla stock is about to get much cheaper
body: Tesla shares are about to get three times less expensive.

headline: Tech wreck: Goldman Sachs cuts Netflix, Roblox and eBay to ‘sell’
body: Tech stocks have been obliterated this year. The Nasdaq is down more than 26%, putting that index in a bear market. Unfortunately for investors, analysts at Goldman Sachs see more pain ahead for some (but not all) tech heavyweights.

headline: How far will Operation Fly Formula shipments really go to fill America’s store shelves?
body: The first shipments from the federal government’s Operation Fly Formula will bring a total of nearly 1 million pounds of baby formula powder into the United States. That’s just a fraction of what the nation’s families need – about the same amount of formula typically sold over two days in the US – but it is a jump-start to easing the shortage.

headline: Two Air Force Ones, one big mess for Boeing
body: Editor’s Note: This story is part of CNN Business’ Nightcap newsletter. To get it in your inbox, sign up for free, here.
