headline: Alibaba and JD.com stocks rally on hopes tech crackdown may be over
body: Shares in Chinese tech companies have surged this week on hopes that Beijing is close to ending a yearlong regulatory crackdown on the industry.

headline: Amazon’s stock price is set to drop, but that won’t make it cheaper
body: For many average investors, the price of just one Amazon share has been prohibitively expensive. There are a lot of things a person can spend about $2,500 on instead of one tiny piece of “Prime” stock market real estate. A nice vacation? That home entertainment system? Season tickets for your favorite sports team?

headline: US takes action against two private planes owned by Russian oligarch Roman Abramovich
body: A US judge approved the seizure of two of Russian oligarch Roman Abramovich’s private planes, valued at more than $400 million, for violating US export and sanctions laws.

headline: JetBlue increases offer for Spirit Airlines as bidding war heats up
body: JetBlue on Monday improved its offer for smaller rival Spirit Airlines in an attempt to outstrip competition in the race to buy the low-cost carrier.

headline: The economy is going into the toilet. Let’s hope no one flushes it!
body: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon says an economic hurricane is coming. Tesla’s Elon Musk says he has a “super bad feeling” about a recession. Companies are downgrading their earnings forecasts. Oh, and we’re in the midst of an energy and inflation crisis, and stocks have been flirting with a bear market.

headline: Airlines are scrambling as 'demand has come roaring back'
body: CNN’s Pete Muntean reports on how the airline industry is preparing for an increase in travel demand as it juggles crew shortages and weather issues.

headline: With rocketing demand but a stunted travel industry, 2022 is shaping up to be one hot mess of a summer
body: Flight cancellations, delays and rocketing prices – welcome to travel in 2022.

headline: JPMorgan Chase CEO warns of an economic 'hurricane'
body: Jamie Dimon, CEO of JPMorgan Chase, spoke at the Bernstein Strategic Decisions Conference about economic headwinds. CNN’s Christine Romans unpacks his comments.

headline: What if airplanes were wider? Plane interior concept re-imagines inflight seating
body: Aviation interior consultancy LIFT Aero Design has developed a concept that allows airlines to adjust the size of seats according to demand, making the case for wider airplanes.

headline: United Airlines donates flights to ship formula from UK to US via ‘Operation Fly Formula’ flights
body: United Airlines is becoming the first major airline carrier to donate flights to ship baby formula from abroad to the United States as the federal government works to address the ongoing shortage, the White House announced Wednesday.

headline: This Italian airline just got a sassy new look
body: ITA Airways, Italy’s new flag carrier airline, has unveiled plans for new uniforms, new plane interiors, and menus planned by Michelin-starred chefs.

headline: Qatar Airways CEO defends 160 extra daily flights at ‘climate-neutral’ World Cup
body: Qatar Airways will partner with regional carriers to shuttle World Cup ticket holders into Doha and back from neighboring countries just for the day, drawing criticism from climate action advocates.

headline: What is it like to fly on a small plane compared to a big plane?
body: Everything you need to know about small plane safety, speed and more.

headline: Russia and China are ahead of US in hypersonic missile technology. Here's why
body: Russia and China are ahead of the US in developing and testing hypersonic missile technology, especially when it comes to building wind tunnels. CNN’s Kristin Fisher has the details.

headline: How this hospitality company is adapting to changes in the workforce
body: AccorHotels CEO Sébastien Bazin tells CNN’s Richard Quest how the company is managing a changing work landscape and adapting to shifting needs amid a labor shortage.

headline: Norwegian settles dispute with Boeing and buys 50 737 Max jets
body: Norwegian Air has agreed to buy 50 Boeing 737 Max 8 aircraft and secured options for a further 30 of the planes at an undisclosed price, ending a contract dispute between the two companies, the budget carrier said on Monday.

headline: Forget FAANG, it’s all about LVMH
body: To most investors, navigating today’s stock market is as treacherous as walking the plank. But for luxury investors, it’s more like strutting down the catwalk.

headline: Travel news: Supersonic jets, solar planes and underground railways
body: This week in travel, London opened a $25 billion new metro line, Bombardier announced a breakthrough for their supersonic jet, and America’s best beaches have been revealed.

headline: Pfizer CEO pledges vaccines to low-income countries at zero profit
body: Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla shares Pfizer’s plan to bring all its existing and future vaccines to 45 low-income countries at zero profit. Bourla also discusses with CNN’s Richard Quest the goal and challenge of developing an annual Covid vaccine.

headline: Chipmaker Broadcom to buy cloud services firm VMware in $61 billion deal
body: Chipmaker Broadcom is buying cloud services provider VMware in a cash-and-stock deal valued at $61 billion to speed up its expansion into the enterprise software business.

headline: Maradona tribute plane unveiled in Argentina
body: An aeroplane dedicated to Argentine great Diego Maradona was unveiled on Wednesday ahead of a journey that will end at the World Cup in Qatar later this year.

headline: Boeing’s Starliner capsule makes safe return from test mission
body: Boeing’s Starliner spacecraft made a safe return home from its five-day stay at the International Space Station on Wednesday, concluding a long-awaited test mission that could pave the way for the Starliner to launch astronauts for the first time later this year.

headline: Samsung plans to create 80,000 new jobs with $356 billion investment
body: Samsung on Tuesday outlined a plan to pour more than $350 billion into its businesses and create tens of thousands of new jobs over the next five years.

headline: Here’s what happened during Boeing’s ‘nail-biting’ spacecraft docking
body: Boeing managed to dock a spacecraft at the International Space Station late last week, but it was not without several minor hangups.

headline: Stocks surge thanks to big rally for JPMorgan Chase and other banks
body: Investors took a break from selling in May and going away, for one day at least.

headline: Intel CEO on why semiconductors are more important than energy
body: Intel CEO Patrick Gelsinger says geopolitics has been too focused on oil reserves and argues that building semiconductor fabrication plants should be the priority.

headline: CNN10: The big stories of the day, explained in 10 minutes
body: The U.S. ups its support for Ukraine, shipments of baby formula are flown into America, gas and diesel prices hit new records, and a stock index raises concerns.

headline: Baby formula arrives in Indianapolis from Germany on US military aircraft to address critical need
body: A shipment of 35 tons of baby formula has arrived Sunday in Indianapolis on a US military aircraft from Germany to address a nationwide shortage.

headline: Watch first military shipment of baby formula arrive in the US
body: CNN’s Polo Sandoval is in Indianapolis where the first shipment of baby formula arrived on a US military aircraft from Germany to address a nationwide shortage.

headline: Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos are getting political on Twitter
body: Brian Stelter discusses the billionaires with Philip Bump and Margaret Sullivan of The Washington Post. Plus, Khaya Himmelman of The Dispatch discusses why the government’s Disinformation Governance Board was doomed.

headline: Intensifying battle between Elon Musk and Twitter
body: The Reliable Sources panel discusses Elon Musk’s insistence that his Twitter takeover is on hold, plus the platform’s newest effort to reduce misinformation.

headline: In unusual step, US military aircraft will transport first pallets of baby formula to US
body: The first flights of the Biden administration’s latest effort to expedite baby formula delivery to the US amid a nationwide shortage will include US military aircraft, a White House official says.

headline: Moody's chief economist: 'Uncomfortably high' risk of recession in US
body: The US is likely headed into recession, but Moody’s Analytics Chief Economist Mark Zandi says the Fed may still be successful with a soft landing.

headline: Boeing successfully launches Starliner, spacecraft that will take astronauts to ISS
body: After a botched launch in 2019, Boeing successfully test launched their Starliner spacecraft that it developed to take NASA astronauts to the International Space Station.

headline: Boeing launches Starliner astronaut capsule on uncrewed test mission
body: Boeing launched its Starliner spacecraft, designed to ferry astronauts to and from the International Space Station, on an uncrewed test mission toward the orbiting outpost Thursday evening. After two prior attempts to complete such a mission failed, Boeing’s goal is to prove the spacecraft can dock with the ISS. It must succeed before it can move on to missions with people on board.

headline: Boeing tries to catch up to SpaceX after plenty of drama
body: Boeing is the world’s largest aerospace company, a primary US defense contractor, and a titan of a global aviation duopoly. A few years ago, the idea that it would dominate commercial space was a given, and companies like SpaceX, a relatively young business relying on a strategy of moving fast and breaking things, would take a back seat to the move level-headed and experienced Boeing.

headline: How soaring diesel prices may impact consumers
body: Diesel prices are soaring to record levels and oil tanks are sitting at alarmingly low levels as demand outpaces supply. CNN’s Vanessa Yurkevich speaks with an oil analyst about how consumers may be impacted.

headline: Flight data suggests China Eastern plane deliberately crashed: Wall Street Journal report
body: Black box data recovered from a China Eastern flight that crashed in March suggests someone in the cockpit intentionally downed the plane, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing a preliminary assessment from United States officials.

headline: WSJ: Flight data suggest Chinese plane crash was intentional
body: CNN’s Pete Muntean details a Wall Street Journal report that says black box data recovered from a China Eastern flight that crashed in March suggests someone intentionally downed the plane.

headline: JPMorgan shareholders vote down pay bump for CEO Jamie Dimon
body: JP Morgan Chase investors on Tuesday voted down a multimillion-dollar payout for CEO Jamie Dimon.

headline: Here's what investors are worried about as retail stocks plunge
body: Target and Walmart shares have dropped, leading the companies into their worst one-day declines since the 1987 market crash. Now investors are worried about stagflation. CNN’s Paul R. La Monica reports.

headline: World’s largest aircraft owner lost 113 planes to Russia due to sanctions
body: AerCap Holdings, the aircraft leasing giant that is the world’s largest owner of jets, lost 113 planes when Russia seized them in response to sanctions triggered by the war in Ukraine.

headline: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway finally bails on Wells Fargo
body: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway has been a top investor in Wells Fargo for the past few years, despite the company’s fake account scandal, overcharging foreign-exchange customers and myriad other problems.

headline: Gravity-defying feats on display at the Red Bull Paper Wings World Final
body: A standard 65-seat school bus spans about 35 feet long.

headline: The Red Bull Paper Wings world paper airplane championship
body: On May 14, the Red Bull Paper Wings World Final took off at Hangar-7, Salzburg Airport. The event is the official paper airplane world championship and first took place in 2006. This year’s edition saw 61,000 hopefuls take part in over 500 “Qualiflyers” around the world.

headline: Ryanair CEO blasts Boeing in expletive-laden remarks about slow delivery of 737 jets
body: Ryanair CEO Michael O’Leary used expletives to air his frustration over recent dealings with Boeing to deliver more 737 jets to the airline.

headline: Boeing needs to get its ‘s*** together,’ Ryanair CEO says
body: The CEO of Ryanair let loose a scathing, obscenity-laden attack on Boeing management Monday, saying company executives need either an immediate “reboot, or a boot up the a**.”

headline: Passenger who landed plane describes moment he took action
body: In an interview with NBC’s “Today,” Darren Harrison describes how he managed to land a plane with zero flight experience after the aircraft’s pilot became incapacitated.

headline: JetBlue launches hostile takeover for Spirit
body: JetBlue is going hostile in its effort to acquire Spirit, the latest twist in an industry battle for the low-cost carrier.

headline: Photos: The best airlines in North America, according to passengers
body: See photos of the top North American airlines for economy passengers according to J.D. Power’s 2022 North American Airline Satisfaction Study.

headline: Video shows airliner on fire after skidding off runway
body: A Tibet Airlines plane caught fire after skidding off the runway in the southwestern Chinese city of Chongqing. The airline says all passengers and crew were safely evacuated.

headline: Passenger plane catches fire during takeoff in southwestern China
body: A Tibet Airlines plane caught fire after skidding off the runway in the southwestern Chinese city of Chongqing on Thursday morning.

headline: A passenger with no flying experience landed a plane at a Florida airport after the pilot became incapacitated
body: “I have no idea how to fly the airplane.”

headline: Over 100 Jewish passengers of German airline say they were denied boarding
body: CNN’s Alexandra Field reports on a German airline, Lufthansa, apologizing after more than 100 Orthodox Jewish passengers weren’t allowed to board a flight due to what the airline says were some of them not following airline mask rules.

headline: Boeing clashes with key supplier ahead of Starliner spacecraft launch
body: Boeing Co. is feuding with Aerojet Rocketdyne, a key supplier for its Starliner spacecraft, as the U.S. aerospace giant races to test launch the uncrewed astronaut capsule and mend its reputation in the space sector, people familiar with the matter said.

headline: Did you see the viral flying Tesla? It wrecked this man's car
body: A flying Tesla went viral and attracted national attention. CNN’s Jon Sarlin explores what caused influencers to descend on a once-quiet Los Angeles street.

headline: See moment passenger lands plane after pilot had medical emergency
body: A passenger with no flying experience safely landed a private plane at a Florida airport with the help of an air traffic controller after the pilot became incapacitated. The condition of the pilot is unknown at this time. CNN’s Pete Muntean reports.

headline: US airline passengers aren’t happy. Here’s why
body: Consumer research company J.D. Power’s 2022 North American Airline Satisfaction Study suggests passenger contentment is declining across the board thanks to packed planes, canceled flights and soaring airfares.

headline: 'It's a decision for Erling,' Borussia Dortmund CEO lifts the lid on Haaland's future

headline: Why this Russian plane could signify a 'warning to the West'
body: A menacing, lumbering jetliner sometimes called the “doomsday plane” or “flying Kremlin,” was scheduled to fly over Russia’s Victory Day celebration but was noticeably absent. CNN’s Brian Todd reports on the mysterious aircraft and its capabilities.

headline: Boeing is losing the plane race. So it packed up and left for Washington
body: Boeing is moving its headquarters from Chicago to a suburb of Washington, DC. But some analysts think this move is one in the wrong direction.

headline: UN ambassador: Russia has put itself on list of state sponsors of terror
body: CNN’s Jake Tapper presses US Ambassador to the United Nations Linda Thomas-Greenfield on whether the United States will add Russia to its list of state sponsors of terrorism.

headline: A small plane crashed into a backyard in Houston. All four people on board walked away
body: A small plane carrying four people crashed into a backyard in Houston on Friday, and all four people on board walked away.

headline: Wall Street is fed up with Under Armour, Nike and Adidas
body: Tripped-up supply chains and a coronavirus surge in China are causing headaches for top athletic brands.

headline: CNN asks Kirby about US intel used by Ukraine to sink Russian warship
body: CNN’s Brianna Keilar asks Pentagon press secretary John Kirby about US intel that was used by Ukraine to sink the Moskva, a major Russian warship, in the Black Sea.

headline: Booking.com CEO: We're seeing positive signs of people wanting to travel
body: Glenn Fogel, CEO of Booking Holdings, joins First Move to discuss the uptick in bookings for travelers in Europe and the US as pent-up demand drives growth.

headline: This solar-powered plane could stay in the air for months
body: Solar Impulse 2 circumnavigated the Earth without using a drop of fuel. Now, Skydweller Aero aims to use the plane to create the world’s first commercially viable “pseudo-satellite.”

headline: Skydweller is flying the flag for zero-emissions aircraft
body: Skydweller Aero aims to turn Solar Impulse 2 into a “pseudo-satellite” powered by the sun. It’s just one a number of aircraft being developed that can operate without using fossil fuels.

headline: May 4, 2022 stock market coverage
body: Here’s the latest news on what stocks are doing.

headline: Watch what it's like inside a Blue Origin flight
body: Dylan Taylor and Cameron Bess, two passengers on a Blue Origin flight in December 2021, reveal details about what it is like inside the capsule, from training to landing.

headline: See renderings of space hotel that could be the future of travel
body: Orbital Assembly Corporation is planning to build Voyager Station and Pioneer Station, two space hubs in the sky. Here’s a peek at what life among the stars might look like.

headline: Qantas reveals details of record-breaking Project Sunrise flights
body: With an order of 12 Airbus 350 planes, Qantas has taken a major step toward launching direct flights between Australia and New York and London.

headline: CNN media analyst says 'we are headed to hell' without Twitter regulation

headline: See Nike's new building honoring tennis star Serena Williams
body: Nike has only a few buildings named after female athletes. Serena Williams just got hers. Check out Nike’s 1-million-square-foot building crafted for its design, insights and product-merchandising teams.

headline: Live updates: Berkshire Hathaway’s annual shareholder meeting
body: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway is hosting its annual shareholder meeting in Omaha, Nebraska. Follow CNN for the latest updates on stock prices, earnings, and more.

headline: NATO scrambles fighter jets to intercept Russian planes
body: NATO fighter jets stationed in both the Baltic and Black Sea regions scrambled “multiple times over the past four days” to track and intercept Russian aircraft near alliance airspace, according to a statement posted by NATO’s Allied Air Command. CNN’s Barbara Starr reports.

headline: Elon Musk sells $8.5 billion worth of Tesla shares
body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk sold $8.5 billion of the electric automaker’s stock in the three days after the Twitter board agreed to sell the company to him.

headline: US astronaut describes needing to borrow Russian cosmonauts' toilet
body: The first all-private mission to the International Space Station brokered by Axiom Space successfully splashed down, but not before the US astronauts needed to borrow Russian cosmonauts’ toilet while in space. AX-1 pilot Larry Connor speaks to CNN.

headline: Boeing ‘probably shouldn’t have taken’ Trump-negotiated Air Force One deal, CEO says
body: Boeing’s CEO on Wednesday called the unusual deal his predecessor negotiated with then-President Donald Trump for the next generation of Air Force One a one-off that he hopes not to repeat.

headline: Hear CEO admit Boeing 'probably shouldn't have' made Air Force One deal with Trump
body: In an earnings call, Boeing CEO David Calhoun said the company “probably shouldn’t have taken” a deal in 2018 negotiated by then-President Trump to build new Air Force One.

headline: Bill Ford on electric pickup truck: 'We are way ahead of everybody else'
body: Ford Motor Company has launched its electric F-150 Lightning pickup truck. The company’s executive chairman Bill Ford shares his perspective on the company’s legacy, and says they’re “so sold out” of the trucks that they had to stop taking orders.

headline: Analyst: Musk leveraging Tesla stock to buy Twitter is like swapping sushi for a hot dog
body: Dan Ives, managing director and senior equity research analyst at Wedbush Securities, breaks down how Tesla and Twitter investors are reacting to Elon Musk’s latest move.

headline: Boeing delays its newest jet as losses soar
body: The bad news keeps piling up for Boeing. The company is delaying the debut of its newest passenger jet to 2025, and it reported a much bigger-than-expected quarterly loss.

headline: The big winner in Elon Musk’s Twitter deal
body: Even the world’s richest person needs financial advice. That’s great news for Morgan Stanley, the investment bank of choice for Elon Musk.

headline: Elon Musk to buy Twitter
body: Twitter said Monday it has agreed to sell itself to Elon Musk in a roughly $44 billion deal. Follow here for the latest news and reaction.

headline: 3 reasons why Deutsche Bank is forecasting a recession
body: Deutsche Bank predicts a “major recession” in the US, amid high inflation and investor concerns. CNN’s Matt Egan reports.

headline: Amazon's proposed new building looks like this emoji
body: The shape of Amazon’s screwy new headquarters inspires mock and awe. CNN’s Jeanne Moos has the best jokes.

headline: Green jet fuel is here – so why are airlines not using it?
body: SAF – Sustainable Aviation Fuel – is a new type of jet fuel that promises to curb carbon emissions by 80% on average. But even before Covid hit the industry, airline takeup was slow

headline: Trump says he won't return to Twitter even if he's reinstated by Musk
body: Twitter agreed to sell itself to Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in a roughly $44 billion deal. CNN’s Brian Todd reports on what has critics concerned about the sale, and why former President Donald Trump may not be returning to the popular social media platform.

headline: Elon Musk to buy Twitter
body: Twitter has agreed to sell itself to Elon Musk in a deal valued at around $44 billion, the company said Monday. Follow here for live updates.

headline: Video shows pilots switching planes mid-air, one crash lands
body: The Federal Aviation Administration is investigating a mid-air stunt that ended with a plane crashing in the Arizona desert after organizers apparently defied a government order.

headline: Elon Musk set to purchase Twitter for $44 billion
body: Twitter’s board has accepted Elon Musk’s offer to purchase the company for $44 billion. CNN reporters Brian Stelter and Matt Egan weigh in on Musk’s quest to take over the social media company.

headline: Mike Tyson appears to hit fellow airplane passenger
body: Former heavyweight boxing champion Mike Tyson seems to have joined the ranks of unruly airline passengers.

headline: Dow falls nearly 1,000 points on rate hike fears and poor earnings from Verizon
body: Stocks plunged Friday.

headline: Forget the FAANGs. It’s a stock picker’s market now
body: investors who have been blindly buying all big techs got a rude awakening this week after Netflix imploded. But the good news from Tesla proves that some top momentum stocks can still thrive in this rocky market.

headline: Video shows Mike Tyson punching passenger aboard plane
body: Video obtained by TMZ Sports appears to show boxing legend Mike Tyson hitting another passenger in the seat behind him while aboard a JetBlue plane in San Francisco.

headline: Budweiser brewer AB InBev is selling its stake in 11 Russian breweries
body: Anheuser-Busch InBev said on Friday it would sell its stake in Russian joint-venture AB InBev Efes which will result in a $1.1 billion impairment charge in its first quarter results.

headline: After two years of losses, airlines expect record revenue
body: After two years of massive losses, US airlines are about to start reporting profits once again.

headline: Ukraine’s Air Force has added about 20 more operational aircraft after influx of spare parts, senior US defense official says
body: The Ukrainian Air Force has added about 20 more operational aircraft to its fleet because of an influx of spare parts, according to a senior US defense official.

headline: 5 unusual airlines that really existed
body: The deregulation of the US airline industry in the 1970s opened the skies to some entrepreneurial and eyebrow-raising ventures, including carriers devoted to pets, worshippers and smokers.

headline: Here’s what to look for in Tesla’s earnings
body: Tesla shareholders have been spending a lot of time following CEO Elon Musk’s grand play to buy Twitter. Come Wednesday night they’ll be focused once again on a company he already controls — Tesla itself.

headline: Plans for New York’s largest ‘all-electric’ skyscraper unveiled
body: Designed by British architecture firm Foster + Partners, banking giant JPMorgan Chase’s new global headquarters is a 60-story skyscraper powered entirely by renewable energy.

headline: Toyota, Volkswagen and Tesla are bringing factories in China back on line
body: Toyota and Volkswagen are gradually bringing their China factories back on line after they were closed for weeks because of Covid lockdowns.

headline: The biggest risk to the global economy no one is talking about
body: Nearly 400,000 million people across 45 cities in China are under full or partial lockdown as part of China’s strict zero-Covid policy. Together they represent 40%, or $7.2 trillion, of annual gross domestic product for the world’s second-largest economy.

headline: Can the world’s largest plane ever fly again?
body: Ukraine has vowed to rebuild the gigantic Mriya AN-225 airplane after it was destroyed in the Russian invasion. While this would restore a symbol of pride for the country, getting this unique Soviet-era aircraft back in the air will be a challenge.

headline: SpaceX’s Falcon 9 launches spy satellites for a second time
body: A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket once again successfully launched a US spy satellite from the Vandenberg Space Force Base in California, the company said.

headline: What the Fed needs to do as recession looms over US economy
body: The Fed is late in handling inflation, Former President and CEO of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York Bill Dudley says. Dudley explains what the Fed needs to do as the US faces risk of a recession.

headline: Airlines are slashing flights due to staffing shortage
body: Airlines are canceling flights across the country due to an overwhelming staffing shortage in the industry. CNN’s aviation correspondent Pete Muntean reports.

headline: China is sending its most advanced fighter jet to patrol disputed seas
body: China has begun sending its most advanced fighter aircraft, the J-20, to patrol the East and South China Seas, Chinese state media has reported.

headline: CNN visited the Moskva in 2015. This is what it looked like on board
body: One of the Russian Navy’s most important warships has sunk in the Black Sea. CNN’s Matthew Chance visited the Moskva in 2015, and this is what it looked like on board.

headline: What's that long skinny thing a restaurant just tried sending to space?
body: It looked like an edible UFO … CNN’s Jeanne Moos reports on the latest attempt at launching an oddball object into space.

headline: Twitter must decide on Elon Musk's $43 billion offer
body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk offered to buy Twitter for $43 billion and wants to take the company private. The next anticipated step is for Twitter’s board to make a decision. CNN’s Christine Romans reports.

headline: Bank earnings signal dark clouds on the horizon
body: Wall Street’s biggest players have had a rough start to the year.

headline: Twitter responds to Elon Musk not joining its board
body: Twitter’s shares traded higher amid news Elon Musk, the social media platform’s largest shareholder, will not be joining its board. CNN’s Clare Sebastian reports.

headline: CNN reporter explains significance of potential missile strike on Russian ship
body: There are conflicting reports about why one of the Russian Navy’s most important warships is either floating abandoned or at the bottom of the Black Sea.  CNN’s Clare Sebastian reports.

headline: Alleghany shareholder sues to block $11.6 billion Berkshire buyout over lack of disclosures
body: Alleghany Corp, which agreed last month to be acquired by Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway Inc, was sued on Wednesday by a shareholder who accused the insurance company of making inadequate and misleading disclosures about the $11.6 billion takeover.

headline: Passengers revolt after plane is forced to land at different airport
body: Passengers on this international Jet Blue flight begged flight attendants to land early due to concerns about bad weather. Jet Blue releases a statement responding that the safety of their passengers is their top priority and their pilots are trained to manage severe weather.

headline: Why modern airplanes have winglets
body: Look out of the window of a passenger airplane, and there’s a good chance you’ll spot an upturned “winglet” at the end of the wing. While they’re a handy place to display the airline’s logo, they also perform some crucial flight roles.

headline: Delta says hiking fares can help it turn a profit as fuel costs surge
body: Travel is booming, and Delta Air Lines boosted ticket prices. That helped the company weather higher fuel costs in the first quarter, and Delta believes it can turn a profit in the second quarter.

headline: Watch CNN's 1981 coverage of Space Shuttle Columbia launch
body: CNN reported on the launch of Space Shuttle Columbia on April 12, 1981 from the Kennedy Space Center in Florida. The spacecraft became the first reusable manned shuttle to travel into space.

headline: Boeing loses more than 90 jet orders due to war in Ukraine
body: Boeing is likely to lose about 90 jet orders due to “geopolitical issues” related to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, the company said Tuesday.

headline: EU blacklists 21 Russian airlines over ‘serious safety concerns’
body: The European Union has blacklisted 21 Russian-certified airlines, including national carrier Aeroflot, over “serious safety concerns.”

headline: See photos of the world’s busiest airports in 2021
body: View photos from the 10 busiest airports in the world for passenger traffic in 2021.

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery: A new media giant
body: Brian Stelter reports that the merger between WarnerMedia and Discovery has taken effect. Claire Atkinson says management’s goal will be creating “a streaming service that is really going to challenge Netflix and Disney.”

headline: See Elon Musk's unusual tweets after becoming largest Twitter shareholder
body: Elon Musk, Tesla’s CEO who just became the largest shareholder in Twitter, has been tweeting about possible changes to the company.

headline: Reporter presses Mitch McConnell on his Trump remarks
body: Axios reporter Jonathan Swan asked Minority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY) why he condemned Trump’s actions after the January 6th insurrection but then later said he would vote for him if he is the Republican nominee in 2024.

headline: SpaceX just launched paying customers to the ISS. Here’s everything you need to know
body: A SpaceX rocket carrying three paying customers and a former NASA astronaut took off from Kennedy Space Center in Florida on Friday morning, kicking off a first-of-its-kind mission that will take the group on a 10-day mission to the International Space Station.

headline: Russia has lost 79 planes to sanctions
body: Sanctions put in place in response to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine have caused the nation’s air carriers to lose 79 of their commercial jets, nearly 10% of their combined fleets.

headline: CEOs at major oil companies come under fire for high gas prices
body: Former Labor Secretary Robert Reich and Resources for the Future Fellow Daniel Raimi join Newsroom to discuss CEOs at major oil companies coming under fire for the rising gas prices and how a solution could be found to benefit consumers.

headline: FULL SHOW 04/06/2022: Why investors are suddenly freaked out about the Fed
body: Charles Schwab’s Liz Ann Sonders offers her strategy for navigating the current volatility. Plus Voyager Digital CEO Steve Ehrlich explains what’s next for the crypto investment firm after state regulators raised questions about a key product. And Primetime Partners’ Alan Patricof looks back on his legendary career in venture capital.

headline: Why the US could be headed toward a recession
body: The US will face a recession, says Deutsche Bank’s Chief US Economist Matthew Luzzetti. He points to “imbalances in the economy” as factors and explains what the Fed would need to do.

headline: Amazon announces huge rocket deal to launch its satellite internet constellation
body: Amazon is moving its business into the exosphere, with plans to deploy more than 3,000 satellites to beam internet connectivity all over the planet. On Tuesday, the company announced deals with three rocket companies that will launch those satellites.

headline: German airline unveils candy-striped aircraft
body: German airline Condor is stepping up its livery game with a simple yet stylish paint job: bold candy stripes designed to evoke summer vacations past and present.

headline: Shanghai to New York in two hours? China joins the hypersonic flight race
body: Shanghai to New York in just a couple of hours? Not a problem when you fly in a hypersonic space plane. Beijing-based Space Transportation (aka Lingkong Tianxing in China) is the latest player aiming to make this prospect a reality.

headline: What Elon Musk's big investment in Twitter could mean
body: Elon Musk bought a 9.2% stake in Twitter, making him the company’s largest shareholder. CNN’s Paul R. La Monica reports.

headline: Images show destruction of world’s largest airplane in Ukraine
body: Its fuselage is a charred and twisted gaping hole. Its gigantic wings are slumped to the ground. After Russian troops left Hostomel airfield outside Kyiv, the extent of damage to Ukraine’s huge AN-225 airplane has been revealed.

headline: Video shows destruction of world's biggest plane in Ukraine
body: A CNN team first saw wreckage of the largest plane in the world after the Russian military withdrew from a strategic airfield outside Kyiv.

headline: SpaceX launched at least 40 satellites last week. Here's why that could be a problem
body: CNN’s Kristin Fisher shows us the impact of a massive increase in satellites in our night skies. GoThere is available on CNN+ – CNN’s new streaming service.

headline: India’s Gautam Adani joins Elon Musk and Warren Buffett in the centibillionaires club
body: India’s Gautam Adani has joined what is probably the most elite club in the world.

headline: Alaska Airlines cancels dozens of flights as pilots picket
body: Alaska Airlines canceled dozens of flights this weekend as its pilots held informational pickets in numerous cities throughout the United States in an almost 3-year-long deadlock in contract negotiations with the airline.

headline: Hear what Zelensky said when asked about strike in Russia
body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky wouldn’t confirm or deny if Ukraine struck a fuel depot inside Russia, but he did suggest it was a valid military target.

headline: Video shows helicopters attacking fuel depot inside Russia
body: Russian authorities say a fire broke out at a fuel depot in Belgorod, Russia, after an air strike coming from two helicopters belonging to the Ukrainian Armed forces. CNN is unable to verify this claim.

headline: Blue Origin rocket launches into space with six passengers onboard
body: Blue Origin has completed it fourth successful crewed suborbital space launch, this time without any of the celebrity names like Michael Strahan or William Shatner that have become a staple of its voyages.

headline: Blue Origin successfully completes fourth space tourism mission
body: Jeff Bezos’ Blue Origin just launched its fourth successful space tourism mission, putting yet another feather in the cap of the company that hopes to make these supersonic joyrides a mainstay of pop culture.

headline: Russian airspace rerouting may create a new world’s longest flight
body: Cathay Pacific’s Hong Kong to New York JFK route could become the world’s longest commercial flight if the airline opts to reoroute over the Atlantic.

headline: An A380 superjumbo just completed a flight powered by cooking oil
body: The world’s largest commercial passenger airliner has completed a test flight powered entirely by SAF – sustainable aviation fuel, composed mainly of cooking oil — an achievement that could help pave the way for greener flying.

headline: Qatar not planning new investments in Russia amid war
body: Qatar’s Minister of Foreign Affairs, Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al-Thani, told CNN’s Becky Anderson at the Doha Forum that investment in Russia is currently “under a lot of review” and Qatar is not thinking about increasing its investments there until there is a “better environment and more political stability.”

headline: Canada edges closer to F-35 jets deal with Lockheed Martin worth up to $15 billion
body: Canada has picked Lockheed Martin Corp as the preferred bidder to supply 88 new fighter jets, Procurement Minister Filomena Tassi said Monday, in a clear sign the US company is set to win the multibillion-dollar contract.

headline: CNN10: The big stories of the day, explained in 10 minutes
body: Two space probes take the heat as they approach our nearest star, inflation hits Americans’ travel budgets, and two companies create an extra-syrupy soda.

headline: FedEx names Raj Subramaniam as CEO, replacing founder Fred Smith
body: US package delivery company FedEx Corp on Monday named Raj Subramaniam as its new chief executive officer effective June 1, succeeding Fred Smith, who founded the company in 1973.

headline: Here’s who’s flying on Thursday’s Blue Origin space launch
body: Pete Davidson was initially slated to be the next headline-grabbing name to take flight aboard the suborbital space tourism rocket developed by Jeff Bezos’ company, Blue Origin, after the commercial space company launched several other famous faces on its previous flights.

headline: How to invest in tech and leave Facebook behind
body: Tech stocks have taken a tumble this year, but some investing experts say there are now plenty of good values in the sector. You just have to look beyond the increasingly tired MT. FAANG stocks.

headline: Elon Musk wants to get to Mars with this behemoth rocket
body: SpaceX says Starship is the most powerful rocket ever built. Here’s everything you need to know about the vehicle Elon Musk plans to use to set up a self-sustaining city on Mars.

headline: Melbourne to Dallas in 17 hours: Qantas announces latest ultra long-haul flight to US
body: As global travel continues to reopen in 2022, there will soon be another addition to the “world’s longest flights” list – a direct route between Melbourne, Australia and Dallas-Fort Worth International Airport (DFW) operated by Qantas.

headline: 'We need to be prepared': Sen. Warner breaks down Russian cyberattack threat
body: On CNN’s State of the Union, Senator Mark Warner joins CNN’s Dana Bash to discuss the potential threat of Russian cyberattacks and the work he’s doing to prevent Russia from evading sanctions.

headline: Boeing’s problems in China go far beyond the latest grounding
body: Another Boeing plane has been grounded after a fatal crash, this time in China. That may be the least of the company’s problems in a crucial market.

headline: All 132 people on board crashed China airliner confirmed dead as second black box recovered
body: All 132 people on board the China Eastern Airlines jetliner that crashed in the densely forested mountains of southern China Monday are dead, China’s aviation authorities confirmed Saturday night.

headline: China Eastern Airlines grounds 223 Boeing 737-800 aircraft after crash
body: China Eastern Airlines is grounding dozens of aircraft after a deadly crash earlier this week.

headline: This company is chartering planes full of cargo to deliver refugees aid
body: California-based freight company Flexport is working to move the supply chain forward to ensure Ukrainian refugees in countries including Poland, Romania and Moldova receive cargo quickly and efficiently. Founder and CEO Ryan Petersen sheds light on the company’s purpose and strategy.

headline: Good news for the economy can be found in these 20 stocks
body: Here’s a promising sign from Wall Street: Transportation stocks are leading the stock market this year, and that could bode well for the broader economy.

headline: Blue Origin announces replacement for Pete Davidson on next space tourism mission
body: Jeff Bezos’ space company, Blue Origin, said it will replace Saturday Night Live star Pete Davidson with a long-time employee on the company’s next supersonic jaunt to the edge of space.

headline: Goldman Sachs’ CEO will perform at Lollapalooza
body: Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon will DJ at Chicago’s Lollapalooza music festival this July alongside acts like Metallica, Dua Lipa, Doja Cat, and Green Day.

headline: Tesla delivers first cars from Berlin factory
body: Tesla opened its third assembly plant near Berlin, Germany, and made the first deliveries of its Model Y sedan there Tuesday.

headline: ‘It’s absolutely critical.’ Ex-Trump official backs Biden’s computer chip push
body: Former Trump national security adviser H.R. McMaster is calling on Congress to swiftly fund investments in American computer chip manufacturing, a plan championed by the Biden administration to address global semiconductor shortages.

headline: No survivors found after China’s worst air disaster in more than a decade, investigators say
body: No survivors of a China Eastern Airlines plane crash have been found after a second day of search efforts, Chinese investigators said late Tuesday.

headline: Wall Street is starting to believe in Alibaba again
body: Alibaba has a message for investors nervous about its slowing growth and geopolitical uncertainty: We think our stock is cheap and we’re putting our money where our mouth is.

headline: India’s IPO boom has rapidly turned to bust
body: From Zomato to Nykaa, many Indian tech companies went public last year, with massive valuations. But they are now languishing way below their listing price. And, Paytm is down over 70%, facing concerns over its path to profitability and regulatory hurdles.

headline: A 737 crashed in China. What we know about the plane
body: A Boeing 737 carrying 132 people crashed early Monday in China. Although Boeing’s 737 has faced extraordinarily high-profile safety concerns over the past three years, the plane that crashed Monday was a different version of the aircraft than the embattled 737 Max that shook Boeing to its core.

headline: Chinese airliner carrying 132 people crashes in southern Guangxi region
body: A China Eastern Airlines jetliner carrying 132 people crashed in the mountains in southern China’s Guangxi region on Monday afternoon, according to the country’s Civil Aviation Administration (CAAC).

headline: Video shows what happened to China Eastern airliner that crashed
body: A China Eastern Airliner jet crashed in the mountains of southern China according to China’s Civil Aviation Administration. All 132 passengers were killed. CNN’s Pete Muntean reports.

headline: Watch a Tesla fly through the air before crashing
body: A video posted by the LAPD shows a Tesla flying over a hill and through the air in Los Angeles. Police are now asking the public for information about the driver.

headline: SpaceX will now launch satellites for top space broadband competitor, OneWeb
body: SpaceX has a new deal to launch internet-beaming satellites for its chief competitor in the satellite business — British company OneWeb.

headline: Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway is buying insurer Alleghany for $11.6 billion
body: It may not be the “elephant-sized” deal that Warren Buffett has long promised, but Berkshire Hathaway is making its biggest acquisition in years: it’s buying insurer Alleghany for $11.6 billion in cash.

headline: Should Americans boycott companies that won't exit Russia?
body: Zelensky told Congress, ‘All American companies must leave Russia.’ And so far, more than 400 American and other multinational firms have stopped doing business in Russia. But dozens of others are digging in or trying to buy time.

headline: Jet fuel prices spike to highest level in 2+ years
body: Airline ticket prices are rising as jet fuel prices spike to the highest level in more than two years. CNN’s Pete Muntean reports.

headline: Photos: Innovative airplane seat concepts shortlisted for the Crystal Cabin Awards 2022
body: See photos of the airplane seat designs shortlisted for this year’s Crystal Cabin Awards, from a double-decker seat to Virgin Atlantic’s latest cabin concept.

headline: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway is making a huge bet on this oil company
body: The Oracle of Omaha is making an even bigger bet on a major oil company as crude prices continue to surge.

headline: Retired brig. general: This weapon is Zelensky's no-fly zone
body: Retired Brig. Gen. Steven Anderson talks with CNN’s Brianna Keilar about what President Zelansky needs in order to fulfill his no-fly zone.

headline: Drone video shows large blaze at Indianapolis distribution center
body: Firefighters have concerns about supplying water to the large blaze at a Walmart distribution center, which broke out on March 16.

headline: Russia moves to seize hundreds of planes from foreign owners
body: Russia is seizing hundreds of commercial jets owned by US and European leasing companies, a further sign of the challenges the country’s airline industry faces due to sanctions following its invasion of Ukraine.

headline: Big oil catered to shareholders while Americans were hit with surging gas prices
body: Americans were hit with soaring gas prices, and ramping up oil production was a potential solution. CNN’s Rene Marsh reports on recently uncovered audio calls that reveal inconsistencies between what fossil fuel companies purported about oil supply, and what their conversations were with shareholders – including offering them higher dividends and stock buybacks.

headline: Stocks surge after Fed rate hike
body: Here’s the latest news on what stocks are doing.

headline: Company's stock price drops after rocket launch
body: When startup Astra launched its latest rocket, it could not confirm the mission was successful for over an hour. Its stock plummeted as investors waited, and never fully rebounded when the mission was confirmed a success.

headline: A look behind the scenes of the Red Bull Plane Swap
body: On April 24, Luke Aikins and Andy Farrington will attempt a world-first, death-defying feat. Teaming up with an aerospace engineer, the pair will try to skydive from two separate planes they each pilot, into the other’s plane and then land the aircraft.

headline: Astra’s stock takes wild ride after rocket launch
Germany will buy US-made F-35 fighter jets as it ramps up military spending after Russia’s Ukraine invasion
body: Germany has announced that it will buy 35 US-made F-35A fighter jets, the first major arms purchase to be publicly confirmed since Chancellor Olaf Scholz committed to ramping up his country’s defense spending in the wake of the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

headline: Turning old airplanes into home offices
body: The newly launched Irish company Aeropod is turning old airplanes into home offices, glamping pods and alternative accommodation.

headline: Pete Davidson and five paying customers to fly on Jeff Bezos’ suborbital rocket
body: Pete Davidson will become the latest celebrity to fly to space with Jeff Bezos’ rocket company, Blue Origin, in a brief, suborbital flight slated for later this month.

headline: Naomi Osaka brought to tears by heckler during tennis match
body: Naomi Osaka was brought to tears after being heckled by a spectator in the crowd during her match against Veronika Kudermetova at the BNP Paribas Open in Indian Wells, California on Saturday.

headline: Sen. Klobuchar on Ukraine: 'I would like to see the planes over there'
body: Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar of Minnesota repeats her call for the United States to facilitate giving fighter jets to Ukraine in an interview with CNN’s Dana Bash.

headline: Flying on Russian planes is about to get much more dangerous
body: As Russia’s economy gets pummeled by increasingly severe western sanctions for its invasion of Ukraine, the country’s crucial airline industry could soon find itself on life support.

headline: Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan are getting out of Russia
body: Goldman Sachs is exiting Russia, becoming the first major Wall Street bank to announce plans to do so after the invasion of Ukraine.

headline: Amazon and Alphabet could give the Dow a 21st century facelift
body: Amazon and Google owner Alphabet are two of the most dominant companies on Earth. Each is worth more than $1 trillion and is a leader in multiple industries. But neither stock is a member of Wall Street’s most exclusive club: the Dow Jones Industrial Average. That may soon change.

headline: Amazon’s stock is about to get much, much cheaper
body: Amazon shares are about to get 20 times less expensive.

headline: All-electric Eviation Alice set to take off
body: Meet what could be the world’s first all-electric commuter aircraft, Eviation’s Alice. It will be ready for its first flight in weeks, according to the company.

headline: Dow tumbles as West considers cutting off Russian oil
body: Here’s the latest news on what stocks are doing.

headline: Corporate exodus from Russia continues and US stocks feel the impact
body: The US stock market tumbles as the military conflict between Russia and Ukraine persists. CNN’s Richard Quest points to uncertainty caused by the exodus of companies from Russia and Ukraine as a reason for the dip. When companies don’t know the next step, the “investment landscape is very dangerous,” Quest says.

headline: Video shows Russian jet falling from the sky
body: CNN’s Arlette Saenz reports on the latest in Ukraine as video shows a Russian fighter jet the Ukrainian government says they shot down.

headline: Dow tumbles after Russian nuclear plant attack
body: Here’s the latest news on what stocks are doing.

headline: Sony and Honda are starting a new company to make electric vehicles
body: Two of Japan’s biggest names in business are teaming up.

headline: US Navy recovers wreckage of jet that crashed into aircraft carrier from South China Sea
body: The US Navy on Wednesday recovered from the bottom of the South China Sea the wreckage of a US military stealth fighter jet that crashed into the deck of a US aircraft carrier in January, the US Navy’s 7th Fleet announced in a news release Thursday.

headline: Pete Davidson in talks to head to space on Jeff Bezos’ Blue Origin flight
body: Pete Davidson might be headed to space.

headline: Russian space chief says Russia will no longer sell rocket engines to the US
body: Russia’s space agency, Roscosmos, will no longer deliver Russian-made rocket engines to the United States, Roscosmos head Dmitry Rogozin said on state television, ending a decades-long relationship between US and Russian rocket makers.

headline: Russia’s largest airline yanked from global reservation systems
body: The technology company Sabre has terminated its agreement with Russian government-owned carrier Aeroflot, crippling its ability to sell seats.

headline: Ford CEO: This is the biggest investment in our company's history
