headline: The teenager who tracked Elon Musk’s jet is now tracking Russian oligarchs
body: Jack Sweeney, a Florida teen who tracks Elon Musk’s private jet online has a new aviation-themed target: Russian oligarchs and billionaires.

headline: Dow tumbles as Russia threatens the West
body: Here’s the latest news on what stocks are doing.

headline: World’s largest plane destroyed in Ukraine
body: The world’s largest plane, the Antonov AN-225, has been destroyed during the Russian invasion of Ukraine, according to Ukrainian officials, generating alarm and sadness among the aviation world in which it occupies almost cult status.

headline: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway posts nearly $40 billion profit
body: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway reported a nearly $40 billion profit in the fourth quarter, up more than 10% from the same period of 2020. Profits more than doubled for the full year, to just shy of $90 billion.

headline: US stocks rise as Russia opens possibility of diplomacy
body: Here’s the latest news on what stocks are doing.

headline: Foot Locker’s stock tumbles 35% because Nike wants to go on its own
body: Foot Locker’s stock tumbled 35% Friday after the shoe store predicted sales and profit would fall sharply this year. The culprit: Nike.

headline: Harold Varner III holes incredible 92-foot eagle putt to win Saudi International
body: Harold Varner III drained a huge eagle putt on the 18th hole of the final round to snatch victory at the 2022 Saudi International. A shot behind Bubba Watson and off the front edge of the 18th, Varner’s hopes had looked to have slipped away. Undeterred, the US golfer hit a winding, weaving putt that eventually found the hole to clinch a dramatic win at the Royal Greens Golf and Country Club.

headline: British Airways cancels Moscow flights as Russia retaliates over Aeroflot ban
body: British Airways has suspended its flights to Moscow after Russia banned all UK carriers from its airspace.

headline: Airbus to test hydrogen-fueled engine on A380 jet
body: The plane manufacturer will use a “A380 flying testbed fitted with liquid hydrogen tanks” to trial propulsion technology for its future hydrogen aircraft.

headline: Video shows explosion after fighter jet shot down, official says
body: A Ukrainian Sukhoi Su-27 fighter jet was shot down over Kyiv early Friday, Ukrainian Deputy Interior Minister Evgeny Yenin tells CNN’s Matthew Chance.

headline: US stocks rebound after West holds back on its most potent sanctions against Russia
body: Here’s the latest news on what stocks are doing.

headline: Latvia's airline suspends overnight flights to Ukraine
body: Latvian-based airline airBaltic has suspended overnight flights to Ukraine amid Russia-Ukraine tensions and ensuing uncertainty in the region. The airline, which has witnessed a surge in bookings compared to the prior year, is communicating with authorities “24/7” and fueling the aircraft in case a sudden return is necessary, says CEO Martin Gauss.

headline: Marriott CEO on Ukraine crisis: We worry about the safety of our guests
body: Marriott CEO Tony Capuano discusses the hotel chain’s challenges in China, and how potential political instability in Ukraine can rattle traveler and customer confidence and the pace of recovery.

headline: The Dow’s top stock of 2021 is off to a rough start this year
body: Home Depot was the Dow’s best-performing stock in 2021, soaring more than 55% thanks to strong demand from consumers in what was a red hot housing market. But shares are off to a bumpy start this year.

headline: CNN10: The big stories of the day, explained in 10 minutes
body: Today’s show explores the history of the up-and-down relationship between the U.S. and China. We’re also examining the interruption of certain avocado exports.

headline: Nike executive Larry Miller faces his dark secret
body: As he was climbing the corporate ladder and becoming friends with stars like Michael Jordan, Larry Miller was concealing a criminal past. CNN’s Sara Sidner reports.

headline: YouTube channel goes viral for man's hilarious commentary for landing jets
body: CNN’s Hala Gorani reports on commercial jets landing in high winds at Heathrow Airport in London.

headline: 'My car is now adrift': Cargo ship fire imperils thousands of luxury cars
body: A cargo ship carrying thousands of luxury cars is abandoned in the middle of the Atlantic ocean after a fire forced the crew to escape.

headline: LBJ adviser describes scene on Air Force Two moments after JFK died
body: Bill Moyers, who served as White House press secretary under President Lyndon B. Johnson, describes the atmosphere inside of Air Force Two when then-Vice President Johnson got sworn in as president in the moments following the assassination of President John F. Kennedy.

headline: World’s first electric plane start up parts ways with CEO in mysterious rift
body: Eviation, the company behind what is supposed to be the world’s first all-electric passenger airplane, has undergone an unexpected change in leadership just before the plane’s projected first flight – and the company and the now-former CEO are offering different takes on the situation.

headline: Charlie Munger defends windowless dorms and China investments
body: A conversation with 98-year old Berkshire Hathaway vice chairman Charlie Munger is never dull.

headline: Airplanes as art: in pictures
body: Canadian Laird Kay trained as a designer – but he always loved planes. Now he’s combined the two, having become an aircraft photographer, specializing in bringing to life the small design elements of airplanes.

headline: FULL SHOW 02/16/2022: Why stocks are sinking and oil is rising
body: Why Goldman Sachs’ Damien Courvalin predicts Brent crude will hit $100 a barrel this year and $105 in 2023. Plus, LPL Financial’s Ryan Detrick says stocks tend to do well a year after the Fed starts hiking rates. And as labor gets more expensive, businesses are turning to cashierless checkout. Standard Cognition’s Jordan Fisher shares how his $1B startup will outfit any store with AI-powered checkout.

headline: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway perfectly timed an out-of-left-field investment
body: Sometimes in investing, a little luck goes a long way. Just ask Warren Buffett. The Oracle of Omaha is set to make a handsome profit from a new investment in video game maker Activision Blizzard that Berkshire Hathaway made during the quarter before Microsoft announced its plans to buy it.

headline: A billionaire CEO is on track to go further into space than any human in 50 years
body: Jared Isaacman — the billionaire CEO of payments processing company Shift 4 — is buying three more flights with SpaceX, the first of which is scheduled for this year and could put Isaacman and SpaceX on track to travel deeper into space than any human has traveled in a half century.

headline: Lockheed Martin terminates $4.4 billion deal to acquire Aerojet Rocketdyne
body: U.S. arms maker Lockheed Martin Corp said on Sunday it terminated its plan to acquire rocket engine maker Aerojet Rocketdyne Holdings Inc for $4.4 billion.

headline: Teenager tracking Elon Musk's jet explains why he's doing it
body: A teenager figured out how to track the movements of Elon Musk’s private jet and posted the information on Twitter. Musk personally reached out to ask him to stop. Jack Sweeney says he is holding out for a free Tesla.

headline: Looking for bargains? Here are the stocks we love
body: Most companies have reported fourth quarter earnings. The biggest takeaway for investors? This is a stock picker’s market. Some companies are thriving while their competitors are not.

headline: Watch: Astra's first-ever satellite launch for NASA ends in failure
body: Rocket startup Astra’s latest unmanned launch, equipped with four satellites, suffered a malfunction during stage separation and tumbled out of control

headline: See pilot rescued seconds before train annihilates his plane
body: A plane crashed onto train tracks in California. Police officers pulled the pilot from the wreckage seconds before an oncoming train destroyed the plane.

headline: Kellogg's CEO on navigating inflation to keep brands on shelves
body: Kellogg’s CEO Steve Cahillane discusses supply disruptions, pricing, their booming snack business and how they strive to keep their demand “as strong as possible” despite price increases.

headline: Mattel CEO: The company is in growth mode
body: Ynon Kreiz, CEO of Mattel, says the company saw the highest annual growth rate in decades last year. After “winning back” Disney Princess and Frozen, Kreiz says they will “continue to develop and grow evergreen franchises.”

headline: Black Hawk helicopter flies itself for the first time
body: A division of Lockheed Martin has developed technology that allows a Black Hawk helicopter to take off, land, and fly itself, even in the face of obstacles.

headline: Big Tech stocks are all over the place. Here's what investors need to know
body: Amazon had its biggest one day gain ever just one day after Facebook’s parent company, Meta, had its biggest one day loss. Lo Toney, founding managing partner at Plexo Capital, explains why and how big cap tech stocks are diverging in market value.

headline: See Samsung's Galaxy S22 smartphone lineup
body: Samsung has unveiled the latest in its Galaxy smartphone lineup, the S22. It features an upgraded camera and a more powerful battery and processing chip.

headline: Maersk CEO sees more supply chain trouble ahead
body: Maersk has a front-row seat to global supply chains. It says more trouble is ahead.

headline: Maersk CEO: We need more labor in the ports
body: Maersk CEO Søren Skou says strong demand and shipping bottlenecks have driven up freight rates, calling it a “perfect storm.”

headline: Delta CEO repeats call for a ‘no-fly’ list for unruly passengers; DOJ responds
body: Delta Air Lines CEO Ed Bastian on Friday reiterated his call for the Justice Department to prosecute unruly passengers and place them on a “no-fly” list. The DOJ responded this week.

headline: Elon Musk launched his own Tesla roadster to space four years ago. Where is it now?
SoftBank's record-breaking chip designer sale to Nvidia called off
body: The $40 billion sale of prized chip designer ARM from SoftBank to US chipmaker Nvidia has officially been called off after regulators shared concerns about the deal, eventually leading to its collapse.

headline: Nvidia to buy chipmaker from SoftBank (September, 2020)
body: Nvidia is buying British chipmaker ARM from SoftBank for as much as $40 billion — a total that would make it the largest semiconductor deal ever.

headline: Newly leaked video shows F-35 crashing in flames on aircraft carrier
body: A video posted on social media over the weekend shows the stealth fighter that crashed on a US Navy aircraft carrier last month bursting into flames as it strikes the flight deck of the massive warship.

headline: See leaked footage of fighter jet crashing into South China Sea
body: The Pentagon confirms the authenticity of newly leaked footage of a F-35 jet crashing onto the deck of an aircraft carrier off the South China Sea. CNN’s Barbara Starr has more.

headline: An airline is asking for an unruly passengers no-fly list. See Buttigieg's response
body: Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg says the US government is looking into implementing a no-fly list for unruly passengers after Delta Airlines CEO Ed Bastian sent a letter requesting a list to the Justice Department.

headline: Spirit and Frontier Airlines plan to merge
body: Spirit and Frontier Airlines on Monday announced a $6.6 billion merger, a combination of low-fare carriers that would create America’s fifth-largest airline.

headline: Frontier and Spirit merger would create the fifth-largest airline in the US
body: Spirit and Frontier Airlines on Monday announced a $6.6 billion merger, a combination of low-fare carriers that would create America’s fifth-largest airline.

headline: Startup jumping into space race with 3D printed rockets
body: Using proprietary tech to 3D print rockets, California-based Relativity Space has dreams of helping build a Mars colony. But they have to get a launch under their belt first.

headline: NASA will retire ISS by crashing it into the ocean
body: NASA plans to retire the International Space Station in 2031 by crashing it into the Pacific Ocean. Retired astronaut Cmdr. Chris Hadfield joins New Day Weekend to talk about the future of space stations.

headline: PlayStation and Switch sales are suffering as the gaming wars heat up
body: Two of the world’s biggest video game companies are feeling the pressure as the console wars heat up.

headline: CNN gets look on board aircraft carrier in Europe amid Russia tensions
body: Amid tensions with Russia, CNN goes on board one of the US Navy’s flagship aircraft carriers while it conducts military drills with other NATO partners in the Mediterranean.

headline: Plane forced to abort shaky landing seconds after wheels touch ground
body: A British Airways flight was attempting to land at London’s Heathrow Airport when high winds forced the pilots to abort its shaky landing.

headline: Retired British Airways jet transformed into $1,300 per hour ‘party plane’
body: Suzannah Harvey, chief executive of the Cotswold Airport near Kemble in western England, bought the Negus 747 for just over a $1 back in October 2020 and has spent around 14 months converting it into a versatile events space.

headline: Alice, the first all-electric passenger airplane, prepares to fly
body: What hopes to be the world’s first all-electric passenger aircraft is preparing to take flight.

headline: United Airlines has an answer to the pilot shortage: Its own flight school
body: The United Aviate Academy officially opened Thursday outside Phoenix, putting the school’s first class of about 60 students on a streamlined path to a new career.

headline: Elon Musk offered a Florida teen $5,000 to delete a Twitter account tracking his jet. It wasn’t enough
body: Jack Sweeney, a 19-year from Florida, rejected a $5,000 offer from Elon Musk to delete his Twitter account that tracks the billionaire’s private jet.

headline: Ethiopian Airlines employees are fleeing the country by hiding in the planes they work on
body: CNN has spoken to several Tigrayan employees of Ethiopian Airlines who have fled Ethiopia in recent months through their jobs as technicians and flight crew.

headline: Warren Buffett is having the last laugh
body: It’s been a tough start to the year for investors in big tech companies. Cathie Wood’s ARK Innovation fund, a big owner of Tesla, Zoom and Roku, has plunged nearly 30%. And speculative meme stocks like GameStop and AMC have been crushed.

headline: Travel marvels: Flying yachts and whale-shaped planes
body: A “flying car” is cleared for takeoff and plans for a flying yacht have been revealed. Airbus is chartering its much-loved Beluga XL plane and a robot vacuum cleaner escapes from a UK hotel. Here’s the latest news from CNN Travel.

headline: United Airlines launches flight academy to alleviate pilot shortage
body: Amid a pilot shortage, United Airlines created a flight school, the only one owned by a major US airline. Airlines that downsized during the Covid-19 pandemic are now looking to hire pilots. CNN’s Pete Muntean reports.

headline: US Navy races to recover F-35 jet from South China Sea
body: The US Navy is scrambling to recover an F-35C stealth fighter jet that crashed into the USS Carl Vinson aircraft carrier and ended up in the South China Sea to protect its “sensitive technology” from China. CNN’s Ivan Watson reports.

headline: The US is starting to make a manufacturing comeback. Here’s how to sustain it
body: It’s important to enact legislation to put historic levels of funding behind strengthening our supply chains, accelerating research and development in critical technologies, rebuilding manufacturing capabilities across America, and driving greater equity in STEM research and education.

headline: United opens first flight school owned by major US airline
body: United Airlines is banking on Aviate Academy, the first flight school owned by a major US airline, as its solution to industry-wide staffing shortages and lack of diversity. Around 90% of commercial pilots in the US are White men, at United that number is around 80%. CNN’s Pete Muntean reports.

headline: The world’s best-selling airplanes
body: Boeing and Airbus dominate the list of the world’s best-selling airplanes, but a lesser-known US manufacturer comes out on top.

headline: See the world’s most popular airplanes
Here's why the US doesn't want its F-35 wreckage to fall into China's hands
body: The United States Navy is trying to retrieve a F-35c stealth fighter jet from the depths of the South China Sea, an extremely complex operation that analysts say will be closely monitored by Beijing. CNN’s Ivan Watson reports.

headline: Bud Light Next launches just in time for Super Bowl
body: Anheuser-Busch is launching a new zero-carb beer bearing the Bud Light name just in time for the Super Bowl. Get an inside look at how the company brews its latest innovation.

headline: CNN10: The big stories of the day, explained in 10 minutes
body: A U.S. government report looks into the global computer chip shortage, a game reserve makes progress in “rewilding,” and flying cars get closer to taking off.

headline: Airbus to charter its popular Beluga XL ‘whale plane’
body: Airbus plans to charter out its whale-shaped Beluga transport planes – whose main job until now has been to ferry aircraft parts between its plants in Europe – to help other industries haul urgently-needed outsized machinery by air.

headline: Boeing’s new 777X-9 takes to the skies for the first time
body: The long-awaited maiden flight of the Boeing’s 777X-9 has successfully completed in the skies over Washington state.

headline: Boeing posts massive charge for 787 Dreamliner problems, sending losses soaring
body: Boeing took nearly $4 billion in charges related to problems it had with its 787 Dreamliner, causing losses to soar for the third straight year.

headline: Asian brands unveil future mobility at CES 2022
body: From an all-electric car fleet, to robots in the metaverse – innovation in mobility dominated stages at CES 2022 in Las Vegas. We speak to VinFast, Hyundai Motor Company and Boston Dynamics, to see what breakthroughs companies from Asia are bringing to this space.

headline: Asian brands unveil future mobility at CES 2022
body: From an all-electric car fleet, to robots in the metaverse – innovation in mobility dominated stages at CES 2022 in Las Vegas. We speak to VinFast, Hyundai Motor Company and Boston Dynamics, to see what breakthroughs companies from Asia are bringing to this space.

headline: US Navy wants to get crashed stealth fighter back – before China can
body: The United States Navy is trying to retrieve its most advanced fighter jet from the depths of the South China Sea, an extremely complex operation that analysts say will be closely monitored by Beijing.

headline: See the 'Rain Man' Buick Roadmaster up for auction
body: Actor Dustin Hoffman is selling one of the two 1949 Buicks used during the filming of the 1988 Oscar winning movie.

headline: Some manufacturers have less than 5 days’ supply of computer chips, Commerce Department warns
body: Some manufacturers that rely on semiconductors are down to less than five days’ worth of inventory, according to a report released Tuesday by the Commerce Department, in the latest indication of the extent of the computer chip shortage.

headline: The Royal Queensland Golf Club
body: The Royal Queensland Golf Club in Brisbane has a history stretching back over 100 years and has built a reputation as one of the finest courses in the southern hemisphere. With the announcement that the course will host the 2032 Olympic golf event, preparations are already underway for the world’s best players to tee it up on the course.

headline: 7 injured after F-35 jet crashes on aircraft carrier in South China Sea
body: The pilot of a US F-35 jet ejected as his jet crashed on the deck of the USS Carl Vinson aircraft carrier in the South China Sea, injuring seven, the US Pacific Fleet said in a statement Monday.

headline: The 5G-airlines crisis was mostly averted. Here’s what happened - and what we still don’t know
Pandemic stock winners are in trouble
body: Netflix and Peloton shares plummeted after both companies disappointed investors. CNN’s Anna Stewart reports.

headline: Major airlines say the 5G doomsday scenario is over
body: Airline executives breathed a sigh of relief to their investors Thursday, saying they believe the threat to their operations from the rollout of 5G technology is now behind them.

headline: FAA approves more airliners – including some smaller, regional jets – to fly near 5G towers
body: The Federal Aviation Administration has cleared more commercial airliners – notably more smaller, regional jets – to fly in the situations where pilots consider possible 5G interference to be the most dangerous.

headline: American and United warn of reduced demand due to Omicron
body: Both American Airlines and United Airlines reported better-than-expected financial results, despite problems brought on by the Omicron surge during the holiday travel period. But both said they expect problems from the variant early this year.

headline: International airlines restore flights to US after 5G confusion
body: Major international airlines have resumed normal service after a slew of cancellations on Wednesday over fears the rollout of 5G mobile networks in the United States would compromise safety.

headline: The 5G-airline snafu: Everything we know
body: The attempt to roll out amped up mobile service across the United States has been a bit of a mess. The aviation industry and transportation regulators are worried about new 5G antennas interfering with a key type of aircraft altimeter that’s essential for landing planes in bad weather. But wireless carriers and telecom regulators have said there’s nothing to fear.

headline: Airline concerns over 5G rollout persist despite FAA clearances
body: Issues pervade the 5G rollout, and airlines may bring planes back online when they are sure themselves, beyond FAA approval, that 5G-related threats have passed. CNN’s Pete Muntean reports.

headline: FULL SHOW 01/19/2022: Stocks try to recover after getting clobbered
body: Oil just touched a 7-year high, but Citigroup’s Ed Morse is predicting a radical drop in energy prices by the end of the year. Plus, Urban Stems’ Seth Goldman on how the floral delivery company is navigating supply chain challenges. And BMO Capital’s Brian Belski on why Fed tightening does not signify doom for US stock market performance.

headline: Microsoft to acquire Activision Blizzard for $68.7 billion
body: Microsoft announced plans to acquire video game company Activision Blizzard for nearly $70 billion. The largest deal for the video game space in the industry’s history, it points to the global importance of gaming, reports CNN’s Brian Stelter.

headline: Goldman Sachs earned nearly $4 billion, but that wasn’t good enough
body: Goldman Sachs had a phenomenal year. But like many of its competitors on Wall Street, the numbers just weren’t good enough to satisfy fickle investors.

headline: The best ever A380 airline stunts
body: Incredible new photos show a woman in Emirates flight attendant uniform perched on the spire of the Burj Khalifa as an Airbus A380 flies past, but it’s not the first time the superjumbo has been used for a publicity stunt.

headline: Former Miss Universe asked to 'cover-up' before boarding flight, sister says
body: The former Miss Universe was asked to change into a more appropriate outfit before boarding an American Airlines flight to Cabo, according to her sister, who documented the incident on Instagram.

headline: Virgin Galactic launched 7 satellites into orbit. Here's what they'll do
body: Richard Branson and Virgin Orbit CEO Dan Hart explains to CNN’s Jake Tapper how the company launched 7 satellites from their 747, and what the new satellites will do in orbit.

headline: FedEx asks FAA permission to add anti-missile system to some cargo planes
body: FedEx wants to operate cargo planes outfitted with lasers that throw off incoming heat-seeking missiles, according to a newly published federal documents.

headline: Virgin Galactic shares tumble as company says it’s raising $425 million in debt
Dow falls as big banks get pummeled
body: Investors clearly didn’t want to go into the upcoming three-day weekend holding onto financial stocks. The Dow fell a little more than 200 points, led by a steep fall in shares of JPMorgan Chase and other big banks.

headline: Stellantis hopes to make the best of a delayed electric start, CEO says
body: Stellantis, the company formed last year through the merger of Fiat Chrysler Automobiles and France’s PSA Group, has some catching up to do when it comes to comes to electric cars. Chief executive Carlos Tavares said he knows that, of course, but being first isn’t everything.

headline: Why airplanes might soon have just one pilot
body: Two-pilot planes have been the norm in commercial aviation for more than 30 years. As technology advances, airlines are looking at single-pilot operations as a way of saving money and addressing the pilot shortage – but is it both feasible and safe?

headline: LAPD officers save pilot moments before train hits plane
body: Dramatic police body camera footage shows Los Angeles police officers pulling a pilot from a downed private aircraft just seconds before an oncoming train barrels into the wreckage. Watch Anderson Cooper Full Circle on Monday, Wednesday and Friday at 6pm E.T.

headline: Man storms cockpit on American Airlines flight, breaks controls
body: Aviation correspondent Pete Muntean describes ‘one of the most egregious cases’ in the unruly passenger trend.

headline: Jerome Powell gets grilled in his bid for 4 more years
body: Here’s the latest news on what stocks are doing.

headline: Space industry year ahead: SpaceX’s Mars rocket, tourism, and more billionaire battles
The world’s best-performing airline has been revealed
body: Among the clouds over 2022 travel, we’re finding silver linings. Some countries are relaxing entry restrictions, and the world’s safest and most punctual airlines have been revealed.

headline: Virgin Orbit CEO says their technology offers 'better economics'
body: Virgin Orbit’s CEO Dan Hart discusses the “disruptive technology” the company has that makes for an efficient flight, and he explains how the small satellite is the fastest growing part of the space economy.

headline: The family letters left on a Southwest plane – in pictures
body: When Rachel DeGolia’s folder of letters from her late mother were left on a plane in Chicago, she thought she’d never see them again. But that was before one dogged Southwest Airlines employee decided not to rest until she’d reunited the precious letters with their owner.

headline: Global stocks drop after a rough day on Wall Street
body: Stocks in Asia Pacific were unsteady Thursday after a major sell-off on Wall Street, as investors continued to grapple with Omicron headlines and concerns that the US Federal Reserve may need to take a more hawkish stance in the coming months.

headline: How flying will change in 2022
body: During almost any other year, a look ahead to what the future holds for aviation would almost certainly be centered on exciting things like new airplanes, airlines and airports.

headline: Hasbro names digital gaming chief Chris Cocks as CEO
body: Hasbro Inc on Wednesday named Chris Cocks, head of the division housing the “Dungeons and Dragons” game, as the toymaker’s chief executive officer, months after longtime CEO Brian Goldner’s death.

headline: Stellantis, Jeep’s parent company, is teaming up with Amazon
body: Stellantis, the international automaker that owns brands like Jeep, Chrysler, Fiat, Ram and Peugeot, has entered into a wide-ranging agreement with Amazon. The deal will put Amazon software in Stellantis vehicles and will also put Stellantis’s electric vans into Amazon’s delivery fleet.

headline: FULL SHOW 01/05/2022: Stocks are acting really weird lately
body: ECRI’s Lakshman Achuthan explains why recession risks are rising this year. Plus, Seventh Generation CEO Alison Whritenour on how the green cleaning company is keeping up with customer demand. And JP Morgan’s Gabriela Santos shares her strategy for navigating the market in 2022.

headline: The world’s safest airline for 2022 revealed
body: The past year has proved to be yet another incredibly difficult one for airlines as the slump in air travel continued throughout 2021 due to the impact of the ongoing pandemic.

headline: Airline Ratings safe airlines list for 2022
See how Walmart can stock your kitchen when you're not home
body: Walmart announced it is expanding its InHome service, which allows employees to enter participating consumers’ homes to deliver groceries.

headline: Charlie Munger must really, really like China’s Alibaba
body: Charlie Munger, the longtime pal of Berkshire Hathaway’s Warren Buffett, is apparently a very big fan of Alibaba… even though the 98-year-old has recently praised the Communist government of China for cracking down on the Chinese e-commerce company and cloud giant.

headline: GM was America’s largest automaker for nearly a century. It was just dethroned by Toyota
body: Toyota is the leader in US auto sales for the first time, taking away a title that General Motors had held for nearly a century.

headline: GM was America’s largest automaker for nearly a century. It’s about to be dethroned by Toyota
body: Toyota is about to become the leader in US auto sales for the first time, taking away a title that General Motors has held for nearly a century.

headline: Apple becomes world's first $3 trillion company
body: Apple hit $3 trillion in market value, making it the world’s first publicly-traded company to reach this mark. CNN’s Paul R. La Monica says the iPhone is the main driver behind the company’s success, but its numerous subscription services have helped to boost its revenue and reach this milestone.

headline: 2021: The year of space tourism
Stocks kicked 2022 off at record highs
body: Start the year how you intend to spend it, right? For the Dow, that means at all-time highs.

headline: Where Big Tech is taking us in 2022
body: Kara Swisher discusses how the pandemic made tech companies like Google and Meta even more powerful. She also discusses political oversight of Big Tech and says “what we really need overall is a national privacy bill.”

headline: How air travel changed in 2021
body: From lost revenue to unruly passengers to canceled flights and staff shortages, the aviation industry was on the front line during the Covid pandemic’s second difficult year

headline: Chinese tech stocks are climbing on the last day of the year. But 2021 has been a bloodbath
body: Chinese tech stocks got a big boost in Hong Kong on the last day of the year, but it’s far from enough to make up for what has been a historically tumultuous time for the sector.

headline: 'Not an ounce of public safety': Flight attendant union president calls out Delta Airlines
body: Sara Nelson, the president of the Association of Flight Attendants, joins CNN’s Kaitlan Collins on New Day to discuss the new CDC guidelines and the measures Delta Airlines has taken for their flight attendants.

headline: China’s Xi’an lockdown hits some of the world’s largest chipmakers
body: Two of the world’s biggest chipmakers are warning that Covid-19 outbreaks and stringent lockdowns in a major Chinese industrial hub are hampering their operations.

headline: China lockdown is hitting world's biggest chipmakers
body: Shutdown in Xi’an, China, in response to Covid-19 infections is affecting two of the world’s biggest chipmakers, Samsung and Micron, which have extensive manufacturing facilities in the city. The lockdown can potentially exacerbate the ongoing global chip shortage crisis, reports CNN’s Steven Jiang.

headline: JetBlue is canceling 1,280 flights as Omicron cases surge
body: JetBlue Airways is reducing its schedule by about 1,280 flights from Thursday through January 13 because a growing number of crew members are falling sick from Covid infections.

headline: Why a Mach 5 passenger plane is a crazy idea that might just work
body: Atlanta-based startup Hermeus hopes to develop a passenger airplane capable of reaching Mach 5, or 3,000 miles per hour, but is the prospect of building a hypersonic successor to Concorde merely a flight of fancy?

headline: China slams Elon Musk and US claiming SpaceX satellites endangered Chinese
body: China lashed out at Elon Mask stating that his SpaceX’s Starlink satellites endangered Chinese astronauts by flying too close to China’s space station on two occasions. China’s foreign ministry spokesperson blamed the US as well, but the larger issue is how to manage growing traffic in space, says CNN’s Ivan Watson.

headline: 'I thought it was an earthquake:' Witness describes plane crash tragedy
body: An airplane crashed in the El Cajon area of Southern California, leaving no survivors, according to the San Diego County Sheriff’s Department. Authorities said the plane was a Learjet and are uncertain about how many passengers it was carrying.

headline: Winter weather, sick crews cancel thousands of holiday flights
body: The surging Omicron variant is causing flight cancellations around the world.

headline: Airlines cancel more than 6,000 flights amid Omicron
body: Airlines canceled over 6,000 flights during Christmas weekend due to staffing shortages resulting from the Omicron variant, technical difficulties, weather challenges and normal holiday travel inconveniences. CNN’s Nadia Romero reports.

headline: Kenya Airways converted two 787 Dreamliners to carry cargo. Here’s why
body: Kenya Airways CEO Allan Kilavuka explains how the airline has pivoted to meet growing demand for cargo flights.

headline: Albert Bourla of Pfizer is the CNN Business CEO of the Year
body: The Covid-19 pandemic is far from over. But life in many ways has returned to something resembling normal for many. That’s in large part because there are now multiple coronavirus vaccines, including one from Pfizer.

headline: Watch James Webb Space Telescope lift off
body: The James Webb Space Telescope has finally launched into orbit. The most powerful telescope ever built, its mission now is to observe previously unseen parts of the galaxy.

headline: Pfizer CEO shares thoughts on boosters and the future of Covid
body: Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla spoke with CNN Business’ Paul R. La Monica about annual Covid-19 vaccines, the future of the virus, and getting the vaccine to low-income countries.

headline: China is helping this US ally develop ballistic missiles
body: US intelligence and satellite images show Saudi Arabia is now actively developing its own ballistic missiles with the help of China. CNN’s Oren Liebermann reports.

headline: New images indicate proof of Saudi Arabia ballistic missile program
body: US intelligence agencies have assessed that Saudi Arabia is now actively manufacturing its own ballistic missiles with the help of China. CNN’s Natasha Bertrand explains how this could impact US policy toward the kingdom.

headline: Boeing and Airbus want Biden administration to delay rollout of 5G cell service, citing safety concerns
body: The world’s biggest commercial airplane manufacturers are telling the Biden Administration to delay the rollout of 5G cell service next month.

headline: Airline executives worry about your cellphone's 5G network. Here's why (2021)
body: Airline executives say the January 5, 2021, rollout of the 5G network could cause interference that could adversely affect the ability of aircraft to safely operate. CNN’s Pete Muntean has the story.

headline: Nike is trying to outrun supply chain problems
body: Plenty of people want to buy Nike clothes and sneakers. But nearly two years into the coronavirus pandemic, supply chain issues mean the company is struggling to meet that demand and grow its business.

headline: Stocks slide amid growing economic threats

headline: Stocks soar as America’s biggest banks are booming

headline: Airline trades skirts and heels for loose suits and sneakers

Los nuevos empleos buscan ayudar al gigante del comercio electrónico a mantenerse al día con la demanda en las ventas minoristas, la publicidad y la computación en la nube, que tuvieron un impulso durante la pandemia.

It’s just one more setback in a series of them for a trial that NASA and Boeing desperately want to go off without any major issues like the ones they had during their first launch attempt, back in December 2019.

headline: Jeff Bezos is going to space for 11 minutes. Here’s how risky that is

He could afford to buy a the whole NFL; he could buy an archipelago for his family and friends; he could buy over 65,000 Bugatti Chirons (base price $2.9 million), even though only 500 are being built. As the world’s richest person, the possibilities are endless. But Bezos appears ready to risk it all for an 11-minute ride to space.

It took almost a year for investigators to recover over 95% of the plane, but now the federal government will begin destroying the reconstructed wreckage of the ill-fated aircraft.

Still, SpaceX CEO Elon Musk said Tuesday, not running out of money is top of mind.
