headline: Tesla’s stock rises on record Model 3 and Model Y deliveries
body: No Model S or Model X cars on the Tesla assembly line is apparently no problem for investors.

headline: Delta temporarily fills middle seats in response to flight cancelations
body: Citing several contributing factors, Delta Air Lines canceled approximately 100 flights Sunday.

headline: Former AmEx CEO Ken Chenault on why companies must "stand up for the right to vote"
body: CNN’s Abby Phillip speaks with former American Express CEO Ken Chenault about the letter he and 71 other Black executives wrote, speaking out against restrictive voting laws and calling on business leaders to pressure Georgia lawmakers after they approved their own law last week.

headline: Exclusive look at designs for US supersonic presidential jet
body: California start-up Exosonic is developing a supersonic jet designed to one day carry the leaders of the US Executive Branch and their guests. CNN Travel got a sneak peek inside the plane

headline: Watch yet another SpaceX prototype explode
body: See SpaceX’s SN11 Starship prototype explode during a test flight in Brownsville, Texas. It’s the fourth attempt in a row that’s met a fiery end.

headline: Taiwan’s TSMC is pouring $100 billion into chipmaking to prevent another shortage
body: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company, the world’s largest contract chipmaker, announced Thursday that it expects to pour $100 billion into advanced chips over the next three years to keep up with rising demand.

headline: Virgin Galactic unveils mirror-coated space plane known as ‘Spaceship III’
body: Virgin Galactic, the space tourism firm that hopes to send its first customers to space next year, unveiled a new spacecraft design on Tuesday. The sleek new space plane has a reflective coating that the company calls “mirror-like,” and says will add to space tourists’ experience.

headline: Goldman Sachs reportedly jumps on the bitcoin bandwagon
body: Goldman Sachs will reportedly soon offer its private wealth management clients avenues to invest in bitcoin and other digital currencies.

headline: Goodbye empty middle seats. Delta is selling the whole plane starting May 1
body: The empty middle seat on airplanes, one of the few advantages of pandemic, is about to disappear.

headline: Delta to book middle seats again
body: Delta Air Lines, the last remaining US airline to keep middle seats empty, has lifted that restriction as of May 1. CNN’s Pete Muntean reports.

headline: CNN10 - 3/31/21
body: The World Health Organization probes the origins of coronavirus, traffic resumes flowing through the Suez Canal, and a concept jet could change aviation.

headline: Supersonic airliner could fly LA to Tokyo in under three hours
body: The newly unveiled Aerion AS3 is a supersonic commercial airliner that promises to travel at Mach 4+ speeds, allowing it to jet between LA and Tokyo in under three hours.

headline: Southwest just placed the biggest Boeing 737 Max order since it was grounded
body: Southwest agreed to buy 100 737 Max jets from Boeing, the largest order for the troubled jet since its grounding in 2019 following two fatal crashes.

headline: 'Supercar Blondie' has driven 400 of the world's fastest cars
body: Australian Alex Hirschi, better known as “Supercar Blondie,” has become a social-media sensation vlogging about the craziest supercars in Dubai.

headline: CNN10 - 3/26/21
body: A futuristic drone carries a historic artifact on Mars, an Australian landscape is changed by floods, and a man works to reconnect a fragmented forest in Brazil.

headline: US lawmakers question tech CEOs on misinformation
body: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg, Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey appeared before lawmakers to answer question about their platforms’ efforts to stem baseless election fraud claims and vaccine skepticism. CNN’s Donie O’Sullivan reports.

headline: Intel CEO: We're ready to go bigger and faster
body: Intel will invest $20 billion in two new US chipmaking facilities. CEO Pat Gelsinger says “we’re putting our chips on the table” and says governments are stepping forward to support their efforts.

headline: GM adds Meg Whitman to its majority-women board
body: Former Hewlett-Packard CEO Meg Whitman is joining the board of General Motors, adding another woman to one of the more diverse boards in corporate America.

headline: Amazon’s cloud business has a new CEO
body: Amazon has appointed Tableau CEO Adam Selipsky as the new head of its biggest moneymaker, Amazon Web Services.

headline: Wall Street firms move to ease employee burn-out
body: Goldman Sachs, Jefferies and Citigroup are responding to the mental health pressure facing employees. CNN’s Clare Sebastian reports.

headline: CNN10 - 3/23/21
body: Tremendous rainfall leads to record-breaking floods in Australia, a space mission tests out a way to clean up space junk, and a gold mask is unearthed in China.

headline: Europe’s biggest flying lab is tackling our toughest environmental challenges
body: The UK’s Facility for Airborne Atmospheric Measurements uses a reconfigured passenger aircraft to take atmospheric measurements all over the world.

headline: Why you should book your summer vacation now
body: As worldwide travel slowly returns to pre-pandemic levels, Glenn Fogel, CEO of Booking Holdings, tells vacationers to beat the rush and book their summer vacations now.

headline: 1 engine broken, the other wrapped. This is the current state of Trump's 757
body: Former President Donald Trump’s private Boeing 757, once the crown jewel of his wealth with customized leather seats, gilded bathrooms and seat buckles layered in 24-karat gold, now sits idle and in need of repair. CNN’s Kate Bennett reports.

headline: Goldman Sachs analysts say they are enduring workplace abuse
body: About a dozen Goldman Sachs junior analysts say they are working more than 95 hours a week on average, sleeping just five hours a night and enduring workplace abuse according to a workplace survey. Paul R. La Monica reports.

headline: The final Airbus A380 superjumbo makes its first flight
body: A magnificent beast made of four million parts from 30 countries, the last ever Airbus A380 – the world’s largest passenger airliner – has made its first flight

headline: FULL SHOW 03/17/2021: Investors focused on the Federal Reserve
body: Danielle DiMartino Booth, CEO and Chief Strategist for Quill Intelligence, predicts what to expect from the Federal Reserve. Plus, Booking Holdings CEO & President Glenn Fogel on the outlook for the travel industry. And JPM Asset Management Chief Global Strategist David Kelly shares his strategy for investors.

headline: How to launch an airline during a global pandemic
body: The coronavirus pandemic has forced even the biggest airlines to ground planes, slash jobs and bolster their finances to survive the worst crisis in aviation history. A full recovery is still years away, but a handful of gutsy CEOs think now is the perfect time to launch new carriers.

headline: The global chip shortage is still hurting Samsung, Honda and Volkswagen
body: The global chip shortage is continuing to pummel global business, with Samsung, Honda and Volkswagen among the latest major companies to warn of sustained disruption.

headline: Volkswagen could soon steal Tesla’s crown
body: Tesla knows all about how to disrupt an industry. It may soon find out what it’s like to be on the receiving end.

headline: The most valuable startup in America is worth more than SpaceX
body: Move over, SpaceX and Instacart: Payments processing company Stripe is now the most valuable startup in America.

headline: SEC: Elon Musk officially named 'Technoking of Tesla'
body: In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Tesla disclosed that CEO Elon Musk is adding the title of “Technoking of Tesla.” It also said that Chief Financial Officer Zach Kirkhorn had taken on the title of “Master of Coin.” CNN’s Richard Quest and Paul R. La Monica discuss the move by Musk.

headline: US airline stocks rise on hopes for a travel rebound
body: US airline stocks rose Monday after a number of carriers reported strong demand for seats from leisure travelers.

headline: Goldman Sachs to invest billions in Black women
body: A Goldman Sachs report shows Black American women hold 90% less wealth than White American men. As a result of the data, Goldman Sachs is investing $10 billion to change those disparities. CNN’s Poppy Harlow and Goldman Sachs Asset Management Global Head of Sustainability & Impact Margaret Anadu discuss how this will impact the Black community.

headline: SpaceX launches Falcon 9 rocket carrying Starlink satellites. Their goal is to blanket the planet in high-speed broadband
body: The SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket successfully launched Sunday morning, sending 60 Starlink satellites into orbit.

headline: The greatest airplane beds in the sky
body: The most luxurious thing in the sky is to stretch out on a fully flat bed and sleep your way through a night flight, arriving refreshed the next morning. These are some of the best in-flight lie-flat experiences available for when we can all fly again.

headline: CNN10 - 3/12/21
body: China and Russia team up to build a new space station, conservationists work to build a wall of trees on a desert’s border, and we check out an island for sale.

headline: The 737 Max crisis costs continues to climb two years after the second fatal crash
body: Wednesday marked a grim anniversary for Boeing and hundreds of families worldwide – two years since the fatal crash of a 737 Max flown by Ethiopian Airlines that killed all 157 people on board. While the human toll outweighs the financial accounting of the crisis, the dollar cost is likely to make Boeing’s 737 Max safety issues one of the most costly corporate mistakes ever.

headline: Stocks surge as Tesla and tech shares rebound
body: As Tesla shares have climbed, tech stocks have rebounded and led a rally on Wall Street. CNN’s Paul R. La Monica reports.

headline: Two years after a global grounding, airlines are quickly bringing 737 Max jets back into service
body: Two years after a 737 Max system failure led to fatal crashes, airlines are rapidly bringing the Boeing jet back into service.

headline: GE is in talks to merge its aircraft leasing unit with rival AerCap
body: General Electric is in talks to combine its massive aircraft leasing unit with rival AerCap Holdings.

headline: China has built the world’s largest navy. Now what’s Beijing going to do with it?
body: At some point between 2015 and today, China has assembled the world’s largest naval force. And now it’s working to make it formidable far from its shores.

headline: Engine failed on United Airlines flight after pilots increased power, NTSB report says
body: The right engine of United Airlines Flight 328 failed with a fiery bang minutes after takeoff last month when the aircraft’s pilots throttled up the engines to minimize expected turbulence, National Transportation Safety Board investigators said in an update Friday.

headline: US and EU agree to suspend tariffs linked to long-running Boeing-Airbus dispute
body: The United States and European Union have agreed to suspend for four months all tariffs related to the long-running dispute over subsidies to Boeing and Airbus.

headline: Cantor Fitzgerald CEO: SPACs are private equity for the public market
body: Howard Lutnick, CEO of Cantor Fitzgerald, discusses the recent popularity of Special Purpose Acquisition Companies.

headline: Jerome Powell: US economy 'some time' away from full recovery
body: US stocks tumble after Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell says the US economy is far from a full recovery. CNN’s Richard Quest and CEO of Cantor Fitzgerald Howard Lutnick discuss Powell’s prediction.

headline: Watch SpaceX Mars prototype rocket nail landing, explode on pad
body: SpaceX’s Starship prototype, the SN10, successfully landed for the first time during a test flight. Minutes later the rocket exploded on its landing pad.

headline: Marriott CEO: We want travelers to feel safe
body: Marriott International CEO Tony Capuano discusses how the company is prioritizing service excellence and insuring travel safety for guests.

headline: A shortage of pilots could keep the airlines from making a real comeback
body: An important question facing the airline industry is not whether it will face a pilot shortage, but when it will begin.

headline: United, predicting a rebound in travel, buys 25 Boeing 737 Max jets
body: United Airlines disclosed Monday one of its largest orders for the Boeing 737 Max jet since the aircraft was grounded in March 2019, agreeing to buy an additional 25 planes.

headline: Rocket Lab joins the SPAC craze
Wreckage from TWA Flight 800 to be destroyed years after explosion
body: Wreckage from TWA Flight 800, which exploded in 1996 shortly after takeoff from New York’s John F. Kennedy airport, will be decommissioned and destroyed, the NTSB announced.

headline: Airbnb CEO: This is how we outperformed our competitors in 2020
body: Airbnb’s CEO Brian Chesky says his company is preparing for what they believe will be a “meaningful travel rebound” after seeing bookings drop 41% in 2020 due to the pandemic.

headline: Australia’s Qantas says it will resume international flights in October of 2021
body: Australian airline Qantas has announced that it plans to resume international flights in October 2021.

headline: US stocks get back on track
body: View more stock market news today.

headline: Airplane seat revolution creates one of biggest beds in the sky
body: One of the largest beds in the sky is set to debut in just a few months time when JetBlue starts flying its A321neos from Boston and New York to London. It’s part of the luxurious Mint Studio offering coming soon.

headline: FAA directs air carriers to inspect engines similar to the one that failed on the United Airlines flight
body: The Federal Aviation Administration on Tuesday directed air carriers to inspect all Pratt & Whitney engines similar to the one that dramatically failed on a United Airlines flight on Saturday.

headline: 4 reasons Tesla’s stock is tumbling
body: Tesla, the hottest stock in the market for more than a year, has sunk into bear market territory.

headline: Investigators release preliminary findings on the United Airlines flight engine failure. Here’s what we know
body: The investigation into the engine failure of a Boeing 777 could take more than a year, officials said, but already the picture is becoming clearer about what happened to the United Airlines flight on Saturday.

headline: Engine on United Airlines flight was showing signs of metal fatigue, NTSB says
body: The Pratt & Whitney engine that failed minutes into United Airlines flight 328 showed signs of metal fatigue, investigators with the National Transportation Safety Board said during their first public briefing on Monday.

headline: CNN10 - 2/23/21
body: Dozens of Boeing passenger planes are grounded, Covid numbers continue to decrease in the U.S., and an orbiting laboratory opens up more to commercial visits.

headline: Airlines ground dozens of Boeing 777 planes after engine failure over Denver
body: Airlines in the United States, South Korea and Japan have grounded dozens of Boeing 777 aircraft after one of the jets suffered engine failure Saturday, sending debris crashing down over Denver.

headline: The 737 Max is no longer Boeing’s biggest problem, after yet another safety grounding
body: The grounding of 69 of Boeing’s 777-model jets following the frightening engine failure on a United Airlines flight out of Denver on Saturday underscores a larger problem facing the aircrtaft maker.

headline: Another safety scare is the last thing Boeing needs
body: Boeing has spent years trying to assure customers, regulators and the public that its planes are safe. That job may have just gotten harder.

headline: Another United Airlines flight experienced a right engine failure in 2018
body: Saturday’s dramatic engine failure on a United Airlines flight is the second time since 2018 that the right engine failed during a United flight.

headline: Dozens of Boeing 777 planes grounded after engine failure
body: Boeing recommended that airlines stop flying versions of the 777 aircraft that are equipped with Pratt & Whitney engines while US authorities investigate the Denver incident. CNN’s Richard Quest reports.

headline: Pilot: What happens in an emergency like United 328
body: Les Abend explains that an uncontained and catastrophic incident caused the engine of United 328 to catch fire midair. Likely caused by a propeller blade that came lose, the flight narrowly escaped becoming a tragedy thanks to the quick thinking of the crew.

headline: United Airlines pulls Boeing 777s following engine fire
body: Boeing has recommended suspending the use of 777s that have a Pratt & Whitney 4000 engine, and United Airlines has already pulled them following the engine fire aboard United Airlines flight 328. Both the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) and the NTSB are investigating. CNN’s Dan Simon has the latest.

headline: Video shows United Airlines plane engine on fire after takeoff from Denver
body: A United Airlines flight was forced to return to Denver International Airport after it suffered an engine failure shortly after takeoff, sending aircraft debris raining down on soccer fields, homes and yards in a Denver suburb. CNN’s Lucy Kafanov reports.

headline: 'Sounded like something exploded': Witness describes plane incident
body: A United Airlines flight bound for Honolulu was forced to return to Denver International Airport after suffering an engine issue, a spokesperson for the airport told CNN. CNN’s Erica Hill speaks to Kieran Cain, who took photos of plane debris that landed in a nearby neighborhood.

headline: Police: 'Amazing' that there are no reports of injuries
body: A United Airlines flight headed to Honolulu from Denver International Airport had to turn around due to an engine issue, a spokesperson for the airport told CNN. The FAA said the aircraft experienced right-engine failure shortly after takeoff, as CNN’s Pete Muntean reports.

headline: At least 1 person killed after small plane crashes into rig near Port of Los Angeles
body: At least one person died Friday when a small plane crashed into a semi tractor trailer near the Port of Los Angeles in San Pedro, California, officials said.

headline: Airbus CEO: Could ramp up production by second half of 2021
body: Airbus CEO Guillaume Faury discusses how UK production levels remain competitive and how he expects air travel to go back to pre-pandemic levels by 2024 with CNN’s Richard Quest.

headline: Maersk has found a way to clean up shipping but there’s a catch
body: Maersk says it will launch the world’s first carbon neutral cargo ship in 2023, as efforts to clean up one of the planet’s worst polluting industries gain momentum.

headline: Chinese drone company EHang’s shares plunged 63% after fraud claim
body: Investors have been dumping shares in Chinese drone maker EHang, after a short-seller accused the US-listed company of fraud.

headline: Mitsubishi tries to reinvent itself with SUV debut on Amazon
body: Mitsubishi unveiled its fully redesigned Outlander SUV on Amazon Live, a the streaming service operated by the online retailer, on Tuesday evening.

headline: Warren Buffett sells JPMorgan Chase stock and buys Verizon
body: It appears that Warren Buffett is souring on the financial sector’s prospects, and that the Oracle of Omaha also has a newfound interest in Big Oil, as well as telecom and media.

headline: Marriott CEO Arne Sorenson dies at age 62
body: Marriott International’s president and CEO Arne Sorenson has died following a nearly two-year battle with pancreatic cancer. CNN’s Julia Chatterely pays tribute to Arne Sorenson’s 9-year career with Marriott.

headline: SpaceX launches another batch of Starlink satellites, but misses rocket landing
body: SpaceX delivered its 19th large batch of Starlink internet satellites into orbit on Monday evening, but in a rare misstep, the first-stage rocket booster used to launch those satellites missed its landing target.

headline: Goldman Sachs’ investment advice is no longer just for the super rich
body: Move over, Robinhood, here comes Goldman Sachs.

headline: Why this will be the hottest airplane seat in 2021
body: Whether it’s trading down from business class, upgrading with miles or buying extra space because of Covid-19 fears, premium economy seats are likely to be in high demand when international travel picks up.

headline: Travel pro shares her best airline seat hack
body: Travel journalist and TV host Oneika Raymond surprises Richard Quest with her best tip for grabbing her favorite seat on a plane.

headline: US files complaint with Israel over unfair airline treatment for Tel Aviv flights
body: The US Department of Transportation has filed a complaint with Israel over unfair treatment of airlines, stemming from the closure of Ben Gurion International Airport in which Israel has allowed the country’s El Al airline to fly passengers but barred US airlines from doing the same, an Israeli official with knowledge of the complaint confirmed to CNN.

headline: Elon Musk’s SpaceX now owns about a third of all active satellites in the sky
body: SpaceX created a swarm of about a thousand satellites that is circulating about 340 miles overhead, and building the constellation has put SpaceX in a “deep chasm” of expenses, according to CEO Elon Musk. The constellation has also raised concerns about potential in-space collisions and the impact on astronomers’ ability to study the night sky. But for some early customers of the $99-per-month Starlink service, the satellites are already improving how rural communities access the internet.

headline: Learjet, once the go-to private plane for celebrities, is ending production
body: Learjet, the private plane brand made famous by stars like Frank Sinatra, is halting production later this year.

headline: CNN10 - 2/11/21
body: The U.S. government considers mandatory Covid testing for all domestic flight passengers, and a conservationist works to protect the Sierra Gorda region.

headline: Volkswagen is exploring flying vehicles in China
body: Volkswagen is looking into flying vehicles in China, becoming the latest automaker to probe the possibilities of personal air travel.

headline: Boeing delivers 26 planes in January, including 21 of the 737 Max
body: Boeing delivered 26 jets in January, logging one of its best months since the grounding of the 737 Max in March 2019.

headline: Amazon’s plans for India take a hit as court battle swings in rival’s favor
body: Amazon is once again on the back foot in its legal battle over the vast Indian retail market.

headline: Despite huge losses, US airlines are rolling in cash
body: The US airline industry just closed the books on the worst year in its history, losing a combined $32 billion excluding special items. Yet it still ended 2020 awash in an ocean of cash.

headline: Volvo CEO on chips: We are competing with a lot of buyers
body: Volvo CEO Håkan Samuelsson tells CNN’s Julia Chatterley that the semiconductor shortage makes clear production visibility difficult.

headline: Kuaishou stock soars after IPO
body: Kuaishou’s stock skyrocketed in value as the TikTok-like video app scored the world’s biggest IPO since the coronavirus pandemic began. CNN’s Selina Wang reports.

headline: Analysis: Bezos leaves behind a company that’s created value but has also triggered a national reckoning
body: In 1997, the year Amazon became a publicly traded company, CEO Jeff Bezos promised investors they would be in for a journey. Amazon would not chase short-term profits, he warned in a letter to shareholders. It would focus “relentlessly” on customers. It would act with urgency but prioritize long-term investments. And it would run a lean culture that minimized costs and cut waste.

headline: Ken Frazier, one of the only Black Fortune 500 CEOs, is retiring
body: Merck CEO Kenneth Frazier, who is currently one of the few Black CEOs of a Fortune 500 company, is retiring in June, ending a nearly 30-year run with the company.

headline: The rockets that defined space travel
body: Ever since the first long-range ballistic missile in 1944, there has been nonstop innovation in space technology. Take a look at the evolution of rockets and how they have shaped space travel today.

headline: Jeff Bezos is stepping down as Amazon CEO
body: Jeff Bezos has been Amazon’s CEO since its founding in 1995. He will remain as Amazon’s executive chairman with AWS CEO Andy Jassy as his successor.

headline: Jeff Bezos has been halfway out the door at Amazon for a while
body: “Jeff is not leaving.” That is what Amazon chief financial officer Brian Olsavsky told analysts on the company’s earnings call Tuesday – a call that Bezos wasn’t even on. But Bezos’ absence probably doesn’t matter much for investors.

headline: In 1999 Jeff Bezos told CNN he was surprised about Amazon's success
body: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos expressed his shock at the company’s success in a 1999 interview with CNN. At the time, Amazon was still using paper for window blinds and an old hospital as it headquarters.

headline: FAA to oversee investigation of SpaceX Mars rocket prototype’s explosive landing
body: The Federal Aviation Administration said it will oversee an investigation into a crash landing of a SpaceX prototype rocket on Tuesday. The announcement comes after the FAA forced SpaceX to delay the launch as it investigated a previous explosion of a similar rocket prototype.

headline: Jeff Bezos is stepping down as Amazon CEO
body: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos will step down from his role as chief executive later this year and transition to the role of executive chair, the company said Tuesday. He will be replaced by Andy Jassy.

headline: Chance airplane encounter leads to marriage
A surprise announcement in Amazon’s blockbuster earnings
body: Today in business news: Jeff Bezos steps down as Amazon CEO, GameStop stock plummets and these robots can jump. Let’s get into it.

headline: Andy Jassy will be Amazon's CEO. In 2019, CNN asked him if he wanted the job
body: Andy Jassy will lead Amazon as CEO after founder Jeff Bezos steps down later this year. Hear what Jassy said about the idea two years earlier.

headline: Read Jeff Bezos’s letter to Amazon employees
body: Amazon’s founder Jeff Bezos is stepping down later this year as CEO. He sent the following email announcing the transition to Amazon employees on Tuesday:

headline: JetBlue unveils new 'mint' business class suites
body: JetBlue airways CEO Robin Hayes discusses the new business class pods, and explains when the company expects travel to finally pick up again.

headline: Watch SpaceX's Mars rocket prototype crash land... again
body: SpaceX’s Starship prototype, the SN9, exploded on landing during a test flight. It’s the second test in a row for SpaceX that’s ended in a fiery crash.

headline: Astra, rocket startup that has yet to conduct a successful launch, is going public
body: Astra, a US-based rocket startup aiming to build cheap rockets to haul satellites to space, announced Tuesday that it’s going public via a reverse merger known as SPAC.

headline: Alibaba sales surge, even as crackdown in China intensifies
body: Alibaba reported a big quarter for its e-commerce business. But China’s most famous tech firm faced nervous investors on Tuesday as a regulatory crackdown by Beijing and co-founder Jack Ma’s fall from grace cast a shadow over its future.

headline: SpaceX announces first-ever all-civilian space flight crew
Google investors may have forgotten how much lawmakers want to rein in Big Tech
body: Over the past few years, Google owner Alphabet’s stock had lagged compared to the stellar rise of big techs like the other FAANG members and Microsoft. That’s finally starting to change. But investors might be overlooking one major problem: potential regulatory risk.

headline: See Russian jet fly low near US Navy ship in Black Sea
body: A Russian fighter jet flew low over the Black Sea on January 31, near the USS Donald Cook, a naval missile destroyer operating in the Black Sea, according to a tweet from US Naval Forces Europe-Africa/US 6th Fleet, which tweeted video of the incident.

headline: GM plans to be carbon neutral by 2040
body: General Motors said it plans to be carbon neutral by 2040 for global operations and offer only zero-emissions vehicles by 2035. CNN’s Vanessa Yurkevich discusses what this means for the largest U.S. automaker.

headline: Over 200 flights on American Airlines’ regional carrier canceled after inspection problem
body: PSA Airlines, one of American Airlines’ largest operators of regional flights, has been “temporarily grounded” for an inspection issue on nearly all of its planes, according to an internal email obtained by CNN.

headline: CNN10 - 1/29/21
body: The U.S. gross domestic product shrinks, a new type of helicopter approaches its launch point, we visit Hawaii’s Banzai Pipeline, and a panda makes his debut.

headline: Southwest Airlines reports first loss in 48 years
body: The last time Southwest Airlines posted an annual loss was 1972, when it was a small upstart airline flying a handful of planes on Texas-only routes.

headline: Toyota overtakes Volkswagen as world’s biggest automaker
body: Toyota is once again back on top.

headline: The Dow has its biggest loss since October
body: View more stock market news today.

headline: Facing back-to-back crises, Boeing posts a record loss
body: Boeing closed the books on its worst year ever, posting record losses and plunging sales on the backs of combined crises: the Covid-19 pandemic and the problems getting the 737 Max back in the air.

headline: SpaceX, Amazon spat pits world’s richest men against each other over space real estate
body: SpaceX and Amazon — companies run by the two richest men in the world — are sparring over their competing satellite-based internet businesses, with SpaceX accusing Amazon of “stifling competition” and Amazon accusing SpaceX of looking to “smother competition in the cradle.”

headline: The Soviet flying beast that never really took off
body: The only surviving prototype of the unusual Bartini Beriev VVA-14 vertical takeoff airplane sits dilapidated in a field near Moscow, but it was once the hope of the Soviet Union against US submarine attacks.

headline: SpaceX launches 143 satellites on one rocket in record-setting mission
body: A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket carried 143 satellites into orbit on a jam-packed rideshare mission Sunday, setting a new world record for the most satellites launched by a single rocket.

headline: Concorde successor AS2 takes leap forward with vast new Florida HQ
body: Supersonic travel is one step closer as airplane manufacturer Aerion breaks ground on a new Florida HQ for its 1,000mph AS2 private jet

headline: Biden's HHS secretary pick: The plane is in a nosedive
body: Health and Human Services Secretary-designate Xavier Becerra tells CNN’s Dana Bash that the US coronavirus response is like a plane in a nosedive, and it’s the Biden administration’s job to pull up.

headline: Un fiscal confirma que falsificaron la firma de Diego Armando Maradona
body: El fiscal a cargo de la investigación por la muerte de Diego Armando Maradona, confirmó a CNN que falsificaron la firma del astro argentino en el documento que permitió acceder su historia médica del hospital donde fue operado, según una pericia. José Manuel Rodríguez cuenta los detalles.

headline: American Airlines has so much extra wine that it is starting a delivery service
How one airline plans to reinvent itself in the face of the pandemic
body: CNN’s Business Traveller speaks to Air Canada, Canada’s largest carrier, about the airline’s plans and strategies to face the challenging road to recovery, and how it will reinvent itself again from the ground up.

headline: How one airline plans to reinvent itself in the face of the pandemic
body: CNN’s Business Traveller speaks to Air Canada, Canada’s largest carrier, about the airline’s plans and strategies to face the challenging road to recovery, and how it will reinvent itself again from the ground up.

headline: Tesla has started deliveries of the Chinese-made Model Y
body: Tesla has begun rolling out locally made Model Y crossover vehicles in China, reaching an important milestone in the world’s largest auto market.

headline: Goldman Sachs posts impressive earnings thanks to Wall Street’s strength
body: Goldman Sachs, one of the largest investment banks on Wall Street, reported results for the fourth quarter that easily topped analysts’ expectations Tuesday morning.

headline: The best laptops of 2021
Watch this rocket launch from the wing of a jumbo jet
body: Virgin Orbit completed its first successful launch into orbit, sending its LauncherOne hurtling to space after deploying from the wing of a retrofitted Boeing 747.

headline: Virgin Orbit launches rocket off a 747 aircraft, puts nine satellites in space
body: A 70-foot rocket, riding beneath the wing of a retrofitted Boeing 747 aircraft, detached from the plane and fired itself into Earth’s orbit on Sunday — marking the first successful launch for the California-based rocket startup Virgin Orbit.

headline: The online shopping exec Walmart hired to take on Amazon is leaving
body: The executive hired to help boost Walmart’s e-commerce business to compete with Amazon is leaving the company.

headline: JPMorgan Chase just reported a record quarterly profit. But its CEO is still nervous
body: The economy may not have fully recovered yet, but that’s no problem for America’s biggest bank. JPMorgan Chase reported a record profit of $12.1 billion for the fourth quarter Friday — easily topping Wall Street’s forecasts.

headline: Alibaba is facing an ‘existential crisis’
body: This year could be the most consequential for Alibaba since it was founded two decades ago.

headline: Etihad CEO: Targeting a complete turnaround by 2023
body: Etihad Aviation Group CEO Tony Douglas discusses his optimism for international travel despite the ongoing pandemic.

headline: Columbia Sportswear CEO: Trump should be removed from office
body: Columbia Sportswear CEO Tim Boyle explains why he believes the Biden administration will bring the country forward.

headline: Qatar Airways to retire half of its A380 planes
body: Qatar Airways is retiring half of its fleet of Airbus A380s, the world’s largest passenger plane. It’s the latest nail in the coffin for the double-decker superjumbo.

headline: Stocks hold steady ahead of impeachment vote
body: View more stock market news today.

headline: Volkswagen and Audi are starting to challenge Tesla
A global chip shortage is hitting carmakers at the worst possible time
body: The world’s largest carmakers are facing a critical shortage of semiconductors that threatens to hamstring production just as the industry tries to stage a comeback from a sales slump caused by the pandemic.

headline: In pictures: Casino magnate Sheldon Adelson
body: Sheldon Adelson, the chairman and CEO of Las Vegas Sands and a major donor to Republican politicians, died Monday, January 11, at the age of 87.

headline: In pictures: Indonesian jetliner crashes into ocean
body: An Indonesian passenger jet crashed into the ocean minutes after takeoff on Saturday, January 9, with 62 people on board.

headline: Companies distance themselves from Trump
body: Deutsche Bank will no longer do business with President Donald Trump. CNN’s Christine Romans takes a look at the corporate backlash following the deadly riot at the US Capitol.

headline: Boeing reports strong end to its worst year in decades
body: Boeing ended its worst year in more than 40 years with its best month of 2020.

headline: Indonesian search team recovers black box at Sriwijaya plane crash site
body: An Indonesian search team has recovered one of the two black boxes that belonged to the Sriwijaya Air plane that crashed in the Java Sea with 62 people on board, a crucial instrument for investigators probing the cause of the crash.

headline: Black boxes located at Indonesian airliner crash site as human remains recovered
body: Rescuers searching for the wreckage of an Indonesian passenger jet that crashed into the ocean with 62 people on board on Saturday say they have located the plane’s black box flight recorder and obtained communications data.

headline: Naomi Osaka revealed as the new face of Louis Vuitton
body: Three-time Grand Slam winner Naomi Osaka has been named brand ambassador for Louis Vuitton, and will appear in the French fashion house’s Spring-Summer 2021 campaign.

headline: All-women Indian pilot crew make history by completing country’s longest commercial flight
body: An all-female Indian pilot team made history this week, after they completed the longest non-stop commercial flight ever operated by an Indian national airline.

headline: Indonesian jetliner with 62 passengers crashes after taking off from Jakarta
body: A Sriwijaya Air jetliner carrying 62 people on board crashed shortly after taking off from Jakarta, according to the head of Indonesia’s National Transportation Safety Committee, Suryanto Cahyono.

headline: Indonesian jetliner crashes after taking off from Jakarta
body: A Sriwijaya Air jetliner carrying 62 people on board crashed shortly after taking off from Jakarta, according to the head of Indonesia’s National Transportation Safety Committee, Suryanto Cahyono. CNN’s Kristie Lu Stout reports.

headline: Sriwijaya Air plane loses contact after taking off from Jakarta
body: Indonesia’s Sriwijaya Air lost contact with flight SJY 182 traveling from Jakarta to Pontianak, according to Indonesia’s Head of National Transportation Safety Committee, Suryanto Cahyono.

headline: Indonesia searches for missing airliner
body: Indonesia’s Sriwijaya Air lost contact with a plane that left Jakarta on Saturday.

headline: Boeing agrees to pay $2.5 billion to settle charges it defrauded FAA on 737 Max
body: Boeing reached a $2.5 billion settlement with the Justice Department on Thursday to settle criminal charges that the company defrauded the Federal Aviation Administration when it first won approval for the flawed 737 Max jet.

headline: Watch a young Elon Musk get his first supercar in 1999
body: Decades before becoming the world’s richest person, a young Elon Musk showed off his newfound Silicon Valley riches when he received a brand new McLaren F1 supercar. From CNN’s archives, watch it all unfold.

headline: See Burger King's retro new logo and uniforms (2021)
body: Burger King is changing its logo for the first time in over two decades. This is what the revamp looks like.

headline: The world’s safest airlines for 2021 revealed
body: There may have been far fewer airplanes in the skies this past year, but if you’re looking ahead to future travel, you might take heed of the latest rankings of the world’s safest airlines from AirlineRatings.com.

headline: Alibaba and Tencent stocks hit by reports that Trump could go after them next
body: Shares in Alibaba and Tencent were rocked in Hong Kong on Thursday following reports that they could be the next casualties of President Donald Trump’s scorched earth campaign against Chinese tech.

headline: Recycling an airplane: What’s scrapped when an aircraft retires?
body: With Covid-19, many aircraft that would have had years of service left are being stripped down and their metals and other materials recycled. Finnair talks with CNN about how it works.

headline: Jeff Bezos just named a huge rocket recovery ship after his mom
body: It’s always a challenge to find the right gift to get one’s mother, the right token that accurately reflects the appreciation and affection you feel towards the woman that birthed you. If you are Jeff Bezos, the world’s richest man, deep pockets enable you to name a giant rocket recovery ship after her.

headline: Ex-Trump adviser Gary Cohn joins IBM as vice chairman
body: Gary Cohn, who quit a top job at Goldman Sachs to join the Trump administration in 2017, is the new vice chairman at tech giant IBM.

headline: Jeff Bezos, Jamie Dimon and Warren Buffett tried to solve health care. 3 years later, their company has shut down
body: Haven, an ambitious health care company formed just three years ago as a partnership between Amazon, Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway and JPMorgan Chase, is shutting down.

headline: Wall Street reverses plan to kick out Chinese telecom companies
body: The New York Stock Exchange has reversed its decision to kick out three of China’s largest state-owned telecom companies.

headline: UK says its aircraft carrier strike group is ready to deploy. China’s already watching
body: Britain is officially an aircraft carrier power again.

headline: Trump directed Pentagon to reverse decision and keep aircraft carrier in Middle East amid Iran tensions
body: President Donald Trump directed acting Secretary of Defense Christopher Miller to reverse course and order a US aircraft carrier to return to the Middle East following a White House meeting Sunday, according to a senior defense official.

headline: Dow falls on first trading day of the year
body: The Dow tumbled on the first trading day of the New Year, as investors grew worried about the pandemic and the economic recovery in 2021. CNN’s Alison Kosik reports.

headline: Dubai plans a sky pod network
Photos: AirlineRatings safest airlines for 2021
body: AirlineRatings.com has named these airlines the safest for travelers in 2021. Click through to see which carriers made the top 20.

headline: Washington orders US aircraft carrier to remain in Middle East amid Iranian threats
body: Days after ordering a United States aircraft carrier out of the Middle East, the country’s acting Secretary of Defense Christopher Miller has reversed that decision, instructing the USS Nimitz to remain in place due to purported Iranian threats “against President Trump and other US government officials.”

headline: US flies B-52 bombers to the Middle East in show of force
body: The US military flew nuclear-capable B-52 bombers to the Middle East Wednesday “to underscore the US military’s commitment to regional security and demonstrate a unique ability to rapidly deploy overwhelming combat power on short notice,” according to a statement from US Central Command, which oversees military operations in the region.

headline: How flying will change in 2021
body: Canceled routes, jumbo jets retired, and smaller planes in the air. The aviation industry has been devastated by the Covid-19 pandemic. So what will it be like to take a flight this winter and spring?

headline: Boeing's 737 Max returns to commercial service
body: Boeing 737 Max has returned to passenger service in the US for the first time since two fatal crashes grounded the jet in March 2019. Brian Sumers, editor-at-large for Skift, on winning over public trust.

headline: Boeing’s troubled 737 Max is back in the air after nearly two years
body: Boeing 737 Max has returned to passenger service in the US this morning for the first time since two fatal crashes grounded the jet in March 2019.

headline: Tesla will start selling cars in India next year, government says
body: Tesla may finally be coming to India. The country’s Minister for Road Transport and Highways, Nitin Gadkari, says that Elon Musk’s electric car company will start selling cars next year.

headline: The 737 Max is about to fly in the US again
body: The Boeing 737 Max is set to carry US passengers for the first time in nearly two years on Tuesday, when American will use the jet on a round-trip route from Miami to New York.

headline: The year the world gave up waiting for Big Tech to fix itself
body: The world’s biggest tech companies faced a global reckoning in 2020 as the United States, the European Union and even China took dramatic steps to curb their dominance. That pressure won’t be going away in the new year.

headline: 12 wild things that happened in aviation in 2020
body: From “flights to nowhere,” to new world records, to the time that Frenchman ejected himself from a fighter jet, there have been some strange and wild moments in aviation in 2020. Here are 12 of them

headline: Boeing 737: How world’s most successful airplane became its most troubled
body: Over 50 years after its maiden flight, the Boeing 737 is both the most successful airliner ever made and one whose future is more uncertain than ever due to two fatal accidents involving 737 MAX 8 variants.

headline: Boeing 737: A photo history of the world’s most successful airplane
China launches antitrust investigation into Alibaba
Passenger deploys emergency exit slide on Delta flight
body: One of two passengers who exited a Delta flight with their dog as the plane taxied onto a runway felt he needed to leave or he would lose control. WCBS’s Tony Aiello reports.

headline: Ahmad Bin Ali Stadium: Qatar 2022's newest arena
body: The Ahmad Bin Ali Stadium is the latest arena to be unveiled for the 2022 FIFA World Cup. Built where the original stood, the new design is described as the “venue that tells the story of Qatar.”

headline: Photos show aircraft in hibernation
How to bring an airplane out of hibernation
body: More and more airplanes are being placed in storage in places like the Australian outback due to the pandemic’s global travel shutdown. But when it’s time to bring them back into service, strict procedures are in place to make sure they’re safe to fly.

headline: Trump's private bankers resign from Deutsche Bank
body: Deutsche Banks says Rosemary Vrablic and Dominic Scalzi, the private bankers responsible for lending to President Donald Trump and Jared Kushner, have resigned. CNN Kara Scannell reports.

headline: Pan Am Boeing 377: The luxury airplane with beds in overhead compartments
body: A Pan Am flight attendant and a historian recall the glory days of the airline’s luxury Boeing 377 Stratocruiser, when fine food and drinks were just the start.

headline: Here's what flying could be like in 2021
body: CNN’s Richard Quest takes you on board United’s first rapid-test Covid-19 flight.

headline: 2020 is when private spaceflight just got started. In 2021 it will shoot for the stars
body: Despite the pandemic, 2020 was a landmark year for the commercial space industry. SpaceX became the first company ever to send humans to space aboard a privately owned spacecraft. The US government continued to work closely with startups and space businesses to put humans back on the Moon. And, helped by governments declaring them “essential businesses” amid the pandemic, a pack of young space companies kept working to create new rockets or satellite services.

headline: Will the bipartisan relief bill prop up the economy?
body: CNN’s Abby Phillip speaks with former Obama chief economist Austan Goolsbee and Kevin Hassett, who held the same job in the Trump administration, about what the relief bill will mean struggling Americans and the economy in the long run.

headline: SpaceX internet competitor OneWeb is back in action after bankruptcy
Tesla is about to become the top S&P 500 stock. It’s not even close
body: When Tesla officially joins the S&P 500 on Monday, Elon Musk’s electric car company will instantly become the top performing stock in the index for 2020.

headline: US bans China’s top chipmaker from using American technology
The Rockefeller Foundation -- founded on oil money -- is dropping fossil fuels
body: The Rockefeller Foundation was founded over 100 years ago using money largely made from Standard Oil. In an exclusive interview with CNN Business’ Matt Egan, the foundation’s current president Dr. Rajiv Shah explains why it’s now dropping all fossil fuel assets.

headline: Drone company competes in Dubai startup challenge
body: Israeli company BeeFree Agro took part in Dubai’s GITEX Supernova Challenge – where startups from around the world compete for $200,000 in prize money.

headline: Cabrera: Según la FIFA, por cada 5 hombres que juegan al fútbol, hay una mujer
body: La fundadora y presidenta de la Asociación Femenina de Fútbol Argentino (AFFA), Evelina Cabrera, describe lo difícil que ha sido ejercer la actividad en un deporte dominado por hombres. En Diálogo con Longobardi reveló una estadística de la FIFA que da cuenta de la disparidad de género en la disciplina.

headline: Spirit Airlines plane slides off taxiway in Baltimore
body: A Spirit Airlines plane skidded off the taxiway at Baltimore/Washington International Thurgood Marshall Airport after a powerful winter storm created slick conditions, HLN’s Robin Meade reports.

headline: Jerome Powell: Wear a mask. It’ll help the economy
body: View more stock market news today.

headline: Computers were too big to fail
body: By 1999 computers had transformed everyday life around the world, but an invisible digital enemy called Y2K threatened to bring it all down. Would the electrical grid collapse? Would planes fall from the sky? The US government responded with a bipartisan effort to prevent the worst from happening.

headline: FULL SHOW 12/16/2020: Federal Reserve, Allbirds and Anthony Scaramucci
body: Danielle DiMartino Booth, CEO and Chief Strategist for Quill Intelligence, talks stocks, stimulus and the Fed. Plus, Allbirds Co-CEO Joey Zwillinger on running a comfy shoe company amid a pandemic. And Anthony Scaramucci weighs in on markets and the future of the GOP.

headline: Bill Gates, Amazon and British Airways are backing a hydrogen plane startup
body: A California-based startup that promises to make zero-carbon flight a reality has just received a major vote of confidence.

headline: See Walmart's self-driving delivery trucks in action
body: Walmart, in partnership with software company Gatik, has announced the launch of two driverless delivery routes in Arkansas and Louisiana. See the autonomous truck here.

headline: Why we started an airline during a pandemic
body: Flyr is a Norwegian start-up airline set to launch in the first half of 2021. The team tells CNN Travel why they are confident they will succeed, despite the current state of the aviation industry.

headline: Chaos at the top of China’s biggest chipmaker
body: The C-suite of one of China’s most important tech companies has just been thrown into confusion.

headline: See Alaska Airlines' Covid-19 'Safety Dance'
body: Alaska Airlines wants you to fly with them – so much so, that they’re willing to dance for you. The airline showed off its Covid-19 safety precautions with a new music video.

headline: 'I've seen 40 doctors': Covid-19 long hauler shares experience
body: Abby Gresko Barclay speaks to CNN’s Alisyn Camerota about her experience as a coronavirus long hauler and shares what it’s like to experience coronavirus symptoms for 9-months, calling it a “nightmare.”

headline: Pfizer CEO explains why he hasn't received a vaccine yet
body: Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla speaks with CNN’s Sanjay Gupta as the company prepares to roll out doses of the Pfizer-BioNTech Covid-19 vaccines in the US.

headline: Video shows man walking on wing of plane before takeoff
body: A man is in custody after climbing onto the winglet of an Alaskan Airlines plane at McCarran International Airport near Las Vegas.

headline: SpaceX Falcon 9 launches and deploys satellite, days after another rocket crashed in Texas
body: SpaceX’s Falcon 9 rocket launched into space Sunday, successfully deploying a satellite for radio provider SiriusXM.

headline: Virgin Galactic unexpectedly aborts test flight of space plane
Emirates president Tim Clark says business travel could bounce back in 2022
body: Few sectors have been hit as hard by the coronavirus pandemic as the aviation industry, but Emirates’ president says there are grounds for optimism.

headline: Watch: Airbnb founder stunned on live TV by stock price
body: Airbnb shares began trading at $146 per share, more than doubling from its IPO price. See CEO Brian Chesky’s reaction to the news.

headline: Space X’s Mars prototype rocket exploded yesterday. Here’s what happened on the flight
Analysis: No profits? No problem for red hot tech IPOs
body: Remember irrational exuberance, the phrase coined by former Federal Reserve chairman Alan Greenspan to describe soaring stocks in the mid-1990s? Welcome to irrational exuberance 2.0. The pops for DoorDash and Airbnb are flat out ridiculous.

headline: Airbnb CEO: People still yearn to travel
body: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky discusses the pandemic’s impact on the travel industry. He also addresses pre-IPO layoffs saying, “we’d welcome people back.”

headline: Corporations pledge to create one million jobs for Black Americans
body: Some of the biggest companies around the world want to hire, train and promote one million jobs for Black Americans over the next ten years. The executive chairman of IBM and the CEO of Merck discuss this commitment with CNN’s Julia Chatterley.

headline: See this SpaceX rocket's fiery crash landing
body: A test flight of SpaceX’s Mars rocket prototype started off well but ended in a crash landing and plumes of smoke.

headline: A SpaceX Mars rocket prototype just exploded. It was still a success
body: A giant experimental rocket built by Elon Musk’s SpaceX successfully soared eight miles above the company’s testing facilities in South Texas on Wednesday and came back down as planned, before crashing into the ground in an enormous plume of flames and smoke.

headline: US stocks pull back after setting records
body: View more stock market news today.

headline: Officials are searching for the pilot of an F-16 military plane that crashed in Michigan
body: A military plane assigned to the Wisconsin Air National Guard crashed in Michigan’s Upper Peninsula, and officials are searching for the lone pilot on board.

headline: Super Guppy: The huge weird airplane built to carry spacecraft
body: Before there was the Beluga XL transporter airplane, there was the Super Guppy, a bizarre-looking NASA airplane resembling a bloated fish that has earned a cult following among planespotters as it blazed a trail in oversized aerial logistics.

headline: SpaceX gets almost $900 million in federal subsidies to deliver broadband to rural America
SpaceX launches more satellites for its internet constellation (2020)
body: SpaceX’s Starlink wants to eventually provide wireless internet to the globe. It operates nearly 1,000 satellites which whiz around Earth at more than 17,000 miles per hour.

headline: Boeing set to deliver first 737 Max since plane’s grounding
body: Boeing is set to deliver a 737 Max to United on Tuesday, the first delivery of the troubled plane since its grounding almost two years ago.

headline: US stocks set another record
body: View more stock market news today.

headline: Tesla, already worth $600 billion, wants to raise another $5 billion in stock
body: Tesla is cashing in on the phenomenal rise of its stock price, announcing plans to sell additional shares worth up to $5 billion.

headline: Look back on the life of Chuck Yeager, the world's first supersonic pilot
body: US Air Force officer and test pilot Chuck Yeager has died at the age of 97. He was the first person to break the sound barrier when he tested the X-1 in October 1947, although the feat was not announced to the public until 1948. CNN’s John Berman looks back at his life.

headline: Brazilian airline GOL will resume Boeing 737 Max passenger flights on Wednesday
body: On Wednesday, Brazilian airline GOL will become the first airline in the world to fly passengers on the Boeing 737 Max in almost two years, the airline announced late Monday.

headline: Warner: 'Stupidity on steroids' if Congress can't pass covid relief
body: Virginia Sen. Mark Warner tells CNN’s Jake Tapper that Congress needs to act on a compromise coronavirus relief bill before the end of the year.

headline: Post-crash recovery: How one airline plans to restore confidence in the Boeing 737 MAX
body: American Airlines will be the first carrier in the world to return the beleaguered but recently FAA re-certified Boeing 737 MAX to the skies. For American, Boeing and the FAA, the stakes – and the scrutiny – couldn’t be higher.

headline: The Boeing 737 MAX is back in the air after fatal crashes (2020)
body: Two deadly crashes in 2018 and 2019 that claimed 346 lives grounded the Boeing 737 MAX. Now, for the first time in 20 months, the jet has been cleared to fly. CNN’s Pete Muntean was aboard an invite-only flight before the plane officially returns to service.

headline: Elon Musk will love this: Tesla short sellers lost more than the US airline industry this year
body: The incredible year for Tesla stock has created a bloodbath for those shorting its shares.

headline: Airline bids farewell to its jumbo jets by inviting fans for a business class lunch
body: ‘Avgeek’ fans of the queen of the skies can book a farewell day on a Virgin Atlantic 747 jumbo jet – complete with a three-hour tour and lunch in Upper Class

headline: Warner Bros. to stream all 2021 films while in theaters
body: HBO Max will stream all of Warner Bros. 2021 films the same day they premiere in movie theaters, the company announced. Warner Bros. and HBO Max share the same parent company, WarnerMedia, which also owns CNN.

headline: Plane crash lands on interstate
body: A single-engine plane made a “suspected emergency landing” on Interstate 35W outside on Minneapolis.

headline: An Alaska Airlines 737-900 has been reconfigured for cargo
body: New “preighter” flights from Alaska Air Cargo are taking off, with a retrofitted 737 flying with freight in the cabin instead of passengers.

headline: Ryanair is buying 75 more 737 Max jets, Boeing’s biggest order since the grounding
body: Ryanair is buying 75 additional 737 Max jets from Boeing, by far the largest order for the troubled plane since it was grounded nearly two years ago.

headline: Ram 1500 TRX named MotorTrend Truck of the Year
body: Fiat Chrysler’s new 702-horsepower Ram 1500 TRX has been named the MotorTrend Truck of the Year.

headline: Elon Musk warns employees Tesla’s stock could ‘get crushed like a soufflé under a sledgehammer’
body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is telling his employees they need to cut costs or they can kiss its lofty stock price goodbye.

headline: CNN looks into how China plans to ship Covid-19 vaccines
body: CNN received exclusive access to infrastructure preparations at Shenzhen Airport in southern China where Alibaba’s logistics and shipping unit, Cainiao, has prepared climate-controlled storage chambers and aircraft cabins to distribute Covid-19 vaccines to parts of the Middle East, Africa and Latin America as soon as China’s Central Government approves them.

headline: Smaller long-haul planes are the future of flying – but also its past
body: On the outside, Boeing 707s are more similar to what we’re flying on today – and will fly on tomorrow – than you might think.

headline: A global airline with no passengers
Nikola shares fall after GM scraps Badger deal and drops equity stake
body: General Motors is giving up its equity stake in Nikola Motors and scrapping plans to build the electric truck maker’s Badger pickup as part of a new, scaled-back deal between the companies.

headline: Delta cancels more than 500 flights this week amid crew shortages
body: A surge in Thanksgiving demand is taxing Delta Air Line’s smaller pandemic-era workforce.  The carrier was forced to cancel hundreds of flights this week, according to its pilot union and the airline.

headline: Boeing needs China to approve the 737 Max. But that won’t end its epic sales drought
body: Boeing is finally close to getting its 737 Max back into the air again in the United States. But the company still faces challenges in the critical aviation market of China, where its business woes go way beyond the troubled aircraft.

headline: These are the best AirPods deals of Black Friday
When will business travel recover?
body: It’s been a gloomy year for the global aviation industry, but Emirates Airlines president Tim Clark says business travel is set for a major rebound.

headline: Global stocks press pause after Wall Street extends its huge rally
body: Stocks in Asia jumped on Wednesday, following Wall Street’s rally that saw the Dow pass the 30,000 milestone for the first time, as investors cheered positive vaccine news and signs that a formal transition of power is finally underway in the United States.

headline: Dow crosses 30,000 mark for the first time ever
body: The dow hit a new all-time high on Tuesday, finally topping the 30,000 mark. NYSE floor trader Peter Tuchman weighs in on the milestone.

headline: ‘Devastating and unrelenting’ Covid-19 crisis will cost airlines $157 billion, says IATA
body: More huge losses are looming for the airline industry as carriers brace for the Covid-19 crisis to extend well into 2021.

headline: Trucking firm wants to shake up cargo deliveries
body: Lori Systems wants to transform logistics, using technology to speed up the movement of cargo in Africa.

headline: Australian PM calls Doha airport incident 'unacceptable' (October 2020)
body: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison responded to an incident at Doha Airport where more than 18 women were subjected to compulsory intimate medical exams after a newborn was found abandoned in a trash can. CNN’s Kristie Lu Stout reports.

headline: British Airways is selling off its in-flight items, from champagne flutes to socks
body: Frustrated frequent fliers pining for those crucial little details of life in the air may be in luck: British Airways is selling off plates, champagne flutes and other items used on its planes.

headline: Alibaba CEO strikes conciliatory tone on China’s plans for tougher tech regulation
body: Alibaba CEO Daniel Zhang has described plans by Chinese regulators to tighten restrictions on internet companies as “timely and necessary.”

headline: CNN10 - 11/23/20
body: Our first of two programs this week covers holiday travel amid coronavirus, the most expensive object ever built, and a show of graduate students’ innovations.

headline: Axios CEO: I'm worried we're going to have 2 Americas
body: Jim VandeHei, CEO and co-founder of Axios, joins CNN’s Brian Stelter to discuss the shifting media landscape as the industry prepares to cover the incoming Biden administration.

headline: What you need to know before you fly on a Boeing 737 MAX
body: Grounded last year due to crashes, Boeing’s 737 MAX is returning to the skies, but passengers may be wary of booking tickets unless they know what they’re getting.

headline: Rudd: There's a 'culture of fear' about Murdoch
body: Fmr. Australian Prime Minister Kevin Rudd on his petition to investigate Rupert Murdoch’s media monopoly and why Trump must act like “a responsible grown up.”

headline: The spoof airline that could actually predict the future of travel
body: Iceland’s new carrier Mom Air offered free seats on every flight, standby tickets and fares subsidized by hotels. It was a spoof, conceived by an artist – but aviation industry insiders say some of his ideas were good

headline: US stocks close lower
body: View more stock market news today.

headline: Boeing’s 737 Max gets approval to fly passengers again
body: The Federal Aviation Administration issued an order Wednesday that paved the way for the troubled Boeing 737 Max to carry passengers again, ending the jet’s 20-month grounding.

headline: GoodRx Co-CEO says Amazon Pharmacy isn't a competitor
body: Amazon expanded its online prescription drug marketplace sending GoodRx’s stock plummeting. But GoodRx’s Co-CEO Doug Hirsch says for now the companies aren’t competitors, they’re partners.

headline: FULL SHOW 11/18/2020: Stocks rise on vaccine optimism
body: BMO Capital Markets’ Brian Belski offers his buying strategy in a market seizing on vaccine optimism. Plus, GoodRx CEO Doug Hirsch on the startup’s new competition from Amazon Pharmacy. And Hedgeye Risk Management’s Darius Dale is back with his firm’s contrarian view of the market.

headline: Vince Reffet, ‘Jetman’ pilot, dies in training accident in Dubai
body: Vince Reffet, a French jetpack pilot who flew for Jetman Dubai, has died in an accident during training.

headline: Delta Air Lines to keep blocking middle seats
body: Delta Air Lines said on Wednesday it will keep middle seats empty on its flights through March, an extension of the social distancing policy it put in place at the start of the pandemic.

headline: Vince Reffet, 'Jetman' pilot, dies in training accident in Dubai
body: Vince Reffet, a jetpack pilot who flew for Jetman Dubai, has died in an accident during training. The incident occurred in Dubai on November 17, according to a statement from the company. He was 36.

headline: Boeing's 737 Max cleared to fly again
body: The Boeing 737 Max, which was grounded in March 2019 after two fatal crashes, gets FAA approval to carry passengers again. CNN’s Richard Quest reports.

headline: Here's how Prop 22 could transform the gig economy
body: Uber, Lyft and DoorDash spent hundreds of millions of dollars on Proposition 22 in California, a controversial ballot measure that prevents gig workers from becoming employees with benefits. CNN’s Jon Sarlin explains what its passing means.

headline: Taiwan grounds entire fleet of US-made F-16 fighter jets after crash
body: Taiwan has grounded its entire fleet of about 140 US-made F-16 fighter jets after one of the planes crashed during a training mission on Tuesday evening.

headline: Aviation expert talks about SpaceX Crew-1's historic mission
body: CNN’s Anderson Cooper and aviation expert Miles O’Brien look ahead to SpaceX’s craft docking with the ISS. Watch Anderson Cooper Full Circle this week Monday - Thursday at 6p E.T.

headline: Businesses with the staying power to survive for more than 100 years
body: A look at five global brands that have been successful for more than a century, in the latest edition of the 100 Club with CNN’s Cyril Vanier.

headline: Boeing’s 737 Max debacle could be the most expensive corporate blunder ever
body: The 20-month grounding of the 737 Max could end as soon as this week, but Boeing’s mounting costs have soared to tens of billions of dollars. That means the plane maker’s repeated safety oversights and mismanagement were not only tragic but also rank among the expensive corporate mistakes in history.

headline: Aviation expert talks about the future of space tourism
body: CNN’s Anderson Cooper and aviation expert Miles O’Brien talk about about the future of space tourism. Watch “Full Circle” Monday - Thursday this week at 6p E.T.

headline: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway makes big bets on drug stocks
body: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway is making a big bet on the health care sector at a time when the Covid-19 pandemic continues to be a major crisis in the United States.

headline: Virgin Galactic delays key test flight after pandemic causes shutdowns
body: Virgin Galactic said Monday that it no longer plans to conduct a key test flight of its spacecraft this week because of a surge in new Covid-19 cases and resulting related restrictions in New Mexico, home to the company’s glitzy spaceport.

headline: 'A lot of firsts on this flight': NASA and SpaceX shoot for history
body: NASA and SpaceX have teamed up to send a diverse group of four astronauts to the International Space Station. CNN’s Rachel Crane reports.

headline: 'A lot of firsts on this flight': NASA and SpaceX shoot for history
body: NASA and SpaceX have teamed up to send a diverse group of four astronauts to the International Space Station. CNN’s Rachel Crane reports.

headline: What the 737 MAX’s return to the sky will mean for passengers
body: Would you fly on the Boeing 737 MAX? That question is going to become all too real for passengers in the near future when the aircraft that’s been grounded for some 600 days after two deadly crashes returns to service.

headline: Scale model of futuristic plane makes successful maiden flight
body: Researchers in the Netherlands ​say they have conducted a successful maiden flight of a scale model of the Flying-V, a plane that could one day carry passengers in its wings.

headline: This Swedish car carrier will be the world's largest wind-powered vessel
body: Shipbuilders Wallenius Marine have designed a transatlantic car carrier that cuts carbon emissions by 90%, compared to standard car carriers.

headline: See Fed chairman's warning about the economy
body: Chairman of the Federal Reserve Jerome Powell warns that the Covid-19 pandemic has changed the economy.

headline: Boeing issues surprisingly upbeat outlook for Chinese aircraft demand
body: Global demand for new aircraft is likely to be hurt for decades because of the Covid-19 pandemic. Yet Boeing just increased its industrywide Chinese sales forecast for the next 20 years – above where that estimate stood in pre-pandemic times.

headline: $250 billion wiped off Chinese tech stocks as Beijing signals crackdown
body: Fears that Beijing could tighten the screw on China’s biggest tech companies have wiped hundreds of billions of dollars off their stock market value in just two days.

headline: Stocks will soar in Joe Biden’s first year in office, Goldman Sachs predicts
body: Stocks will soar in Joe Biden’s first year in office, Goldman Sachs predicts. View more stock market news today.

headline: Pfizer’s CEO sold $5.6 million in stock the day he announced promising vaccine news
body: Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla filed to sell millions of dollars of his company’s stock Monday – the day the pharmaceutical giant announced positive data about its coronavirus vaccine.

headline: It’s a big day for Alibaba. You wouldn’t know from its stock
body: Chinese consumers are flexing their muscles after a difficult start to the year. That’s good news for e-commerce giant Alibaba, which has been in hot water.

headline: Chinese government halts Ant Group's giant IPO

body: Two Russian aircraft made an “unsafe, unprofessional” intercept of a US Air Force B-52 bomber over the Black Sea and in international waters, according to a statement from US Air Forces in Europe and Air Forces Africa Public Affairs. CNN’s Barbara Starr reports.

headline: Married Delta pilots retire early after decades of service

headline: This couple has the best office view in the world

headline: A Delta IV Heavy rocket launch was scrubbed just seconds before liftoff

headline: The tennis grand slam that will be like nothing ever seen before
body: The 2020 US Open in New York will be unlike you’ve ever seen before and it’s all because of the coronavirus. Big names missing, no fans, a bubble for the tournament - it’s all uncharted territory for tennis.

headline: Ryanair passenger removed from flight after getting Covid-19 results
body: Authorities in hazmat suits escorted the passenger from a Ryanair plane, which was headed from Stansted Airport in the UK to Pisa, Italy.

headline: Long-awaited Celera 500L ‘bullet’ plane is finally revealed

body: What do you miss most about traveling? If you answered “being stuck on a plane with crying babies and flight delays,” then this is the game for you.

body: The Dow Jones Industrial Average is getting a massive shakeup to balance out the disruption from Apple’s stock split. CNN’s Matt Egan explains why Exxon is out and Salesforce is in.

headline: Exxon was the world’s largest company in 2013. Now it’s being kicked out of the Dow
body: For decades, ExxonMobil was an unstoppable machine. It made gobs of money, spent that cash wisely and rewarded shareholders lavishly.

headline: The pandemic’s financial impact on airlines will be worse than the 9/11 attacks
body: Covid-19 will impact the US airline industry even more than the terrorist attacks on September 11th. Planes have been grounded and the financial impacts of the pandemic will change the industry and air travel for the foreseeable future.

headline: Why hardware stores might be the future of fashion
body: New York Fashion Week is going to have an unexpected participant this September: Lowe’s. Yup, the hardware store.

headline: Delta Air Lines to furlough nearly 2,000 pilots in October
body: Delta Air Lines is planning to furlough 1,941 pilots in October as the airline industry struggles to rebound from coronavirus-related fallout.

headline: China’s Xpeng Motors plans to raise $1.1 billion in New York IPO
body: Xpeng Motors, a Chinese electric automaker backed by Alibaba, is heading to the New York Stock Exchange, where it hopes to raise up to $1.1 billion — even as relations between Beijing and Washington continue to worsen.

headline: Kushner says Israel-UAE deal ‘should increase the probability’ that UAE gets F-35 jets
body: Jared Kushner suggested Sunday in an interview with CNN’s Fareed Zakaria that the recent peace agreement between Israel and the United Arab Emirates “should increase the probability” of an F-35 jet sale to the UAE.

headline: Tesla has soared 50% since announcing its stock split — last week
body: Tesla is getting ready to split its stock to make it more affordable for average investors. It may need to do another one pretty soon. Tesla has skyrocketed nearly 50% since announcing the stock split on August 11 and now trades above $2,000 a share.

headline: American Airlines suspends service to 15 cities
body: American Airlines will temporarily stop flying routes to 15 small cities across the United States in October, as the coronavirus pandemic continues to devastate the travel industry.

headline: Kushner’s secret push to sell F-35 jets to UAE causes frustration among US agencies and lawmakers
body: A secret push by President Donald Trump’s senior adviser Jared Kushner to sell advanced arms – including F-35 stealth fighter jets – to the United Arab Emirates has caused confusion and frustration among agencies and congressional committees that would normally be involved in such a sale but have been left in the dark.

headline: Tech’s magnificent seven are worth $7.7 trillion
body: Tech titans dominate the market. The industry’s Fab 5 – Apple, Amazon, Microsoft, Google owner Alphabet and Facebook – are worth more than $7 trillion. Add Tesla and Netflix to the list and this septet is valued at a combined $7.67 trillion.

headline: Alibaba sales soar but US crackdown may be looming
body: China’s economy has bounced back from the Covid-19 outbreak in China’s Wuhan province. That’s great news for Alibaba, the e-commerce and cloud giant. But the company also acknowledged the threat of being caught up in the burgeoning trade war between the United States and China.

headline: US stocks finish the day in the red
body: Here’s what’s moving markets today.

headline: Boeing wins first order this year for 737 Max planes
body: Boeing has secured its first order for the troubled 737 Max in nine months.

headline: Australia’s Qantas says international flights ‘unlikely’ to resume before July 2021
body: Australian carrier Qantas Airways announced Thursday that it’s “unlikely” to resume international flights before July 2021, as it suffers heavy losses due to the coronavirus pandemic.

headline: SpaceX is now a $46 billion ‘unicorn’
body: SpaceX, the Elon Musk-led company that recently became the first business in history to send astronauts into Earth’s orbit, is parlaying its successes into big money.

headline: Has Covid-19 spawned a new generation of runners?
body: CEO Jim Weber of Brooks Running says that despite terrible performance in April, Brooks’ sales are up 37% for the year.

headline: FedEx cargo jet makes predawn emergency landing in Los Angeles
body: Sparks erupted from the bottom of a FedEx cargo jet as it made a predawn emergency landing Wednesday at Los Angeles International Airport, officials said.

headline: Welcome to Aviation High School
body: At the Aviation Career and Technical High School, students literally have to earn their wings. Everyday, students take classes in an airplane hangar and work on real aircrafts. The New York City public high school has been training students since the 1930s, and it certifies the most airplane mechanics in the country. Advanced students spend their days at JFK Airport working on their own 727s. From the classroom to the sky, this school is pretty fly.

headline: How Covid-19 is transforming grocery e-commerce in Dubai
body: A surge in demand for fresh produce delivery during the pandemic means business is booming for Dubai startup Farmbox.

headline: Boeing plans more job cuts on top of 16,000 announced this spring
body: Boeing is planning another round of job cuts on top of the 16,000 positions it previously announced it would eliminate.

headline: In 2010, Elon Musk had big plans for Tesla. Listen to his predictions
body: In June of 2010, Elon Musk was preparing to take Tesla public. Ten years later, Tesla has become the most valuable car company in the world. Here’s what he told CNN about the future of the company on the day of Tesla’s IPO.

headline: US finalizes sale of 66 F-16 fighters to Taiwan as China tensions escalate
body: Taiwan will receive 66 new American-made F-16 fighter jets in the biggest arms sale to the self-governing island in years.

headline: Ryanair and EasyJet show the travel industry is still in deep trouble

headline: See Ram's 702hp pickup that's taking on the Ford Raptor

headline: CNN Business Exclusive: 109 year-old IBM is planning to take on Amazon. Here’s how
body: When former IBM cloud leader Arvind Krishna took over the company’s top job earlier this year, the move sent a clear signal about where the company sees its future.

headline: Emirates and Siemens promise to help Lebanon with an airlift and free power

headline: Pilot: 'Nothing's normal about flying anymore'
body: Airline pilots and flight attendants speak out on the challenge of enforcing mask regulations

headline: 5 ways Covid-19 will challenge airlines for years
body: Based on our most recent analysis, the aviation industry is unlikely to even begin to recover until later in 2022 at the earliest — and even then, it will be in domestic travel only.

headline: After TikTok and WeChat, Alibaba could be the next target in Trump’s tech war
body: The United States has taken aim at some of China’s biggest tech champions, from Huawei and ByteDance’s TikTok to Tencent’s WeChat. Alibaba, one of the world’s largest retail and internet conglomerates, could be next.

headline: Southwest Airlines CEO: We still don't have enough testing
body: Southwest Airlines Chairman and CEO Gary Kelly talks with CNN’s Poppy Harlow about the need for more testing to combat Covid-19.

headline: As tensions rise in Asia Pacific, South Korea is building its first aircraft carrier … complete with US-made fighter jets
body: South Korea plans to start building its first aircraft carrier next year, and acquire fighter jets to operate on it, the country’s Defense Ministry has announced.

headline: Boeing loses more jet orders

headline: Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway earnings jumped 87% as it recovers from the pandemic
body: Berkshire Hathaway is recovering from a rough start to a year in which it was hard hit by the coronavirus. Its second quarter earnings, released Saturday morning, were up almost 87% from last year, and a big turnaround from its huge first quarter loss.

headline: Air India plane crashes in Kerala after skidding off the runway

headline: Deadly plane crash in India
