headline: SpaceX and ULA win military launch competition worth $653 million – and that’s just the start
body: Elon Musk’s SpaceX and Boeing-Lockheed Martin joint venture United Launch Alliance are the big winners in a stiff competition to secure military launch contracts, teeing up the companies to dominate the lucrative market for launching US national security satellites for years to come.

headline: Plane overshoots runway and crashes in southern India
body: An Air India Express flight skidded off the runway at Kozhikode Calicut International Airport, officials said.

headline: Delta CEO: Our goal is to restore confidence in air travel
body: Ed Bastian, CEO of Delta, details what the airline is doing to ensure safety on their planes. Measures include leaving seats open, testing air quality, and enforcing masks.

headline: Microsoft Flight Simulator’s 2020 reboot may be the safest way to fly this year

headline: No, this isn't a flying grain silo. It's SpaceX's Starship prototype
body: Watch SpaceX’s Starship SN5 perform a hop test in Boca Chica, Texas. SpaceX CEO Elon Musk says it will one day transport humans to Mars.

headline: A Cosori air fryer is on sale at Amazon for one day only

headline: Qatar is coming to the rescue of British Airways and Iberia

headline: Four tech titans go before Congress

headline: CNN10 - 7/29/20
body: The U.S. Congress debates two new stimulus bills, research indicates that the coronavirus has mutated, and incoming college freshmen discuss their concerns.

headline: Virgin Galactic’s rocket plane will use 16 cameras to capture space tourists’ every move
body: When Virgin Galactic’s tourism customers take their quarter-million dollar ride to the edge of space, they’ll strap themselves into custom-made reclining seats and blast into the upper atmosphere before spending a few minutes floating in microgravity — all while an on-board camera system captures their next social media posts.

body: More than 60 years after its first flight, the X-15 is still the quickest manned aircraft of all time.

headline: Berman on Trump's false Yankees opening pitch claim: Just crazy

body: Here’s what’s moving markets today.

headline: Taiwan’s parliament approves proposal to rename China Airlines
body: Renaming a company is always going to be a complicated undertaking, but rarely does it hit the levels of controversy currently swirling around China Airlines, Taiwan’s largest air carrier.

headline: How to paint an airplane

headline: Here's why it costs $100,000 to paint an airplane
body: Most airplanes start out beige or green before they go through a two-week process involving decals, paint and stenciling in dedicated facilities.

headline: Company shuns Wall Street IPO amid US-China tensions
body: One of China’s biggest tech firms Ant Group announced that it has chosen Hong Kong and Shanghai for its blockbuster IPO, shunning Wall Street where Chinese companies are facing heightened scrutiny because of rising geopolitical tensions. CNN’s Sherisse Pham reports.

headline: The AN-225: How the Cold War created the world’s largest airplane

headline: SpaceX reuses rocket from historic astronaut mission to launch satellite

headline: Queen of the skies: The Boeing 747 is playing a hero’s role during Covid-19 crisis
body: Now that the international transport of critical medical goods has become a daily news headline, cargo operators are the stars of the logistical efforts to support first responders. And they’re all flying the Boeing 747F – that’s “F” for Freighter.

body: Fahim Saleh, CEO of Gokada, Nigeria’s motorcycle ride-hail company, was found dismembered in a luxury New York condo. His executive assistant has been charged with murder, according to police.

body: A new American Airlines and JetBlue partnership will allow the airlines to sell seats on each other’s flights and share frequent flyer benefits.

body: Analog has just become a significantly bigger player in the semiconductor space — and could be instrumental in the race for 5G.

headline: Delta CEO on diversity: I have a responsibility to do better

body: India’s richest man isn’t done with his fundraising spree just yet.

body: The airline says it is following the guidance of local health care officials and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

body: Japan has announced plans to build one of the world’s most sophisticated stealth jet fighters, likely a twin-engine aircraft designed to take over the country’s critical air defense role sometime in the next decade.

headline: Boom supersonic jet set for 2021 take off
US stocks struggle to bounce back with the economic rebound in jeopardy: July 8, 2020
body: Here’s what’s moving markets today.

headline: Nikola CEO explains the competition with Tesla
body: Nikola CEO Trevor Milton explains what makes his company different from Elon Musk’s Tesla and why he believes hydrogen fuel cells are important for long-haul trucking.

headline: Don’t expect to fly on a Boeing 737 Max anytime soon
body: More than 15 months after its best-selling plane was grounded, Boeing is finally close to getting approval to fly passengers on the 737 Max again.

headline: A380’s seats pulled out for Covid-19 missions
body: Portuguese airline Hi Fly has stripped all economy seats from its A380, the world’s biggest passenger jet, to create a temporary auxilary freighter.

headline: An A380 is transformed into a cargo plane
China is investing billions in chipmaking to close the gap with its global rivals
body: China’s largest semiconductor maker could raise as much as $7.5 billion this year by listing its stock in Shanghai — a move that could deliver the Chinese mainland its largest share sale in a decade, and reduce the country’s reliance on foreign chips.

headline: Amazon shares just hit an all-time high
body: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos, already the world’s richest man, has even more to celebrate. Amazon shares topped the $3,000 mark for the first time ever Monday as tech stocks continued to soar.

headline: Who sells short shorts? Elon Musk sells short shorts
body: Tesla is having a great year. Its stock is up 200% in 2020, its market value now exceeds every other carmaker on the planet, as well as Disney and Coke. CEO Elon Musk may truly have proved Tesla’s haters wrong.

headline: Here’s a sign Warren Buffett may have gotten his mojo back
body: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway finally put some cash to work with its purchase of natural gas assets from Dominion Energy. The deal could spark a broader turnaround for the Oracle of Omaha.

headline: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway buying natural gas assets
body: Berkshire Hathaway is purchasing natural gas transmission and storage assets from Dominion Energy in a deal worth nearly $10 billion.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway will buy natural gas assets from Dominion Energy in $10 billion deal
body: In its first deal since the economic downturn caused by coronavirus, Berkshire Hathaway is purchasing natural gas transmission and storage assets from Dominion Energy in a deal worth nearly $10 billion.

headline: Time could be running out for the 747
body: The 747 is perhaps the most popular plane in Boeing’s history. But the embattled aircraft maker could be getting close to finally pulling the plug on the once groundbreaking jumbo jet with the distinctive second-floor bulge.

headline: US Senator blasts American Airlines for packing the middle seats on his flight
body: A United States Senator said he would introduce a bill to ban the sale of middle seats during this coronavirus pandemic, one day after he criticized American Airlines for selling the middle seats of a flight he had boarded, calling it “incredibly irresponsible” and warning it was contributing to the spread of the disease.

headline: Tesla stock topped $1,200. Here’s how it could hit $2,000
body: Tesla’s stock soared 26% during the holiday-shortened week, topping $1,000, $1,100 and $1,200 in the process. Tesla is now worth more than most blue chip firms in the S&P 500.

headline: See the Dodge Durango SRT Hellcat with 6 seats and 710 horsepower
body: According to Fiat Chrysler, its Dodge Durango Hellcat is the most powerful production SUV ever made.

headline: American among airlines set to receive cash infusion from US government
body: American Airlines and four other carriers are set to receive an infusion of cash from the government, the Treasury Department announced Thursday.

headline: Tesla is now worth more than Toyota, Disney and Coke

headline: Damning watchdog report says Boeing shielded key 737 Max details from FAA

headline: Willy T. Ribbs, motorsport's Black pioneer

headline: Middle seats and packed planes are coming back as airlines prepare to ease restrictions

headline: Airlines are trading passengers for packages. That hasn’t made shipping any cheaper

Even as some areas of the world loosen Covid-19 related travel restrictions, and airlines slowly ramp up passenger services, airlines such as United and Delta are still flying dozens of planes each week with goods stuffed into overhead bins, while all of the seats sit empty.

The working theory is based on continuing analysis of data from satellites, radar and electronic data collected routinely by US military and intelligence. All 176 people on board the Boeing 737 were killed.
